1hBarPnydkjw4VjSc0qOjA.text: The donuts were okay...not fantastic.  However the girls were very nice and gave us some free donuts!

HdAsnYkvIE_7eJazoLPGng.text: We came here around 1:30pm on a Sunday and they were closing up and wanted to get rid of the last couple of donuts they had. We had 2 options: BOGO or one box for $10. The box deal was so much more worth it so we ended up getting 16 donuts for $10!!! WHAT A STEAL. Plus if you check in on Yelp you can get either a free Americano or drip coffee. #win  Blueberry Lemon - Just okay, but I liked how it wasn't as sweet as I thought it would be.  Strawberry Split - Meh. I wouldn't get this again. The donut was just cinnamon and dry (probably because it had been sitting out all day) and the whipped cream inside was dry and tasted like it came from a can. The strawberries were also very plain and it would've been better if they were glazed.  Creme Brulee - My favorite out of everything I tried. The crunchy glaze on top was cool, and I love filled donuts. After eating half though, the cream inside started tasting artificial like cheap cake frosting so I had to come back to it.  Buttermilk Bar - I really liked the consistency of this! Moist and cake-like on the inside and nice and crunchy on the outside.  The other donuts look bomb so I'm definitely going to come try some other flavors. I agree that I've had better donuts elsewhere, but this location just opened 3 months ago so maybe their quality will go up. Street parking was easy to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Split $4
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Came before closing and got a box for $10!! As many donuts as you can fit ;)

LEA9DJ-_r26c2ww06-QxUA.text: The donuts and coffee were ok but my wife really liked the French toast donut. More tables outside in the back but inside is limited in space. -1 Star: During our visit there was guy that appeared to know an employee or maybe the owner and he was blocking the counter like he owned the place. Maybe he was the owner but it was still annoying.

HtsCmPvpbOE7vtbQ_gdkLQ.text: A nice, small, quiet place not far from the craziness of Fremont Street.  I like they way they do business: open at 7 am (8 on the weekends) and close when they sell out--which seems to happen before noon.  That way the doughnuts are assuredly fresh.  The service was genuinely friendly.  The doughnuts were very good, but nothing too exciting.

QhlP3KDpkNFUunxsqpHzEQ.text: I always wanted to go here and after a year I finally got to try it! The donuts are very sweet and huge!! You get the price for the looks.. however the creme brulee wasn't what I thought it would be, but it was still sweet and delicious! The pop tart donut actually has pop tart in it! It was super sweet, so prepare for your sweet tooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée and Nutella overload

Ye5G07JBcmFDnJHuWMy14g.text: Day after doughnuts from here are not good. They do not hold up. Pinkbox is forever my favorite!

kPdySKsuHqfN3STLonjsvw.text: I always make it a must do every time I come to Vegas to stop by here. There's so many different things on the menu I want to try. Creme brule donut is a must! I decided this time I would try the French toast to share with my husband. SO MUCH REGRET....agreeing to share with him... one bite and I wanted it all to myself ! LOLOLOLOL.

dLVgDD_gojxZlivKsXyDOA.text: When you walk into Donut Bar you are a little overwhelmed with all the different donut choices. It's super hard to pick just 1 or 2. I tried a few different donuts and I have to admit I was a little disappointed with the taste. I think the presentation of the donut out weighs the taste. I expected more flavor. For example one of the donuts I tried was the snickers donut. Now that sounds like it should be wonderful however I didn't taste any hint of snickers flavor, it just tasted like a chocolate donut and a little dry too.  The staff was super friendly and helpful explaining the different flavors. But honestly if I lived in Vegas I don't know if I'd stop here again.

ifs-mXLJEPoKfM1od6AN7g.text: Not enough time right now for a verbose review...but just know that these donuts are AWESOME!  Definitely try a creme brulee donut and a big poppa tart!! So many choices!! Everything that I bought today was really yummy.  Around the corner on 6th street there's a 3 space, 15 minute, free parking area. Use those spaces unless you're ready to pay for street parking downtown.

67_uRCBthrAFzZEGKjx7ng.text: I'm from Portland,Or and we have Voodoo Donuts. Donut Bars donuts are creative, great tasting, and a new must when visiting Vegas!

rcyOA-HEZGC2x6TcUhayaQ.text: Pretty sure this donut changed my life - for the much better. I LOVE these - Mexican hot chocolate is my favorite, I don't know why it's better than the regular chocolate or the Nutella, but for me it is the best. Blood orange is good, really liked the blueberry lemon, and bc I am a health nut - the Cadbury egg inside the Easter donut.  Actually scratch all this - the Homer is the best. And the fritter. Damn, just order a dozen and wear your sweats, these donuts are amazing.  I got these for my last birthday instead of a cake.  Sent my friend down to get the Easter donuts. Came for Mother's Day... you get the picture. The location is great, you can go to the vintage stores on Main Street or walk Fremont. They have a garden, a donut aquarium, cute art on the walls, nice staff, Chef Jeff is usually there, OH, and banging coffee.   Ok one thing - they bake their masterpieces in the AM and close the store when they sell out. Run don't walk to Donut Bar, as their selection winds down as it gets closer to closing - around lunchtime

4Nq9w5FJpqtxF59-FZhz8Q.text: Was in the area for a jury summons and decided to give this place a try. It's a cool little donut/coffee bar and the selection is on point. Me and my GF shared a Mexican Hot Chocolate, Strawberry Big Poppa Tart and the Creme Brulee. We both agreed that the Creme Brulee had more flavor to it and much more filling. This is one of those occasions where bigger isn't necessarily better.  We both felt that the other 2 looked more appealing but were mostly bread. I would probably go back and try the Brad Fritter w/Bacon (was told it was Brad Pitt's favorite), Blueberry Cheesecake and the Nutella Filled powder donut. The donuts were all fresh, as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dipe531nMnW42bgqzB0yVw.text: We got here at noon also, and also found there to be no line.  We were excited to try it, and pleasantly surprised that they had several vegan donut choices.  And it was buy one get one free, so we were out of there for under $4.  The donuts were very very sweet.  I know donuts are supposed to be sugary but this took it to a new level.  My teeth hurt a little, so I picked the fruit off of the top and threw the rest away.  My husband said that he had to do the same with his.   That said, we did arrive late so we had slim pickings.  Perhaps if we got there earlier, we would have had more choices?

WYVyU_f2cdE-xWDl0zHr7g.text: A cute little spot in dtlv...   Very friendly folks behind the counter. Bright and airy. A great display for the donuts.  We ordered the Homer. (My other half is a The Simpsons superfan.) And the Snickers donut.   The Homer was delicious, soft, moist and really. Yeah. I'll say it. A happy party in my mouth. I would eat it again and again! That was a very well made and thought out donut. Brightly colored, cute sprinkles. Large in size. Easily a donut for two.   The Snickers donut was a bit of a disappointment. It was dry and lacking. The dough didn't seem like it held up as well, possibly because it was chocolate? It was quite unsatisfying. In fact, it went unfinished.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Homer and Snickers donuts.

r5kpD-nMspe5Fp-FEohdjw.text: I've been trying to make it here for years and today it finally happened! We arrived at 10 a.m and they still had plenty of delicious choices to choose from. We chose the famous Creme Brulee donut and a Harry Potter ButterBeer donut. Both were great, the ButterBeer donut was HUGE, I had to share it with my husband. Customer service was friendly and answered all our questions. Can't wait to come back next time we are in Las Vegas

0G9BucPNy2zcHgiuwKZWIQ.text: Five words - CHURRO DONUT ICE CREAM CONE!!! Seriously the best thing in Vegas especially on a hot summer day. But you have to go early bc they run out of their yummy goods so fast!  So besides this delicious cone, we also got a few regular donuts. But of course these are far from "regular"! We ordered the oh-my-bday-cake-Oreo, blueberry cheesecake, blueberry with Meyer lemon, toasted coconut, birthday cake, and chocolate twix. My favorite (besides the donut cone with the vanilla soft serve AND chocolate sauce over the top) was the coconut and blueberry cheesecake. They were all good but seriously, I could not get over that darn churro cone! WITH SOFT SERVE! MY FAVORITE! I love soft serve ice cream! And to put it in a churro donut cone is freaking geeeenius!   We went back a few days a later but went too late! I seriously almost cried when I saw the sold out on the window!!   This is a DEFINITE stop if you're just visiting Vegas or if you live in Vegas. But go early, they run out of everything pretty darn fast, by lunch time, you're gonna be outta luck! Def worth it to wake up early and get that donuts and ice cream!!

zptZQz04_8jnj7hu1GHJtQ.text: I love to order donuts in the morning when I don't feel like getting out of bed! Never messes up an order!

Fa84Y0JFLlEKnx0RPZf63w.text: HOLY MOLY the vegan creme brulee donut was the best thing sweet treat that's hit my mouth this week. I had their Hawaiian hazelnut drip coffee with almond milk and it was the best combo with my donut.  This place sells out incredibly fast, so come first thing in the morning!!

SmUg_MJ1iaMkTEhdZcnj3Q.text: Came from Cali to celebrate my husband birthday and all he kept talking about was going to the donut bar. Well when get there they have a board on the wall with all the donuts for the day.(they all sound amazing) but when it was time to order my husband wanted the Homer donut and big poppa tart and our friends wanted a couple of other donuts that was on this " list " and the lady behind the counter said their all sold out and aren't making any more and it was only a hour after they opened so we found that very strange and upsetting.. they only had 7 donuts out of a whole damn list!! My husband was very disappointed. It seems like the only way you can get a donut on this so called list is being there when the works clock in for their shift in the early a.m.

P65eBunoMqOIRnUxWz066Q.text: This place is a must!! It's on a side street but def the visit... the donuts are fresh & I am embarrassed to say I ate the damn apple fritter three days latter & it was SLAMMING  absolutely delicious. Purchased a box of goodies for $10 oh yeah  anything toy can fit in the box for $10.. amazingly yummy

UEg3mORc0lcGk-1AkdvPVQ.text: THE BEST DONUTS I'VE EVER HAD!!!  I'm a sucker for raised donuts and their raised donuts are THE BOMB!! There's one close to home but I can never get myself to drive there before the donuts sell out. Thus, since I'm a donut fiend I made it a mission to come here since I was staying on the strip. I absolutely loved the caramel latte donut, it was my favorite. The French toast donut was made to order and it was so fluffy and good. I also got the mud pie and Creme brulee donut and they were amazing as well. I wish I got to try all of the donuts but that would be too much for a small girl like me haha. I couldn't believe that their strawberry split was vegan and it was huge!! I came with my cousin's gf and sister and they're vegans and they couldn't believe it either. We were all in heaven and were in awe the whole time. The prices aren't bad either considering the amount of dough you're getting! I need to come back here whether in SD of LV to try the other flavors and come back for the caramel latte donut.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Ff0jGtWSGFaRisLJO-NMA.text: Tons of flavors to choose from! My favorites were probably the creme brulee! The outer crust of the donut was nice and hard just like the top of creme brulee! Some other good ones we had were Boston cream, very chocolate, and the apple bacon fritter. They had a steady flow of traffic coming through the doors. The staff was super friendly, patient, and helpful. They also serve coffee. I had an Americano. It was light years ahead of anything I've had from Starbucks. Overall wonderful and pleasant experience.

wrxu31RaGFRWdCtcd4pqLQ.text: Went here yesterday morning because of all the raves. They supposedly had the best doughnuts in the world.  We had the coconut, blueberry cheesecake, creme brulee and birthday cake oreo doughnuts. First of all they were all very dry. My daughter hated the birthday cake oreo doughnut, she said it was overly sweet, even when I took out the oreo it was still very sweet. We also ordered their strawberry milk and chocolate milk. They tasted like regular milk. Going there was a mistake. About 2 hours later my daughter started getting sick, my daughter is still suffering until now. I'll take Krispy Kreme over this place anytime.

jDlL3cx-5MmUIKsqvaTwyA.text: HOLY VEGAN MOLY, YOU GUYS!   FOOD: It's donuts, how special are donuts, right? WRONG. These guys do it big and I mean, BIG. The flavors are unique and tasty and each donut is easily the size of two. Did I mention they have a bunch of vegan donuts too (not just the plain, boring flavors)? Couldn't even tell the difference (being vegan, doesn't make me biased, I swear!).   SERVICE: Best service. Everyone was nice and was happy to chat us up. I was with my sister and it turns out two brothers were working there together. NEAT! Also, my sister didn't like the coffee drink she got so a nice woman came over to make it different so my sister could enjoy it. No extra charge and she was totally understanding.   PRICE: Who cares? Worth every penny!  OVERALL: Like I said to VegeNation a couple blocks over: I love you guys, come to LA?

2-mTuRPuL2lJ6R0ZdQqg4A.text: I finally had a chance to go here, mainly because my tattoo artist in conveniently next door ;) i didnt realize at the time but i was quite lucky to go in without having to wait in a long line that stretches around the building. Also, i was lucky enough to get donuts because, from what ive heard, they sell out frequently.   I had a decent selection to choose from for it being midday. (One of the guys told me theres usually much more to choose from but they all sold out) i got the strawberry cheescake, peanut butter something, the elvis and an original. It was a "meh" for the original. The elvis was delectable, banana cream with caramel. The peanut butter was a little dry. As for the cheesecake, i cant comment because i ate it the next day.  Will definitely be going back again, mainly to try the churro-looking donut cone they have. Also, the staff was very friendly.

Ac7yNChvDkpgkEZGPYrsIQ.text: My friends and I walked here for breakfast one morning and we were impressed.  The donuts were good and the selection was awesome.  A little overpriced but the donut bar is a great idea.  People were friendly although I will say by 9am they are out of most of the selections.  We will be back!

OB58rKuvMO9B0YKTu_nfJg.text: Donuts were great, I suggest the French Toast Donut.. Honestly it's the best of both worlds.. Won't find anything else like it.. definitely a must have if you're near Fremont Street.

lWjxf1o9D3wx2JWh_91OLA.text: I had been to the Donut bar in San Diego when I was in town for a conference. When I was planning my Vegas trip, I found out that there was a donut bar and it was immediately on my "must eat" list.  We were driving down from Vegas to LA the day we visited so we bought lots of donuts for the ride and every one of them was amazing! I really wish we had one close by!

4wBKHhjlDFOos9iRdITESw.text: Family friendly! The staff was super friendly, and we didn't feel rushed to make the big decision of what amazing donut we wanted. Did you know they give free donuts and balloons to kids on Saturday mornings?! So cool. The donuts were delicious, but my 2.5 year old enjoyed the fish tank of donuts most of all! They also let someone bring their dog in which he loved too.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy donut fish tank!

tyMEn2w1UbZTYfJjqicQtg.text: I woke up this morning... 7 AM... because I was going to go try The Donut Bar. There was so much hype about this place from USA today to the food network to Ellen. I was energized and ready to go! I got there at 7:50 in the morning and it was easy to find parking. There was already a line of at least 40 people ahead of me who were also waiting for a shop that was about to open at 8 AM. The wait time to get in once the shop opens at 8 AM was 30 minutes in line outside. Luckily, it was a pleasant day.  As I approached the inside of the store, I was surprised to see that I wasn't all that excited. I saw many very large looking donuts with hard tacky frosting that weren't at all appealing. The oversized amount made them less appealing rather than to appear yummy. The smaller donuts looked good and, by smaller, I mean normal size like Dunkin' Donuts regular donuts.  The service was just OK. Whoever chose to run this place really doesn't seem to understand what the best environment for customer service is. It was glaring super loud music over the speakers where I could barely hear the person helping me and I'm not sure if they could hear me. I had to order several donuts for a party and thought this is a good place to try because it gets so much publicity so it has to be good. I decided to put my instincts aside because so many people were waiting in front of me and behind me to get into this place and it has gotten all these reviews. As I ordered, after two dozen donuts, the server just went off to help somebody else without even asking me if I was finished with my order. I couldn't believe it! I was very friendly during the whole interaction which is why this shocked me. I did not bother calling her back because I am not confrontational and simply will let something like this go, but won't let it go during a review.  The donuts range from two dollars that are very small to some pastries that are upwards of four dollars. I ordered several donuts including the Twix, Samoa, blueberry with lemon, chai, Nutella, Red velvet, and the creme brulee. Here is what I have to say: firstly, you have to eat these donuts the day of because they are not as good the next day. With that being said, most of the donuts were not that impressive to begin with. They were just ok or disappointing. In fact, the creme brulee donut, which gets all of this amazing hype, was one of the worst ones of the bunch. The hard sugar/Caramel crust on top of the donut was so burnt that it carried a foul aftertaste. The donut itself had a yummy creme brulee center within the dough. The topping of the crunchy burnt sugar/Caramel ruined it. I also did not like that many of the donuts were grossly over sized with a great deal of tacky frosting on it which was glazed and dried off. I did order a couple of those and they were not very good. This place is OK. I did not try the coffee and I wonder if that would've changed my mind and increased their ratings. The donuts are so so. They aren't that much better than other places or don't cost a lot less so I do not know what people are talking about. Also, the wait time and price just isn't worth it. It is a very popular place and a lot of people come here. Not sure if there are people that love donuts so much that this is considered great quality??? I love food and have been very fortunate to taste some phenomenal food internationally at some of the best places. I know donuts and sadly, the donut bar does not have anywhere close to the best donuts around. The two stars are because it is expensive, the service was disappointing, the wait time to get the donuts was way too long for this,and the donuts did not impress. I am glad I tried it just take the hype away and I should have gone with my instincts.

9ojMkNu_lnyp_IbvNUN9lA.text: such an amazing hole in the wall donut shop!!!! what's pictured is two boxes for $20 dollars  they said it was happy hour time and one box is $10 dollars and you fill it up as much as you can!! My favorite donut was the strawberry cheesecake one and the crepe brulee! the other picture is churro ice cream cones I was expecting more for the churro ice cream donut cones especially cause they're $6 dollars, the ice cream wasn't up to my standards but you can get chocolate syrup or caramel syrup on it! The donut shop is about 7-10 minutes away from stratosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Both boxes for $20 dollars #blesshappyhour
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro donut ice cream cones!

f8WOzJA1Yd4sDR32cNUVUA.text: Can not for the life of me figure out what the hype is all about! Disgusting abominations of sugar on top of sugar, dense bready thick, dry, stupidly huge, so called donuts.   Husband went downtown early sat to get some to try since we heard about the place being so great and that they "sell out". Yeah ok. All first timers or tourists and not repeat customers I'd be sure!  2 days later and they are still sitting on my counter, most untouched, after we "tried" a tasting of a few of them..... And I have a house full of kids, one of which is a teenage boy,  if that tells you anything! If they won't eat it you KNOW it's bad! Lol!  The cream brulee (best seller!?! Ugh!) was disgusting. Tasteless hard coating of topping that sticks in your teeth on top of basically bread with literally a teaspoon amount of supposed Bavarian creme (also not made fresh, definitely out of a can). Ick! Every one we tried had the exact same tasteless dense dense dense bread like dough. I would compare it very much like the French bread loaves you get at Walmart for $1 topped or filled with multiple variations of whatever disgusting sugar concoction you can think of. Frosting (any of them) is nothing special and entirely pointlessly overdone, tastes like store bought in the cake isle. Apple tart topped with bacon one was dry (as were all of them due to the "bread" dough they use). I'm not sure how in the world you can make an apple filling tasteless but they did it! Dumped straight out of a can. Super disappointed since that one looked the most promising. The pop tart one... Well that is one that is still sitting untouched on the counter. Just grossly huge, pop tart wrapped in bread, filled with some sort of sickly sweet jelly, and topped with more sugar type topping. Oh! And sprinkles! Puke! My kids wouldn't even touch it.  There is also a sponge bob one so decorated with the gross frosting that my 7 yr old didn't event attempt it.  Basically it is clear that the object of this place is to make things "look" interesting enough to buy but absolutely no attention to actual taste, quality or ingredients. Nothing even remotely tastes like it was hand made fresh. Everything is ingredients you can buy in the cake isle (and bread isle) at the grocery store and make yourself. Blagh!  Hey #donutbar...You can stop saying #bestdonutsintheworld now please!  My recommendation and by far superior quality, taste, freshness, service, and overall care of product is #deesdonuts on centennial and Durango! Go check them out and see the difference!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and more bread! Trust me. They taste like... Bread. Dry, thick, dense.... Bread.

s0ICGW2v_8G_0GHF4nm_VQ.text: I love you guys! Wow all I can say is wow! I have been to your San Diego location and I come to Vegas every other week. My girlfriend and I are HUGE fans of the Big Poppa Tart & the creme brulee :-)   The place looks really cool and has a great vibe to it. It's in a old historic building that has been remodeled. The backyard patio is perfect for coffee & donuts in downtown Vegas!   We also saw Chef Santiago & he took the time to say hello and welcome us to his new shop! We can't wait for Ice Cream Cones from Donut Bar!!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DonutBar&#39;s Bar
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Creme Brûlée that was featured on INSIDER Food. We came in and ordered 15 of these beautiful baby&#39;s! The Creme inside is heaven
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OH MY BIRTHDAY CAKE OREO!!

r1t23aK3rL13bJX6t1GcKA.text: I don't know why there is so much hype about this place. I was initially amped like everyone else, but was sadly put down in the blink of an eye. I guess living In LA for the past four years really spoiled me because of the myriad of donut shops I've tried there. Donut bar is different from all the donut shops in Vegas I do have to say. They offer donuts the size of your face, flavor combinations that are unique, and esthetics so pretty you don't want to eat them. Unfortunately, I can't say the same about the texture. The texture was not as moist as I had anticipated. With every bite, I had to wash it down with some water. We came at noon and maybe the donuts were sitting there for a couple hours? But that should not be a valid excuse for a shop specializing in donuts. They close at 1pm or when all the donuts are sold out. Would I come here again, probably not. Sorry donut bar but you can do better.

gxa_noVeFpymUc3N1Y5hHQ.text: This is the best Donuts I've ever had.. seriously. I heard about this place when it opened.. it closes kinda early so I didn't make it, kept putting it off.. eventually I made it in. I went three days in a row. I got two donuts each time.. I spent 4$, $5 and 9$. The prices are very reasonable .. the last time I was there.. the $9 visit. I purchased the French Toast Donut.. it involved a grill, came out hot and awesome.. with silverware; butter, syrup and jam on a plate.. my goodness!!!   The first and third time I went I was that around opening and it was awesome.. the second time I went I arrived around 11:00AM. (They close at 1Pm) .. at 11 they were almost sold out. That's a positive thing. This place has fresh donuts and they are delicious. So get there earyish

qVN6pIcUPB8_43XBtcYl4w.text: The donut bar is fabulous probably my fourth visit this month I had a grilled cheese French toast doughnut and a creme brulee doughnut and some great coffee these people know how to do quality and serve with smiles thanks Joe and the ladies

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast grilled cheese OMG with crème brûlée doughnut and a wonderful cup of coffee

ujAdLswYwAlLfHKRStr4lw.text: I was excited to have found this place when I went to Vegas for EDC weekend. I was actually looking for a churro place but I guess this place popped up for their cone dipped in cinnamon sugar. Even more excited that the shuttle got lost and dropped us around the corner from Donut Bar!! So why 3 stars? Let me break it down:  Ambience: 5/5. No complaints. Not the strip, and not a glamorous neighborhood, but inside is cute, the donuts all look amazing. Clean, etc. The board and menu is cute as well.   Service: 5/5. The girl who helped us out was patient. It was kind of hard being a short Asian to try to see the donuts displayed in the back and not in the counter. She was super friendly, cheery, and overall nice. Service was quick.  Layout: Definitely up with the social media trends with the hashtags and the sign so you can instagram those ginormous and beautiful looking donuts.   But the most important part is the donut itself.....  Donut/Pastries: 2.5/5. The donuts LOOK amazing. So much variety. Different sizes. Awesome flavor combinations. I bought 6 donuts. A whole box for $16. BUT the donut itself was so disappointing. The batter was dry and thick. Closer to an old-fashioned when it wasnt supposed to be. We got there right when they opened at 8am so its not stale. Its just the batter itself. All the donuts had the same batter so even if the frosting was different, the dry batter was still the same.   Creme brulee donut was one of the top ones according to yelp and the girl, but even though the filling (amount was also inconsistent since I bought two), it still didnt moisten the dry batter. However, the crunch of breaking it was satisfying.   The maple cinnamon which I figured was the closest to a churro was burnt near the top and edges but gooey in the middle. However it was too sweet. Perhaps it was the maple. I still ate 90%.   I really wanted to like this place but their actual donuts were all disappointing. Could not use the #bestdonutsintheworld. Sorry!  P.s. Apparently, the cone only is available after 10am. So I never even got what I came for. The rating is purely on the   3.5 stars rounded down to 3 as I do not think its overhyped for the donut itself. Everything was good though. Come for the novelty and not for the best donut in your life.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Theyre pretty (but dry) :) nomnom first meal in Vegas baby!

WRkUIQOwopphU91yfCynOg.text: I don't know why I always go back to donut bar. I don't know why people like donut bar so much. I don't get the hype! But I love hype!   My favorite thing about donut bar is their creme brulee donut with the crunchy sugar coating and the creamy custard filling. Why are they putting less coating and less filling?!   Donut bar has the most bready donuts. They are seriously just slightly sweet bread that are oversized or overly decorated. I have probably tried all of their donuts and they are just not good in my opinion.  Their donut cone with soft serve is good and their creme brulee donut used to be good.  I have probably been here six times because their instagram is popping but I have to say their donuts are just not good.

6kHrd38famM1F9cyhBXJlg.text: Yes they have Vegan donuts BUT their staff act like they don't know which ones are vegan or like I'm from mars bc I'm vegan.  I rather not have anything and drive 25 min back home than to give a place with bad service my hard earned money.

pPiZ2nnEaEcDPv1BNxxrWg.text: Don't get me wrong, the donuts WERE GOOD... but they weren't exceptional or phenomenal (to me).   If you enjoy cake-batter like heavy donuts, then these will be right up your alley. But if you're more into fluffy doughy donuts, then these are not for you.   My boyfriend and I landed in Vegas on a Saturday morning and headed straight to Donut Bar at 8am hoping for some fresh donuts. We got there around 830AM & there was no line when we walked in. The second we entered, the room filled with sweet smelling goodness.  All the donuts LOOKED AMAZING. We bought 2 dozen for our entire group of friends. So we basically tried every single Donut they had to offer. And I mean I actually tried a bite of every single one.. and I wasn't too amazed. Maybe I was just overhyped?   The price was pretty high too. The doughnuts are HUGE.. But bigger is not always better. They ranged from $2-5 depending on which flavor. We ended up spending about $75 for 2 dozen.  Most likely I would not come back here again, but it doesn't hurt to try if you're a first timer! I would definitely recommend heading to the east coast if you're on the hunt for real delicious donuts!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One dozen!

YgSMrnzPwnZFRXBCXTMhuA.text: Are you kidding me??!   I got the chocolate bacon donut bar and the "Nutella Overload." It's too bad I didn't eat them right when I bought them, so as to have identified the MAJOR problem early on and confronted the shop about it, but I saved the donuts for a late afternoon treat-yo-self after some hours of blackjack. This is how it went down:  I take a few bites of the chocolate bacon...it's aight, your typical donut, definitely has its work cut out for itself to catch up to the maple bacon bar of Voodoo Donuts in Portland, OR.   Next up, I take a big bite of the Nutella Overload, expecting a blobby, sludgy Nutella infusion. Ummm, NO. It's a plain dry donut. Baffled, I take another large bite. NOTHING. I frantically rip apart this stupid donut and THERE IS NO NUTELLA WHATSOEVER IN THE DONUT, let alone an "OVERLOAD."   There is not even a swipe, dab, drop, lick, or smidgeon to be seen of the signature brown chocolate hazelnut heaven paste anywhere inside of the donut. Nada, nien, niet, RIEN!   If the Nutella Overload cost $1, then I'd shrug it off. But $4 paired with deceptive advertising of "overload" is appalling.   Also, their hours are arbitrary and thus, suck. Just make more donuts. You're a self-proclaimed donut "bar." Lastly, it's tiny on the inside and located on a nondescript street. Hardly a place that meets the expectations created by way of their larger-than-life website.   Go to Voodoo Donuts in Portland, OR or Psycho Donuts in San Jose, CA.

8XxN9B8bTqUnbzVU8GT4pQ.text: This place is a cool concept for sure. Donuts and beer. This makes sense to me. Every day their vegan selection changes and you take your chances if you don't get there early. But since they do change out their vegan selection you might be able to try a variety of flavors in just a few visits. The service has been great the two times I've been in. Sadly I haven't even paired a donut with a beer just yet. I'm slacking on my day drinking apparently. All the donuts look awesome and I'm sure are good. I've heard good things about the samoa Girl Scout style donut. I've had the creme brulee... I wish it had more filling. Had to eat the whole donut before finding any filling until the last  bite. I am anticipating some flavors like the spiced chai for sure. I will definitely be back and you should swing by if you haven't yet. They close at 1pm and happy hour is just before. You could score two for one!

zAWVY7MBtesemqI9-McvmA.text: I stayed down the street for one night since I came in super late!  In the morning I was in search of an espresso that was going to be better than the free hotel coffee and a yelp search sent me here.  I walked in and the staff was super friendly and let me look in the cases and take it all in while not pressuring me to make a decision.  The strawberry short cake doughnuts looked amazing as did the one's with the pop tarts inside but, I chose a strawberry cheese cake doughnut, creme brulee doughnut and long doughnut filled with German cream.  Extremely creative doughnut flavors and combinations without being over the top and not well executed.  I headed back to the hotel and let me tell you the strawberry cheesecake doughnut only lasted for 4 bites.  My friend ate the other two and they lasted about the same and he kept saying how amazing they were.  I agreed because I had to stop myself from going back to get more for myself.  The espresso was the strongest and best that I have had in quite a few years!  I will definitely be back when I am here again in June!

Jy21jQaLT8JqpP5Sp8SuSQ.text: Seeing the photo's of these donuts on Yelp, I knew I had to try these babies out.   They had so many options. Almost every donut was about the size of my head. Ton's of toppings and fillings. The lady behind the counter helping us was awesome. She was super helpful, very friendly, and informed. She guided us through the different options, the favorites, and her own favorites. We ended up with the Butter Beer Donut, Apple Fritter, Maple Bacon, and Creme Brule.   I personally thought these donuts were too sweet. And really not my type of donut in general. These are mostly bready donut's with super sugary, cake icing. It wasn't bad. Just not my thing. The Creme Brule was different. Creamy vanilla filling with sugar burleed to the top.   If you are big in to sugar you may love this place. I really loved the people and the experience of it all. Very cute shop. The coffee was good as well. Just not my thing.

-C3IX03mz4c1pGi1wN1Gsw.text: By far the best donuts I have ever seen or eaten In my life. I loved in San Diego for 7 years and was a regular at that location and when one arrived in las vegas I had to make a trip to see if it was just as good, and it was! If you're in las vegas I highly recommend making a trip here and you just have to get there early. They tend to sell out around 11am.   My favorites on the menu would have to be the caramelized pineapple, creme Brule and the big poppa tart. Though your safe with picking any flavor because they are all incredibly delicious.

We got the donut stuffed with oreo and it was DELISH! Not only was it the right size and not too much donut, it paired very well with the coffee.    My husband had a donut left the next day and he said the other donut wasn't as good the second day, but i think fresh is best earlier in the day - especially when there is a lot more variety.  Location is a bit small but its not like you sit and eat donuts at dunkin donuts, we take them to go.  I hope to try some other donuts next time we're in Vegas.

rmLY0epuCaBS2EWBLJH6LA.text: Waited for 3 trips to LV till open. Had tried donuts from SD location.   Ordered several.  Big Poppa my favorite.  French toast was surprisingly light. Great service.  Get there early.  Looked like possible to order o line and pickup better than wait.

The best thing to do, first thing in the morning it to stop the Donut Bar and put up a cake donut and hot cup of coffee.. xphYcNap2YXlljkOTJucFQ.text: What a waste of time and drive! Came here to buy donuts to take back to LA to our kids for Valentine's day. If your website says you close at 1pm you should make enough donuts to be open till that time....especially on Valentine's Day when you know ppl probably give them as gifts! Paid for parking too only to walk over and find that they wrote on the window that they were sold out and it's only 11:30am! It was dark inside so I'm sure they just didn't run out! Bad customer service and bad planning on owners part! I don't care if you have 4.5 stars on Yelp if your customer service sucks! Won't return! Don't care how good the donuts are!

1xAdC8MOY9ZuaURW6Y3bKg.text: I am proud to have this donut bar in Las Vegas! You guys are amazing! If you are looking for a really cool place with an amazing vibe and couple that with some of the most UNIQUE and TASTY Donuts found ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD! Then this is the place for you!  May you continue to serve donuts in Las Vegas for next 100+ Years!   I would rate this one 10 MILLION STARS!

xmj6V4ak8pX6DLkEAgKyjA.text: They have a great selection of donuts. I got the chocolate/bacon and Nutella. They were fresh and very good.

OxvvxrSQTvJB1rMZ_2eFmQ.text: This little donut shop is so cute. I love their pink decor and awesome donut themed aquarium. They have a wide variety of donuts to choose from in all sorts of unique flavors and themes. Then why am I lukewarm about it?  Part of the problem is that they are all looks and less about substance. The donuts are okay, just okay. The yeast donuts are big and fluffy, but they lack flavor. For instance their birthday cake donut looks pretty but it just tastes like a donut - there's nothing to suggest it tastes like birthday cake. No icing, no batter, none of that 'eggy' flavor. All the other yeast donuts were similar. The cake donuts are a better bet, but I only had one of those, so maybe I bet on the wrong horse so to speak.  It's worth a try, but it's not the best donuts you'll ever have. I would suggest sticking to cake donuts if you do come here.

iIxUQPaGupUaN2vKkNSdOA.text: Very cute little donut bar downtown Las Vegas!   The donuts were big & flavorful. I got the 'Cake Batter donut' & my sister got the 'Homer'! They only frost the top then it's a plain donut under which is great for balancing out the sweetness of the frosting.   I feel like the price was fair for the size donut you get. All specialty donuts as well. A lot of flavors to choose from!  The staff was nice & welcoming even told us where more seating was located. They made suggestions on which donuts were most popular & gave us adequate time to make a decision.   The overall environment was clean, cute & artsy. This location was quiet & away from the crowd which was nice.   They had outdoor seating in a little shaded courtyard which was great.   If I'm ever in the area again, I'd check them out.

mxqAq6HrXqfvaARX-qqCkQ.text: I really wanted to love this place but, alas, I did not. We make it a point to seek out "gourmet" doughnut shops on our vacations so I was looking forward to this one.   For starters, most of the doughnuts are huge. While normally that might be a selling point, it's a bummer when you'd like to try multiple flavors. I chose the Harry Potter-themed butterbeer (butterscotch) and it was very cute but the flavor was very eh. I was expecting a filling but realized that they had simply covered the center hole with a squirt of icing and the icing alone wasn't really enough for the intended flavor to come through at all. My husband got the strawberry and whipped cream filled doughnut. It was ok, but the "whipped cream" definitely wasn't dairy based and felt kinda plastic-y in your mouth.  Secondly, because they are so large, the prices are a little hefty. We paid $10 for two donuts and a black coffee. I have no problem paying for good food but the lackluster flavor made the price point not worth it.  Everything was very visually attractive and the shop was cute.  Overall, I might have had a better experience if we had picked different flavors but what we had wasn't worth the money or the drive. Such a shame because the shop was fun and the staff was very friendly.

FK-uzcOY4V2T442WBab40g.text: First time at this donut shop and my kiddo and I loved it! I had the French Toast Donut and it was delicious. My daughter had the Caramel Crunch, I think, which she literally had to do a whole happy-dance about. The weather was really nice today so we headed towards the back where you can exit towards a courtyard with outdoor eating and sitting areas. We didn't notice the rooftop seating at the beginning or else we probably would've enjoyed our food there instead. Overall, this spot exceeded my expectations for a don't shop!

A7qudD3_jWHQmBHFL2zVxw.text: Finally made it here after several attempts. Always too early on the weekend, so we hit other donut shops that open early mornings on weekends we are up and about with sunrise. This place opens 9 am on weekends!  So the donuts look appealing, several large donuts, glazed, chocolate, Nutella. These are twice the size of regular donuts. Today, the large glazed was a little under cooked for me. It was doughy, when pulling apart, the pieces could be rolled into an almost raw like consistency. I don't care for that.   The old fashion was too dried out, dry and stale. They pulled it from a large tray but I don't know how long they where sitting out, but just to dry for me.   Got two of the cream brulee, good donut with hard glaze on top stuffed with cream filling. Tasted like vanilla pudding instead of real cream. Not bad for what it was.   Next thing that we tried was the Boston cream bars. They where good, love the chocolate glaze, again the vanilla pudding cream taste and not truly the real cream flavor.   I am not thinking it was a great choice today. Not completely opposed to trying again, but was not terribly impressed.

O6Ydv6KHSWypUxIhTRM_vQ.text: I gave this place another shot, and I was glad to see a better selection this time. They were still out of some things however, and it was only 9:30am.  These donuts are delicious, but have to be enjoyed within a few hours. They start getting crunchy after that.

xJa27667kvc2A32DcYK2PA.text: Their coffee was good and their simple creme brulee donut @ $2 was a decent introduction to this place.  I walked in on a Saturday morning to find the place alive and buzzing with several excited families seeking donuts for breakfast.  Their regular donut options seemed overwhelmingly huge for $5/piece so when I asked them for their smallest donut they pointed me over to the creme brulee near the end.    Americano took a few mins but was delicious and complex.  The creme brulee was yummy with a sugar topping that shatters when you bite into it and that custard that's to die for.  Worth the random wander off the downtown area but others may find the area too quiet for their own comfort on an early Saturday morning in Feb.  Bonus: the driverless shuttle they are piloting has the Donut Bar as a stop!

MT-SPRYTb549pi6ms0UKyQ.text: The nicest staff and the donuts are amazing .  I love the choices and blends they had. They even have a Homer Donut !!! Wonderful can't wait to go back

eFGYXQT6-b658yY4yiQZ4A.text: Came to visit!  They close super early but we came here around noon for our donuts. First time here and they offered us a $10/ box donut. We filled the entire box up with whatever donuts we wanted, and it was amazing that they still had the poppa tart donut which I wanted to try. I took a giant bite out of it, and it was so yummy! It would've been better if I heated it and the glaze was melty and warm. I recommend heating it up though. Overall, I loved the strawberry pop tart donut even though it was so big I couldn't finish it and only ate a quarter and saved the rest for later! It was delicious and I would definitely eat it again.

EE3icjK4j3R4l942CowoRg.text: Donut Kill My Vibe!! This is a cute, small and fun donut bar! It's been in my bookmarked list for the next time I came to Vegas, and I finally got to try them. When you walk in the aroma of fresh donuts hits you in the face. It's also super cute and colorful. I love that you could see all the donuts on display as well as the colors of the place. It's very warm and welcoming. The staff is also extremely nice and patient. I say patient because I was so eager to get inside and take pictures and create a video. Haha. However as far as taste, their donuts are pretty average.   They have tons of donuts to choose from but we ended up getting the Big Poppa Tart Donut, Strawberry Filled Donut, and they gave us a free candy cane donut because we had our 14 month old daughter with us. How cool is that?! Very nice and thoughtful. I have never had a donut place offer a free kids donut. However, I will say their donuts are a little more on the expensive side, but most are bigger than your average donut so it balances out.   The Big Poppa Tart was definitely big and enough to share. I got the Strawberry one. It's made to look like an oversized Pop-tart. The cool thing is, there is an entire pop tart on the inside of the Big Poppa Tart. The donut itself was very good and tender. It also tasted amazing with the strawberry jam on top. Now I will be honest and say I didn't care much for the Pop-tart on the inside. It was chewy and a little stale tasting as far as texture. It didn't taste like a regular Pop-Tart. I guess something changes as the donut is heated and fried. Overall, the Big Poppa Tart is pretty and the edges taste really good. My husband ate my entire half of my Big Poppa and he never said a thing about the Pop-Tart so I guess it didn't bother him. He just said he couldn't taste it. *Shrugs* I guess it's more of a personal preference.  The Strawberry Filled tasted pretty good. I didn't get to taste it because my husband killed it but overall it was good he said. He said it honestly didn't taste like anything special or different than any other Strawberry Filled Donut he has had. I will say this is one of their smaller donuts. If you order a circular shaped donut then these are the bigger ones.  I also didn't taste my daughter's donut but my husband did. He said it tasted like a regular donut. I guess she liked it because she ate it all. It was just a donut in the shape of a candy cane with white and red glaze on top.   Overall, Donut Bar was cute and fun! As far as taste, I don't think they were anything special. They were pretty average. I will say their creativity of their donuts and some of the flavors is unique but other than that they taste just like any other donut shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poppa Tart , Candy Cane Donut (for kids for free), and Strawberry Filled Donut

Ip_ZUGGJdA0bJwviX0QIFA.text: Good donuts, damn good donuts.  What else is there to know?  Ah... if you insist...  So I guess this place is famous.  I didn't know, I just came downtown to pay a ticket and saw a neat little sign for a donut shop.  Inside I go and I'm just blown away by the different types of donuts on display!  Homer's donut?  Matcha donut?  Nutella donut?  What!?  Which should I try?  The answer is ALL OF THEM!  Haha okay not really, but I did buy a dozen.  The french toast donut was my favorite.  I believe they make it on request because mine came out hot, and I did have to wait additional time for it.  It comes with syrup on the side as well.  My only regret is not buying two!  It was that good.  I loved Homer's donut as well.  I believe that was strawberry flavored icing on top?  It was simple, but great.  The strawberry split was SO good!  My partner loved how it wasn't too sweet, and loved having creme and strawberries in the donut.    I didn't order the creme brulee donut this time, but I hear it's their signature donut.  Heck, they all look and taste like signature donuts!  Instead of cooking breakfast I think I'll just order a french toast donut from here instead.  It was bigger than all the donuts and very filling.    They close when they're out of donuts and trust me, they will run out.  I recommend arriving early as there's usually no line.  Definitely a must try when you're in Las Vegas!  PROTIP:  Their menu changes DAILY!  You can also order in advance on their website only during THE DAY BEFORE!  And it has to be a dozen donuts, minimum.  I believe the deadline is 6pm, but I could be mistaken.  This saves a lot of time during busy weeks if there's a festival going on in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the donuts are displayed, and their menu changes daily!
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée donut!  And the Nutella donut.

aHESFZF_Z659ksz3BghNjA.text: Of course I'm sure the "regular" donuts tasted far better.. but we arrived at 10am and found there to be only 3 vegan options. The apple fritter was so burnt it was black on top. I got it anyways hoping that inside would be a delicious fritter experience... nope. Dry and tasted burnt. Tossed  in the trash.  The creme brulee was alright. I have had better.  The last was a cake donut. Can't even remember the flavor. It was good. But not good enough to spend the amount of money I did.   I would much rather got to Voodoo Donuts where they have atleast 10 different AMAZING vegan donuts at one time.

K839-E8XoXzH1L9NJNuCeg.text: ETA: Try the vegan grilled cheese donut sandwich. It's a one-in-a-lifetime gotta-do-it kinda situation. I think I only need a single bypass instead of a double, cuz, yanno, vegan.

OFfwbYOHQqBGgna5VXxzMQ.text: Vegan donuts were yummy  grilled cheese was good next time I will ask for syrup for on top for a more breakfast feel of deliciousness!!

KlNC7l11g7L8Dch-Vvt_Tg.text: When I first saw the creme brulee donut on Facebook, I knew that I had to try it the next time I was in Vegas. Well, the 'next time' was much sooner than I thought.   And for those of you who don't know what I'm talking about, go Google the creme brulee donut now and watch a video of it in action. It's just one those things where words won't do it justice.   The thing about Donut Bar is that it is open until the store runs out of donuts. Therefore, I recommend getting there when it opens or going on a weekday. My friends and I got there on a Tuesday morning around 10am, and there wasn't a line. The best part was that there was a ton of creme brulee donuts available!  We tried the pistachio lemon, maple bacon, strawberries & cream, and the creme brulee donuts. Out of everything I tried, the creme brulee is my favorite. The sugar coating is thick and tough, making it impossible to 'crack' with a plastic spoon. The cream filling inside is not too sweet and delicious. The other donuts are the cake kind, which is not my favorite. They're good -- a solid 4 where the creme brulee is a 4.5

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée donuts and more!

MgAyzYuaJuN9E-XG4vjxUQ.text: This place used to be my favorite Donut place to go to. Came here on Sunday only to be disappointed. The creme brulee used to be my go to donut and the flavor I'm used to is lacking. The sugar on top also used to cover the whole top of the donut. The other donuts were also mediocre.

yzmOXSKodgadpM3V6UYiHg.text: They were at the farmers market at DTS & was our first turns trying them.  Each large donuts were $3-4.  Hubby and I were not impressed. The large donuts were nothing special but ordinary which I felt like it had too much bread and not enough toppings.  I'll give it another try maybe the selection we had was just off.

WE-cmTn9RHOH7pOCHCVmCw.text: Delicious! The pop tart one is ah-mazing! Like a pop tart wrapped in a toaster strudel

wv095y475rQ-jZb8fdYOrg.text: Amazing donuts for affordable prices. I went in around noon, and they had a special of buy 1 get 1 free OR buy a box for $10. I'm not a huge donut fan because bread + lots of sugar makes me feel sick so I only got 2!  (They close until all the donuts are all sold)  FOOD 5/5: -Creme Brulee ($2): This is what their famous for because INSIDER FOOD showcased this particular donut online and it became a hit! I LOVED it, I'm a fan of regular creme brulee, and they did an amazing job of filling the cream inside the donut & having a sweet/crunch on the top. -Old Fashion Glazed (Free): This was fantastic! If your not into all the sweetness and bread, I strongly recommend this donut. Simple but very good.  SERVICE 5/5: -Right when you get in your greeted by smiles and whoever is working is more than happy to recommend what they're most famous for & what flavors you like!

wXuNzRNxKOvTeYxobkseHw.text: I was very disappointed with this place. I was happy to find out that they had vegan donuts, but the quality of the donuts were sub par at best. I got there around 2:30pm just as they were closing, so they were selling the donuts for $10 per box. I thought it was a good deal until I actually tried the donuts. They were awful. I tried all of the vegan donuts that they had left. Apple fritter, salted caramel, Creme brulee, and peanut butter and jelly. They were all hard and stale. The apple fritter was burnt on the bottom.  The top of the Creme brulee was like a hard piece of plastic. I was shocked at how bad the product was, especially since they are surrounded by so many great eateries in the area. They should be embarrassed selling that kind of garbage, even if it is closing time.  I definitely do not recommend this place.

kzSrVWhFLgxRAEE_PJw0gA.text: I've been stalking this place on Instagram for a while so when I finally went in it was everything I expected. As soon as my daughter and I walked in we were greeted by a very friendly gal. Told her it was our first time here and she broke down all the different donuts. Overall, the donuts we had were awesome, the place was decorated super cute for Halloween, and the service matched the donuts!

tvbW3BJFbe3kwZfq0evhzQ.text: Come here early for a wider selection because once they sell out, they sell out! However, some donuts like their grilled cheese and french toast are made to order. Note that they may not offer the grilled cheese and french toast donuts every day though.   Having been to the Donut Bar in San Diego, I can say the Las Vegas location is definitely bigger and less crowded (at least on a Saturday morning, though I guess it's off season for Vegas right now).   I'd say it's most worth to come here if you're excited to try their unique flavors. Blood orange, birthday cake oreo, and the blueberry cheesecake are delicious and not too sweet actually! Also, if you buy a dozen, you get one donut free. We ended up spending $29 (including tax) for three big donuts and 10 small ones, which runs a bit pricey but I'd argue it's worth it especially if you're splitting donuts. The big donuts are gigantic anyways and are (more than) worth the $3.   Service is friendly and location is hard to miss (with a big donut painted on the outside of the building).

u8eeaJKXJYYAiurUBIfSXw.text: Went here after hearing all the raves... it was disappointing. The staff were supper nice, they described all the flavors for us and was very helpful.  The donuts are not the best, the Red Velvet was super dry and not very flavorful. The maple bacon was ok. I have had better donuts for way cheaper. Almost $12 for 5 donuts!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xxn_bQIryYt0yNGXzP-iHw.text: While I was trying to decide which of the many donuts I would order, some girl was on the phone saying "they aren't regular donuts, they are fancy ones'.  That pretty much sums it up.  The donuts are legit creations and not just glazed with fruit loops sprinkled on top.  Some of the donuts are pretty large and pretty filling.  They don't call it the Big Poppa Tart for no reason.

g48EqDPWH6bprpPg-PvFmg.text: I was originally just going to get one donut because my pastry threshold is usually one but after stepping inside Donut Bar you quickly realize how hard it is to just buy one. That's why we have two hands right, to double fist in morning sugar rushes?  I ended up getting their signature Creme Brulee and a Nutella bar with a Cold Brew. If the donuts didn't do me in, the coffee did because it rocked my Friday morning. It was all so good I bought a round back for my co-workers to share the wealth.  TIP: This cute, cramped donut shop is literally always popping so make sure you strategically find parking beforehand!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mud Pie, Homer, Strawberry Split &amp; Creme Brulee

jD7QMjYMmD50t4JQqiXeHA.text: The donuts here are good; they're dense, unlike a lot of other donut places. You can really tell thy put effort in making them. However, the creme brulee donut was very disappointing. The hype did not match the quality. I think people were just excited about the cracking noise rather than its taste. However, the other donuts were great!

DPCbEHEcyVJA0xijUdTd5A.text: Downtown Vegas. I love you and I hate you. Easy to get around for pedestrians but it's sort of like walking thru a zombie minefield of people asking for money, people talking to themselves or wondering if you're going to get mugged right around the corner. Yeah, not pretty. Perseverance is the key.  My main tip for you is Donut Bar's storefront is actually on Carson Avenue & not on 6th Street.  I planned on getting 2 donuts but everything looked so alluring I settled for 3 & dealt with the consequences later. This was my breakfast & snack for later.  Hmm. Taste was okay. For me it was very sweet but the aim to a donut's success is the texture of the dough & unfortunately all 3 of my choices were on the dry side. Maybe it was an off day? Because look at all the 4-5 Star reviews here. I am like, huh? I dunno.  Creme Brulee Donut - Their specialty. The hard, crunchy brulee'd exterior sticks to your teeth. The creme inside was good.   Blueberry Cheesecake Donut-Yeast donut with comstock blueberry filling & iced cream cheese frosting was very sweet & not very cheesecake-like.  Oreo Birthday Cake Donut- Yeast donut stuffed with an Oreo cookie inside. Although the Oreo was soggy if I had to choose, I liked this donut out of my 3 picks.  I was also bummed to see they no longer had the cartons of Stump Town coffee and only a bottled version of cold brew which brought my bummer level down further.  In my eyes I prefer Mr. Donut & Donut King so for Oahuans don't fret too much if you can't get to Donut Bar on your next trip to the 9th Island. You have very good options at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top to Bottom: Blueberry Cheesecake ($2), Oreo Birthday Cake ($2) &amp; Creme Brûlée ($2). Tax Included. 5/10/17.

arBQp-1H0Mfy4Gk2TdROqw.text: The girl at the counter greeted me and asked if I had been there before which I hadn't. I wanted to try it since their donuts looked really good from YouTube videos I've seen. She told me which ones sold the most and told me about some other popular ones. I already had in mind what I wanted so I got a Nutella ring donut which don't really taste like Nutella, a creme brulee which was really good and I also got a cinnamon roll with bacon on the top and also pieces were throughout which I loved. Next time I go I have to try the red velvet

4_PnkVVqJV8BELIXrAzVKA.text: I finally got to try their creme brulee donut after seeing it in a facebook video. Wow the donut does not disappoint! The crack is pretty loud and wished it delivered through the video that I posted. The donut itself tastes even better (as if the crack wasn't enough). It wasn't overly sweet like I thought it would be. The custard was smooth and delicious. I wish I ordered more. I also got the blueberry cheesecake donut, which I didn't eat until 12 hours later. It was still delightful to me, but I'm sure it would've tasted even better if I ate it fresh. For $2 per donut, this place wins my heart! Not a bad drive from the strip either :)

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1gM7qVJxx_KBfJd3pYYWyQ.text: Finally got to try this place. Yummy describes this sinful obsession of imaginative donut flavor combinations. I regret that I didn't check out the online menu to see what types they had before going there. So it was a bit over-whelming trying to view/choose what to order because the line moved too quickly. I tried the lemon cake donut drizzled with a cream cheese frosting glaze & took back a huge blueberry glazed donut (I forget what there  actual names are). If that wasn't enough, I was fortunate enough to try the Homer Simpson pink donut w/ sprinkles (they always sell out, so go early). Well...they were all wonderfully delicious. But, I'm glad they are not located close to where I reside otherwise, I would be there at least once a week & that wouldn't be good for my waist line (yikes). Yet, I do think about & crave those fried desserts since I've tasted them!!

FH7gqWw7ZEiD-qbu82xEYQ.text: Delicious! I recommend the French toast and the Big Poppa Tart. The staff was also fantastic! Whenever I come to Vegas again, this place will be a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mouLA4JH2Hy4YgVWou9m9w.text: Amazing giant donuts, excellent value and many interesting flavors to choose from. Friendly service.  The nitro cold brew coffee was spot on. Highly recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent donuts , tasty and huge. Try the cold brew coffee, it&#39;s delicious!

tU2qv_0YPE_WIzH3EPE09g.text: Tried Donut Bar yesterday based on the reviews and really disappointed. Paid $26.50 for a dozen donuts and only nearby parking available was pay to park. There was a few spots in front of the store and on the side that had no fee, but no available spots. A few of the donuts we purchased tasted good but most of them were greasy and tasted like they were made the day before. We did purchase a couple of the big donuts, but really not worth the price. Should have a price for a dozen with specialty add ons. Probably won't visit again, not so much the cost but the quality.

mwKzOGKBSPMeGnqxvdpfYw.text: The lines are long but it's 100% worth waiting for this chicken I promise! Hands down the best chicken you will taste!

VLawipJ-xx21_ZtJqK1yPQ.text: We had our wedding donuts from Donut Bar and it was absolutely amazing!  Jeff was so easy to work with, and helped us to pick out whatever flavors we wanted.  They were such a hit at the wedding everyone was asking where they came from and wanted to go back for more!  We chose them for the Vegan options and were completely in love with everything we tried. Thank you so much!  Will definitely be back.

ijn9CBC6XaEo8wvLRmPDXg.text: What's not to love? They have iced coffee on tap, donuts as big as your head. When we were there, we had a buy one get one option. If I were needing a sugar shock, I might have tried the Homer (a pink frosted donut with sprinkles straight out of the Simpsons), but i wasn't feeling so bold. Instead, I opted for a chai cake donut. My boyfriend got a Boston cream. We tore through them so fast I considered getting more.  This place is off of Fremont, but still worth a quick grab and go breakfast.

yB8IS1uk4VEJfEQx2XBqVA.text: The staff was friendly and welcoming. The donuts tasted fresh and were delish! Especially the Mexican hot chocolate one . This was our first time there and we'd definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super nice staff and the donuts were delish!  Our first time and we definitely would go back.

ZLvRXnrzh26O5t7gCFwInA.text: This place is so far away from home, but it was definitely worth the trip! When I first walked in, I was greeted by the workers and by a pleasant bakery aroma. I actually haven't heard of this place until my cousins from California mentioned it. They wanted to try the creme brulee donut so we drove the distance to try it out; it's something I definitely recommend. The donuts here are very different from any other donut place, which makes it all the more special. I really just wanted to buy everything and pig out at home, but unfortunately that couldn't happen. I'll be coming back, soon!

dacEJQ48vttEQorRyLr_JA.text: No words for this deliciousness. At least four types of vegan donuts every day - not sure which is my fav because they're all so incredibly good. It is an honor to pay $3 each for these donuts :-)

5vdXHvVcjpy4xUlCfYluXw.text: The Donut Bar Las Vegas is absolutely, hands down the best place to get your morning started. I eat here almost daily. The donuts are always consistent, and the service from Joe, Jeff, and their staff is always superb! Highly recommended!!!!

QK7wdYZFfsIcZ5yHBuRe3Q.text: I love The Donut Bar. The staff is really lax and the donuts are amazing. It just sucks that they close early but they usually sell out before then. I love their churro cones with ice cream on the top. Please open more locations!

JaHdefOAvLteQ3t2hNS6Rw.text: This place was good. Gotta go early it will get sold out. It's always jumping but good. It's worth the wait in my opinion and a cool atmosphere. I will be going again in the future because there's more I need to try

WtKV6kszyqwkbD71QEOrfQ.text: Awesome, huge donuts! Great coffee. We were here for a mid day snack. Nice stop and in the summer heat of 105 it was nice and cool inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2Vg-BuGn1qi7U1LgZEYDEw.text: Oh my gosh, these donuts are to die for!!! Stopped in on my walk thru downtown. Great concept, gourmet donuts with a awesome atmosphere. Try the soma donut, can't go wrong any of their donuts.

lRKEzeBVkgcJi-BD3tDDmA.text: Such a cute spot! Donut Bar defiently lives up to the buzz that is going around. Went here with a client after they recommended it. Will be back asap!!

C80rZhRVFIJweT1f66XzHQ.text: Are you kidding me??? Buy 6, take a dozen. Ok, done!!!! Every single option of doughnut was to good to be True. From the PB & J to that apple fritter. These people got it going on. Hats off to the pastry chef. The downfall is you have to get there early or you won't get very many options to choose from.

MYKNgWnW16RK5dChjoo9pw.text: Run. Don't walk. Everything we had was so so so good. I took a bunch back home to So Cal with me. We ate them all and enjoyed every bite. I can't wait to go back.

XtgLzp44MSvcMeZeKemYOA.text: Love this place!  Huge to regular size donuts fresh and delicious!

k27ZtEV6rOw0bpBeJkFR8g.text: My very first time trying this and all I can say is OMG WOW AMAZING!!! And I got there at the perfect time.... HAPPY HOUR. Staff is also amazing, very clean place. They definitely stand by their slogan. Best Donuts in the WORLD!! Wow

nmI2fncCc8NcPTbEmzEmIA.text: Now I may have showed up at 11, so they had painted outside that they were sold out but when I came in to double check he did have some they didn't sell yet. Wasn't a huge variety because it was the leftovers some chocolate bars, coffee bar, and some massive sugar donuts. They were absolutely delicious! I got a good deal and more than I could eat for a great price. I got to make it on time tommorow .

gEDmbkF9sM6c7ix1eILUaQ.text: I am obsessed with donuts, and Donut Bar only makes this worse.  The first time I went there, they had a special on birthday cake donuts.  I told them I wanted one of those, and one of the Homer Simpson inspired donuts.  The server placed two birthday cake donuts in my box, instead of one, as a special treat as it was opening week, along with the Homer donut.  When I told her it was also my birthday and that it was really cool, she put another donut in there!   I've been back several times, and still haven't gotten any other free donuts; however, let me just say, I've encountered the same friendly service!  Consider trying the chocolate milk or coffee on tap, and be sure to use the restroom, well, at least look in the restroom before leaving.  The restaurant itself is quite small, so please be sure to explore the courtyard area for more seating that is particularly nice on Spring and Summer mornings.

FFx_pDcV5XkhWQsjE1bCSA.text: It's a neat place! I a little Ali Wong's definition of hipster. But my old age I felt comfortable. The donuts were huge and cooked like remember they were 35 years ago back in the dinosaur era. My choices were an apple bacon fritter and a maple bacon log! I don't care what my wife and mother in law got, I had bacon in front of me! They said, " it was good they'd come back and tell others". I had their coffee and yes!, they'll make you what that startakeyurbucks place can make I believe I like this place better. Place is located downtown Vegas and the area is really becoming a great place geared towards us locals and giving us the non-commercial franchise associated crap local Las vegans are looking for!  Great little place! Big do-NUTS! Better caffeine beverages than StraveYourBucks!

Duhm069OsVlENdXI6LK8gQ.text: Fast service. Clean, unique spot. But can we talk about these donuts already? Like for real!!!!! The creme brulee is everything you could imagine. For once, believe the hype!!! The filling is flavorful and luxurious. Pink box aint got nuthin on this place. Shared some others with my fam. Nutella, some giant strawberry pop tart one and a blueberry lemon. All were fabulous! Coffee was also really good. This is a cute place for a breakfast date. P.s.- theres outside seating in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J6D_r4TUstRy5qHj7gbtDg.text: The Donut House in downtown Las Vegas is a MUST! Their unique creations are fabulous. Their Creme brulee RULES!

KV8oJN-GSEz7xlq7_AwrlQ.text: If you're looking for special donuts that taste as good as they look then you've arrived at the right place. The store variety: smores, Oreo birthday cake, crime brulee, and etc. The donut price ranges from $2-$5 but the $4-$5 donuts are huge!   You have to get to the store before 10 am, preferably 8-9:20 am or else most of the popular donuts will be sold out. You can preorder online and pick it up from 8-10 am but the minimum is 12 donuts.   Easily my favorite donut store when I'm in Las Vegas or San Diego.

1Fbm5WDXrCAyLjq0kvRXzw.text: This place exceeds expectations, the customer service is phenomenal and the donuts were HUGE!! I tried the delicious raspberry iced with pistachio nuts, it looked fake, like a Homer Simpson donut, but the taste was as far from 'fake' as you can imagine! It was moist, sweet (not overly sweet) and melted in my mouth. I know this place is very popular and sells out quickly, so thankful I got to try one!!

zxg2NyKFuxbHlk8-e9MdNg.text: Was in Vegas and stumbled across this place when looking for a breakfast joint to go to near downtown on Yelp. There was such a variety of uncommon donut flavors (Nutella, mud pie, strawberry cheesecake, Homer Simpson) and the donuts were huge! I asked the guy at the counter for a recommendation, since there were so many choices, and he said to try the French toast donut. So I ordered and when it came out, it was a huge donut with butter, syrup, and blueberry compote on the side. I took the first bite with butter and dipped in syrup and I think the sky parted and  I heard angels singing!!! The lightest French toast ever!!! What a combo! My girlfriend had the strawberry cheesecake and said it was amazing! We will be back here the next time we are in Vegas. They only served this donut Sat and Sun, from what the guy said, so if you have a cheat meal and in Vegas for a weekend, this is the meal to have.   It's right down the street from the Mob Museum, which was also a great place to visit after having a foodgasm.

Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast donut=Foodgasm

zUnkR5NB-SupzpvX9X47rQ.text: Omg wow yummy delish love love love their donuts,  we go to the one in Las Vegas and everything is so good so everytime we go we get one of each

hjRVv1vaMOJrO6a6Zu7mEg.text: Best Donuts Ever,,,, Great taste .. And always Fresh! But get there early! Once they run out. they close for the day. Their coffee and hot chocolate are not to be missed. One last thing. I enjoy sitting in the courtyard in the back of the store.

nRZwv_LmiRZVdfqZqGFMVQ.text: Great Donuts. Went opening weekend a while back and they were super friendly. Great for kids as well.

cPhtribIgWH-q2spQW1ThQ.text: This donut bar is a must see!! Off of Carson and 6th in a old motel. The workers inside are so friendly. On Saturday and Sunday they give children a free donut how cool is that!!! You must go see the store and taste them.

vgthUgh3T1L28WQAyghuJw.text: Love the selection and the donuts are huge for the most part. Had the Elvis and hubs had the birthday cake. We devoured them both and we're not usually big donut eaters. Won't go to downtown Vegas without them again

8rDK8sRxDjte_vJ81uR5Vw.text: I was staying at the El Cortez last week and I decided to take a short walk up the block to try out Donut Bar. It's a small little shop but with a great selection. I had the Green Tea doughnut and a Chai Latte then bought a bunch more to take back to my family. I know I was excited to bring back a Homer doughnut for my sister because she loves when she gets Simpson stuff from me. Good doughnuts, cute place: A+ doughnut shop.

LdGqiYfUFOeEFrpujkZpCg.text: Donut Bar Vegas was just as good as the one in San Diego and the one that was in Costa Mesa that changed hands! Great donuts

b8bohcpDlu8lNUqc3jsZwg.text: The store closed at one, we come in late, get three of the last donuts, but they are unbelievably delicious. They are not too sweet, soft and tasty.

eXkM6kEdUeV-1sGXwP0eng.text: Each individual donut is an edible work of art... ALMOST as good to look at as they are to eat (ALMOST)!  Fair prices, cite place, friendly welcoming staff... It's a winner!

5-RsBll8QXdtCd6jmJ7dFw.text: Super friendly and helpful staff. Typical gigantic donuts. The Poptart filled donut is actually delicious.

xwKKoeriF5nWbbPe-Z7-8w.text: Amazing! I highly recommend the maple apple beacon fritter! Wowzers!!! Their coffee is on point.

81FjnwZjdfg-DbnCERa9Rg.text: We are from OC. Went to Vegas & were recommended this place. I saw that the hours were until donuts sell out,  which was weird (looks like they close on average between 1 & 3). We decided today, on our last day in Vegas to show up right at opening (Thursday btw) we showed up at 6:55 am, we were the 2nd person waiting for them to open (Yes, waiting) the lady in front of us drive from an hour away for a donut for her boyfriend who's bday was today. Before we knew it, 3 more people behind us BEFORE opening. The people behind us also raved about this place. We purchased 3 Triple Chocolate, 2 Cinnamon Sugar Donuts with Whip Topping and FRESH Strawberries, a Strawberry Cheesecake and I personally tried at least a bite of each flavor & loved them all. We also purchased a Homer donut, which I didn't try and was told it was a little dry..but it's not my cup of tea anyway..lol. My husband tried an Apple fritter which he loved so much that he texted me while at work to let me know he loved it. I have a nutella donut saved for tomorrow's breakfast and can't wait!! I was told that they do not make the same flavors daily,  which is pretty cool and probably a bummer at the same time..but definitely a good reason to come early!! The lady behind the counter was friendly and knowledgeable, quick and patient with us indecisive customers which was greatly appreciated. I had been recommended the Horchata donut but was told they only make those at the San Diego location. Sounds like I'll have to make a trip, lol. But...will definitely be back to this location since Vegas is our home away from home!!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciousness!!

nABB6an5_nFPFFEluiqUVQ.text: Exceptionally good donut that originated from san diego. My triple chocolate donut is so good for a bucks plus staff n store are cool.

CawQcOAdh2A1lcPQgJo1DA.text: I've been here twice during my travels to Vegas and I've lucked out on skipping long lines when I've visited. I follow them on Instagram, which I would suggest to anyone interested in going, as they always have updated menus and will let their customers know of any new donuts. I've tried a variety of their donuts: creme brulee, bacon cinnamon roll, strawberry cream, French toast and more. French toast donuts are only available on weekends and those are must-haves!  They also have a homemade strawberry milk which reminds me of when I had strawberry Quik as a kid. :)

n7uvo92Gfkdi9ZB7HmdPuw.text: Best Donuts in town! This place rocks! Great selection and everything is fresh and on point!

T4yWjctIU1_LZhfcdsqe_g.text: Love this place. They have THE most amazing donuts. Their staff is very friendly, and everything is reasonably priced. Get there early because they close when they are sold out of the daily batch of donuts already made. With each donut purchased, (at least for my kids) you get another free large sized donut in your box. So cool. My kids loved this place. We got the Double Chocolate Donut and the Birthday Cake Donut, pictured with this review, along with our two freebies. Oh, and they also hand out balloons for the kids!! They have some seating inside, but most is outside in the back of the bar. Such a great place. I highly recommend.
