RnQal9RDxPCrXim6Yx1s9g.text: Cheeky names for the 'nuts and a fair selection of creative flavor combos. My wife and I actually both thought our filled options were too big - but more of a donut:filling ratio issue. The bakers and 'nut slingers were attentive and excited to walk us through the options despite the other few customers behind us (we don't take long, but not being rushed on your first trip in is a big bonus).  The location was easy to find, a bit off the downtown drag, but an easy walk.

Sa778YtLoBSADk4R4UgWDg.text: We got the closing special so we tried a lot of donuts. Honestly I think they're okay. I've had specialty donuts and these were cool but I wouldn't come back. I didn't particularly care for any of them, I didn't like the donut batter itself. The creme brulee wasn't sweet enough and I don't normally like super sweet things but something was just off. These aren't bad but aren't the best specialty donuts I've had.   The search continues!

_qgdqUAssDuAh41prGdp6Q.text: I don't understand the hype. They taste mediocre at best.  Super bready, if you've ever been to NYC and had Dough Donuts they're reminiscent of those, but still not as good. Dough has a good balance of fluffy, bready and chewy, these are just bready. TBH they kinda taste grocery store esque with more unique flavors (not that grocery store donuts are all that bad...just "standard") I've tried a lot of donuts ever since moving to Las Vegas and so far these have been at the bottom of the list...I'd rather wait for the red sign to go on at Krispy Kreme. Again they're not bad, they're cute but not up to the hype that people have been reviewing or talking about. Is it bc they're downtown in the "cool hipster area?" I say hit up Glaze at S. Fort Apache in SW

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8DD4-KtI3SY5zOR7RQP2vA.text: I can't rate the quality of the donuts, due to the poor service I received I left without purchasing any. If you have a certain greeting for your 1st time customers, it should be practiced with ALL first timers not just those the staff choose to give the new customer greeting to. When I made it known that the same courtesy was not given to me, the response was "well do you want to buy anything", after that disrespectful treatment I made the choice to not patronize this business ever!!!!

yT0_d8YhAp2Ku5QBQAyn6A.text: I've been here about ten times. 6 for just a cup of coffee, 4 for the donuts. I don't get it. I try and try and try and I can't bring myself to get excited over them. We came here when they first opened and I thought "They don't have their temperatures/ measurements converted to the altitude of Vegas" as they're a shop based out of San Diego if I'm remembering correctly.   If you order a plain donut that's not filled or stuffed with a cookie, they're all dry :(. The worst part is that they're so expensive. A single plain donut is $2. Anywhere else a single glazed donut is .99 cents or less. They only get more expensive the more "creative" they get. The French toast donut is really good but doesn't need the syrup or extra blueberry topping since the donut is already covered in powdered sugar AND glaze. When you're feeling extra gluttonous I think it hits the spot. The only other saving grace is their hazelnut Kona coffee which I think I found the same one online so I can save myself the trip, parking meter fee, and disappointment of dry donuts.

covkdfjAlKDMKQogb3aGJQ.text: I was very excited to try these donuts. I finally made time to go to this donut shop on my day off. I purchased 4 donuts & was given an additional 4 donuts for free. The customer service was good, but the donuts were not. I was sadly disappointed in these donuts. I will most likely choose another place to buy donuts whenever I get a craving.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

42Pgz3lAbzFPEnuPXJQXKg.text: First time here. Straight from the airport. Saw the hype on yelp and facebook.  No line and plenty of parking.  Close to downtown.   Only got a few..  their creek brulee is a signature item. Hard crispy sugar shell. Yeast insides with custard filling. Looked good.   I had the strawberry pop tart which has an actual pop tart inside. Yeast around the pop tart. It was good but not the best ever. A bit dry. This put them on the map.   Had the Meyer lemon blueberry cake donut. Wow!  It was delicious. I could've eaten maybe 5. Crispy edges. Moist and soft inside. Bursting with blueberry flavor in the cake. Nice lemon flavor icing.    Not too sweet. I would get again if in walking distance.   It's a bit overwhelming as there are so many options and I wanted to try so many.   Also got a Hawaiian coffee and it was very tasty. Staff was very friendly.   Recommend if you are a donut fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooo many options.
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The package...
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Meyer lemon blueberry.

849GYJlPKILtk-GZZo3ulQ.text: Decent donuts. Wonderful staff. Insane prices. All in all, if you know what you're in for, you'll have a great experience.

KDpPAWYE8z3eq-q5IfK4Fg.text: I've tried donut bar before, but I came here for the ice cream donut cone. They don't serve them til after 10 am, so plan accordingly if you want to try it.   I also ordered the creme brulee and strawberry cheesecake. The creme brulee has a hard caramelized top that I think is way too thick. The filling inside was really good, however the donut itself was a little dry. The strawberry cheesecake had an ample amt of filling but the dough was also dry. Onto the reason I came here...the cone isn't really a donut. It's more like a pastry covered in sugar. The soft serve was good, but for $6, would I get it again? No

I8NwH0cGxT7s-s6_B1Fn8Q.text: Is the hype real?  I'm still sitting on the fence about it, but I've been here a few times (if that says anything)! Creme Brulee is definitely my favorite and worth coming back for. I love that they have vegan options! I've tried The Big Poppa and Strawberry Split, which are raved about via social media and they aren't bad but elaborate donuts just aren't my thing. So maybe I'm writing this review from a sort of biased stand point.  Customer service is on point! Always. Any time, any day. Chef Jeff is fantastic and I love that he is so involved! You can see him here as soon as they open and even during the last few minutes before they close. That speaks volumes to me.  The one thing holding me back from giving it a 5 star review is the texture. They are more bread-like in texture and taste vs a traditional donut. When I think of a donut, I think of an almost fluffy, light, fried piece of heaven. It's not heavy (unless it's a cake donut, which in that case.. YUM) but it's not airy either. Am I making any sense? I hope so.   That being said, as aforementioned, I have been a repeat customer and will continue to do so in the future. I have a few more vegan ones to try. Love that their menu changes daily and that they post it on Instagram!

PPZa-gLkBdZ1ZrYIIqT26w.text: Four stars for creativity. Donut Bar knows how to knock your socks off.   Located Downtown LV, there is plenty of street parking. Get there early because a line can form quickly that will run outside along the building. Once you are ready to have your order taken, the staff is there to load your belly. Take note that the donut selection runs outside of the case. There are layers of trays behind you ready to be eaten and don't forget to look at their menu board.   The Oreo Birthday Cake has been my favorite so far. There is a full Oreo inside. I mean, don't. Who doesn't love Oreos?? You also can't go wrong with the classic maple. It's a must for me.   The selection here is fierce. So many donuts to try, so little time. Stop by the donut fish tank and snap a photo. Grab a cup of Cold Brew and go (do)nuts!

We ended up with about 15 donuts, including the lemon blueberry (delicious ), a massive strawberry sugar whipped cream, strawberry pop tart donut, creme Brulee, chocolate buttermilk bar, and chocolate bacon.   Check in gets you a free drip coffee or espresso !!   The staff here is super friendly and welcoming, and I would definitely come again because they have lots of different flavors to try and it never gets boring.

cvyYhYhD6XVE3UJtNrA-pA.text: Got four donuts and were even given some freebies to try since it was the first time visiting and hearing of the place. All were yummy and unique. Atmosphere was perfectly donut themed and employees were great!

cfKjjo4-By42IeGdF619Ag.text: OMD - Oh My Donut! When in Sin City, one must succumb to all of their vices. So when I discovered this sweet, sweet little gem of a donut shop in old downtown Las Vegas, I knew this was one vice I could not resist. But be warned, if you do not come to the Donut Bar before noon, chances are they will be sold out for the day. And trust me, they sell out fast. This place was so good, I had to come twice in two days to try more flavors of their donuts.  On my first visit, I ordered the strawberry cream cheese donut and a blueberry donut with Meyer lemon frosting. The donuts were dense but not overwhelmingly so. The strawberry cream cheese was a little too sweet for my liking but had good strawberry flavor throughout the frosting and the donut. The blueberry donut with Meyer lemon frosting was delicious. The flavors were simple but spot on.  On my second visit, I opted for the salted caramel donut and the Apple crumb donut. The salted caramel was by far my favorite (that I've tried so far). The Apple crumb was tasty with good apple flavor throughout but a little too heavy for my liking.   They have so many flavors to choose from and their flavors appear to rotate almost daily. But like the saying goes, "the early bird gets the worm". Don't be the bird that misses out on these amazing donuts.

DyBnTMaTyqJchPIsmembHw.text: So this place is within walking distance from my hotel and man it was delicious and the donuts all look so pretty. I got myself a Boston cream and an expresso. My 5 year old got the chocolate donut. We enjoyed it so much we decided to stop by again the next day after lunch and it was closed cause they were sold out. My son was literally in tears. He really wanted to have a donut again. I was taking a picture of the sold out sign when he looked up at the right time I got the cutest sad face from being donutless. I recommend to go there before 12 noon.  I highly recommend this place.

S8IXo67GWKgghujHOIORAA.text: I've been visiting the Donut Bar for years. My love started at their OG location in San Diego, and trickled over into Vegas. They offer 5 rotating vegan options, but the best part is their #1 best selling donut, the Creme Brulee is fully vegan, and no one ever knows.  For my kids, not vegan I bring home the classic Oreo birthday cake donut. It's a donut with an Oreo inside, cake frosting, and sprinkles. My dairy eating friends tell me it's heaven. The strawberry shortcake donut is best eaten with two hands. No knife or fork needed, pick that bad boy up and dive in. These are serious donuts meant to be eaten with gusto. The creme brulee top will crack when you bite into it, giving your mouth a journey between soft dough, creamy vanilla bean pudding type filling, and a crunchy candy shell. It's phenomenal.

9N-i-a0Y8Med6cX-wzVTTA.text: I met a friend here to play catch up and try their vegan doughnuts. It's located on 6th and Carson and parking is plentiful... bring change or a credit card. All parking is metered.   I walked in and was greeted by a super friendly staff. Everyone was so nice and welcoming. My friend was there waiting with a vegan green matcha tea doughnut, a creme brulee, and a apple fritter. We headed outside to the court yard and went to town.   The apple fritter was the best donut I've ever eaten. It was crispy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside. There was real apples scattered throughout the donut. The green matcha tea was a delicious cake donut that wasn't overly sweet and had orange zest. It was delicious. The creme brulee was soft and oozed out a delicious and thick creme. I was thoroughly impressed... in fact... it was happy hour when we were done so I got an entire variety box for 5 dollars and gave them to my family and friends.   This is definitely my new favorite donut place. I can't wait to come back and try more of their vegan options!

8aBh3A1snAGpaAOeAPLHdA.text: So excited to finally check this place out and it didn't disappoint. Between four of us we shared several donuts and highly recommend doing that so you can try a little, or in the case of the Big Poppa Tart, a lot, of each. We also had the Creme Brulee which was excellent and the crunch of the sugar topping added a unique texture to the cream filled donut. A must try when visiting. Other donuts we had were the Apple Crumb Cake, Strawberry Shortcake, Boston Cream, and the Nutella overload. Every donut was made really well and unlike some donut shops we've been to, these weren't overly sweet or too rich. They were a perfect balance with the dough itself being fluffy and light. As far as decor there is a nice and quite fitting tribute to Homer Simpson around and if he were to try Donut Bar he'd definitely approve! I would say the one downside of this location is just the location itself and size. It's towards downtown so you need to take lyft/uber/taxi if visiting from out of town and staying on the strip. The shop itself has an incredible display for all their donuts but since it's a small building only has bar stool seating for about 8-10 people. We lucked out and had enough seating but I imagine due to the popularity of these donuts there may be times where they don't have enough space for groups to sit together. A great donut shop overall and when in Sin City worth making the trip out to downtown for.

I have been anticipating trying these heavenly breaths of life for months (when I frequented SD often, but could NEVER get up early enough to experience one). Well this morning, I was determined to make it happen. Since its recent opening downtown, I had no excuses to push this aside; Get out of bed and get those darn donuts before they sell out...AGAIN!  Me + 2, 8am, slightly raining and a line out the door, I seriously couldn't have been more excited. The line of people were also in a good mood which made the wait pleasant. Standing in the rain, 1/2 awake, and before coffee!?? I could've cared less, especially because my experience was great.  Once in the door, the menu was pleasingly overwhelming, incredibly creative options, and Vegan options as well. We got the creme brulee, Strawberry Split, French Toast, and the Maple Bacon Cinnamon Rolls.  To the staff: You are epic!! The upbeat attitude, smiles all around, and patience during your power hours are much appreciated. It felt like we were being hosted in your home AND that we were the only customers there during our order. You unexpectedly exceeded my expectations with your service and good vibes

YyF-49JRj5Ui1isUim2FFw.text: Just as good as the San Diego location!  We get a lot of well known eateries from other cities opening in Vegas.  Not all of them live up to the hype.  Donut Bar definitely does.    I came in around 11 am during their soft opening.  There was a short line that moved quick.  I was getting donuts for a few people so picked a good variety: Caramelized Pineapple, Caramel Latte, Cake Batter, Mud Pie, Red Velvet, Samoa, Chocolate Twix, Blueberry Cheesecake, Banana Caramel and Apple Fritter.  Half went to work with Hubby and half came home with me.  It is hard to pick a favorite but if pressed I would say the Caramel Latte and Samoa were the faves out of the ones I tried.    They post the next days flavors the night before on social media.  Check it out before you go so you have an idea of what you want.  They are listed in store too but the line moves quick so be ready.  Not all of the varieties fit on the counter so don't miss a flavor because you didn't read the list.    Don't forget a drink.  They have Stumptown Cold Brew, Nitro, Chocolate and Strawberry Milk on tap.  See you in line.

7zMN06Kv6Ac6oPeomBZ8GQ.text: Easiest 5 stars EVER.   First of all it's donuts so thats an easy 4 stars just for existing. The location is a bit tucked away which adds to the mystique of this dynamic donut experience. If you're staying in the downtown area and you have a free morning forget cheap steak and eggs. Bloody Mary's can wait... and a breakfast buffet is usually disgusting. These gourmet donuts will change the way you look at this breakfast novelty forever.  Anything with bacon comes with REAL bacon. Not those stingy little crumbles at other places. This bacon was thick cut, maple cured, and had a crunch that sticks to your jaws. EVERY SINGLE FLAVOR POPPED! The glazes are delicious and leave you with an angel like after taste.   I suggest looking at the pictures. Try not to drop your phone with amazement. Yes the presentation is an important part of a business like this. The passerbys or window shoppers will NEVER be disappointed walking into this business. These oversized breakfast treats are worth every penny.   Here's a few suggestions - Creme Brulee ( it cracks when you bite into it) - Brad Fritter ( its an apple fritter covered in caramel drizzle and a mountain of THICK cut bacon) - The Homer ( its a giant donut just like the one from the Simpson's) - Chai Latte ( it was like sipping on a cloud)  5th star factor for me was easily the mountain of bacon I received on top of my donut. It was definitely more then the 2 strips of loneliness you get at a Denny's or any other morning diner. The service was excellent, but damnit the bacon was over the top.

UeM_X0DrE3JR167Z0Lprog.text: Love it how they have so much to choose from And also it really satisfies your cravings that's for-sure I love this place overall amazing and I really can't wait to bring my family here to try them out well worth it I appreciate this place for not only having a good selection but amazing service

TZFIoGXKOn7B6eh-9DVtiQ.text: Had the peanut butter cup donut and it was moist and delicious. I usually get their vegan donuts, but today I had a regular cake donut. I highly recommend this place. The service is friendly and the donuts look as good as they taste.

TArXv-KRacd9u3Cxvf347Q.text: So after the amazing opportunity to eat these donuts at an elite event, I wanted to come by and see the selection in person.  Early on a weekday, I stopped off and picked up 6 donuts for the secretary and I to share.    This donut shop is gourmet and heightened flavors.  When I brought home the extra donuts for the hubby and kids, they generally ignored them.  I was disappointed, but the hubby said that the flavors were outside of the kids wheelhouse.    I know that the place has kid friendly options on the weekend and the chocolate milk on draft will draw my little one in.  So, maybe, I need to bring them in and let them pick their own flavor options.  Here's what we tried.  The dipped old fashion was eh.  The Pop Tart was amaze-balls.  Coworker and I took turns with the plastic knife as we cut off sections.  The jelly inside is tasty.  The frosting is perfect and not too much.  The bacon on top of the Brad fritter should just be served by itself.  I wanted to eat it all.  Coworker told me to, as she like the fritter, but the bacon was a bit off putting for her.  She had the blueberry cheesecake; didn't share.  Split the creme brulee.  The cracked sugar top is interesting.  The star of the show, in my opinion, is the creme filling.  Looking for a weekend to go back.  I hear the trick is to get there early, as they sell out of flavors.

l57AuR6TQKZtex0ABpH1hA.text: Short Review:   Donut Bar originated in San Diego and places an emphasis on fresh, tasty, picture worthy, and creative donuts.  If a caked donut full of sugar is your thing, then give Donut Bar a try.  Donut Bar is considered one the best and their customer service is excellent.  Just be early because these donuts sell out fast.   Longer Review:   I remember the excitement when Donut Bar opened in Las Vegas.  I'm not going to lie.  I wasn't that excited when I heard the news. I didn't bookmark this place and had the opinion that Donut Bar was just hype. I'm originally from the 619 and remember when the first Donut Bar opened their doors in Daygo. I was one of those people that waited in line. The owner of that location was pretty cool and would walk by the line with full sized donut samples to patrons waiting to get in. Originally, I wasn't a fan.  I had a few failed visits because their donuts were either out or I got something that was too sweet.  I always picked a donut that just didn't "wow" me. I am also not into a cake donut with a bunch of sugar on it. I'm really boring when it comes to my donuts. I prefer a chocolate glazed raised donut, maple bar, cruller, or an apple fritter.  That's all I really need or want when I'm in a donut shop.  But when the girlfriend loves donuts, then you support her by eating donuts.  I have been here a couple of times since grand opening week.  I've tried the Samoa, The French Toast, Cake Batter, Caramel Latte, the Big Poppa Tart, Creme Brulee, Matcha Cake, PB&J, and of course, the Homer. Their originality, freshness, and consistency stands out.  I haven't had anything here that was too oily and greasy.  Again, these donuts really do not appeal to me and in my opinion, just too sweet. But then I had their Caramel Latte.  This donut is perfectly glazed with their latte flavor.  Then a little whipped cream and caramel is added. Because this donut is large, the glaze and toppings do not give it that overly sweet taste.  The texture is also perfect and not dry at all. This donut with a cup of their hot coffee equals perfection.  I will cheat on my chocolate raised donut any day for their Caramel Latte.  This donut alone made me a fan.   2017 Yelp Review #77

ApO15yAt0XyYvNZ_XZpcaQ.text: Let's preface this review to say that Donut Bar claims to have the best donuts anywhere. I'll say that they're right, after visiting them for the first time, trying their donuts (multiple kinds) and a shot of their Espresso. Better than Voodoo Donuts! Why do I say that?   1. The recipes are fresh and homemade. I can taste it. No pre-made dough, no dough conditioners. Just pure, tasty donuts. Yum.  2. Great customer service. I didn't catch the name of the person who assisted me, served my donuts and pulled my espresso shot, but she was so friendly and peppy and happy and that was such a good espresso shot.  3. That was a really good espresso shot.  I'll be back. Five Stars.

_AaOsyFnDvtVxbC8kMwPDw.text: Not everything I was expecting it to be. I was so hyped up from what I've seen on social media but Donut Bar just ended up being okay.   The service was good. We did order online, got a confirmation email & then when we showed up they never received our order. We ordered 20 donuts online for us and friends, so I couldn't remember all the exact donuts. I ordered what I did remember and the girl that helped us was extremely sweet and threw in some extra donuts for the inconvenience, which we appreciated.   As for the donuts, they were all just standard donuts. The only amazing donut was the pop tart donut. It was incredible & totally lived up to the hype!! Our creme brulee donuts were soggy on the bottom and the dough tasted like burnt oil. The raspberry cheesecake didn't taste like raspberry cheesecake at all. The lemon blueberry was decent. The original donuts were good but nothing special.   Overall I was just hoping for amazing donuts but they were all subpar. Minus the poptart donut, everything was okay. I've had better donuts at places like Donut Mania or Fractured Prune.

ZfgJswSLZI1VIjvDzHpEDQ.text: I wish I could rate this place from my experience. I got here around 11am but they were closed because they were sold out!!! I mean it gotta be really good to sell out 3 hours before their closing time and I'm sure they have a pretty good estimate on how much supply they should have for Sunday right?

Db2hRcYjgkPrNxFFT4gbtQ.text: I don't understand why this place is so popular.. they donuts are dry AND expensive. The three stars are for the great service we received!

zwoYPojFeAGLaHXXlgVgSQ.text: While not mind-blowing in taste, the donuts are of quality. Yeast donuts are the game here, not cake, and so you will find fluffy, fresh, artsy indulgences here. It's all about the Instagram-worthy photo opportunities. If that's your thing, along with jumping on an undeserved hype bandwagon, you'll love it. If you enjoy donuts for taste and nostalgia, then graded meh+. Continuing the trend of designer donuts, DB rolled on to the scene in 2016. Since then, there's been a dedicated following. They will tell you as much on their website, which is a paragraph or two of self back-patting about celebrities and high-profile mentions.   People love it!  I like it.  When people who haven't been ask about it, I reply, "it's fine."  What has me unimpressed can be boiled down to one word: frantic. -- Parking is abysmal thanks to the location. It often can't be found or you're charged for a 15minute run-in to grab a box. -- On multiple occasions when I was first trying to check them out, they were sold out before noon. Set yourself up for disappointment before you even arrive. Donuts are a morning treat, a routine, a comfort food item. I've never experienced a donut shop that has as part of its marketing that, "hey! we're soooo popular, we run out of our own product before it's even time for lunch, so get on down and fight for a parking spot and a donut. Whee!"  -- The inside is decorated trendy pop pop fun fun, part of the whole experience. But the space inside is cramped, uncomfortable. You walk in and your back is against the wall in a tight funnel herding you towards ordering, which makes everything feel urgent urgent urgent. HURRY.   Claustrophobic? Go to a more spacious donut shop that doesn't run out of product, has hospitable parking, and allows you some elbow room for moving about.  I will say, though: those French toast donuts I turned my nose up at? Pretty incredible. ALMOST worth the effort to gamble on there being one available.

As this was my first visit, I wanted to get a variety of treats to sample. I ordered the French toast doughnut. I don't often use the word heavenly, however that description applies to the French toast doughnut. It was exquisite and large enough for both my wife and I to split. We also ordered the strawberry shortcake doughnut. That was tasty as well. The bacon maple longjohn and the bacon cinnamon roll were both awesome treats combining the salty of bacon and the sweet of the doughnut.  The staff including Chef Jeff were all nice and very friendly in a genuine way.  I will definitely be back on my next trip to Vegas.

lTu7vgwAbet-t8QaACQtow.text: We frequent the original donut bar in San Diego so decided to stop by the one by Fremont street (downtown Las Vegas) while in town for the 4th of July. The place is pretty inconspicuous so easy to drive past, with paid parking all around, although we risked it and just parked and ran in to grab our doughnuts to go.   First thing different we noticed was that there was hardly anyone there. We arrived about 35 minutes after they opened and walked right in. Normally at the one in SD you can expect a line of 20+ people waiting before they open. Maybe we caught them at just the right time since we noticed more people start to show up as we were leaving.  The place is a bit smaller, and it seems like the selection may be smaller too. I also noticed that they don't give kids free doughnuts like they do at the one in SD. The staff were just as friendly and welcoming though, and we were not disappointed with the doughnuts we picked, just as delicious!  If you're staying in downtown or have a car if you're on the strip, definitely worth the trip!

hnU6hCP1AxFbJT_bmFTlCA.text: This place is awesome!!! The people there were very friendly, nice atmosphere and overall good vibes. Probably the best donuts I've ever had, you should try the Mexican hot chocolate one and the birthday one!!!

HmFBYZp9UcxtE7VU_XvS0A.text: This is an update from my orginal post.  This is now my second time visiting Donutbar and unfortunately it will be mt last. I totally understand the excitement about this location and how it reminds people of Voodoo Donuts from Portland but it's not the same. What makes Voodoo Donuts different from Donut Bar here in Las Vegas is that they never out.  They are continuously making their popular donuts for the people.  For example, if Donutbar knows that their French Toast donut is only sold on the weekend, then they should make enough, due to it's popularity.     In regards to their donuts they are super soft and fresh I truly enjoyed the split open strawberry donut because the strawberries are fresh and whipped cream is really smooth,Fresh & Light.  The strawberry cheesecake donut simply tastes like a strawberry jelly filled donut.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open face strawberry split donut and strawberry cheesecake donut

dTaeCAI6SD-DqxJzz3a2gQ.text: Every time we've attempted to go to the original SD location, we were deterred by the line wrapped around the building. So after our quick brunch at Bronze Cafe, we peeked over at Donut Bar and were shocked to be able to see the front door. It also gave us the chance to continue our tradition of donuts on road trips.  We walked in and perused the daily menu and made our way to the display case. The one that jumped out at me was the split donut stuffed with strawberries and whipped cream. My boyfriend stalks DB on Instagram and knew he wanted the Big Poppa Tart. I asked the sweet girl helping us out what the vegan options of the day were: apple fritter, creme brulee, chai latte cake donut, and yes, that strawberry cream beauty was in fact, a vegan soy-based whipped cream. The decision was easy for me because I'm not a big apple fan. One of each, minus the fritter.   The creme brulee was of the yeast-risen variety. On top of the golden brown donut was a cap of hardened caramel that shattered at the first bite. Bite two yielded a rich ooze of vanilla bean-specked custard. The chai donut was exactly what I wanted. I'm a lover of cake donuts and this one did not disappoint. There was nothing "vegan-tasting" about it. It was just a great cake donut. The warm spices gave this a Fall feel and I was happy this was an option available in May. The strawberry cream donut was saved for last. I discarded the top because by the time I reached this, it was a little dry. The cream was dense, but still light and I couldn't believe it was dairy free. The strawberries were perfectly selected, juicy and sweet.   I enjoyed the cake donut over the yeast-risen ones, but that's always been my preference. Still, I was very impressed by the vegan offerings. Street metered parking was easy to find because the location is in Old Vegas area.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big Poppa Tart, vegan strawberries and cream, vegan chai cake donut, vegan creme brulee

_bxua3fgbpZnjdObMDq5TQ.text: Who doesn't love donuts!?   This place has it all.  A cool sign and tons of options for breakfast...   The decor is simple but elegant.  I liked the fish aquarium display.  I had the bacon bear claw which was huge.  I also tried their iced coffee with nitro.  Got here as they opened so the line wasn't long yet but it was within 15 minutes.  I suggest getting here in the AM to snag parking.  Be warned all spots surrounding this place are paid parking... tow trucks circle around and so do the police.  You can pull up the the loading/unloading zone and be in and out in a flash.  Service was just as good as the donuts.   Be sure to take a minute to check out the restroom. You can thank me later.  I'll frequent this place moving forward when in Vegas.  Be back soon...

xGhOA2A01jaYPjrXJd-AoA.text: I like my donuts, just look at my Yelp reviews. I visit donuts shops or bars or store fronts often.   The ambience is great, the decor is definitely interesting, even the bathroom is painted with Homer Simpson and his donut. If you're a fan of the show Tanked, then the fish tank if the lobby will interest you because it's one of theirs.   Their donuts are definitely a site to behold, all creatively decorated and looking delicious.   However, I have had better donuts. I got a Wonder Woman donut, it was cute and it was good, but it wasn't really anything to rave about.   My friend got a donut too, but her's was dry. Like take a but and crumbs everywhere dry. I don't think that should be the case when you eat donuts.   So it's a cool place to see, but I don't know if I would make the effort to go back.

7LpvBqTTPSN1JQSV9xAotg.text: Best donuts in the world these are not. (Depite Donut Bar's claim).   Saw this place in the evening after it had closed while walking near the Fremont district and made it a point to return on Saturday morning based on the excellent reviews. Ultimately was disappointed.  There were some highlights: fast service and an efficient setup to get customers in and out quickly. I always appreciate that. They also have some interesting flavors and combos.   Lowlights: All our donuts were dry. Not being dry is the number one requirement for a good donut, and Donut bar basically failed on that one, precluding it from anything more than three stars. I also think the bacon on pastries thing has passed its prime.  Ultimately Donut Bar has decent donuts, but they were dry and I wouldn't again venture out of my way to return.

tZPdxAClfjY75R2mByuQnQ.text: Once upon a time I would say that waking up early and heading to the local donut shoppe prior to opening, waiting outside discussing what indulgences we will enjoy as we waft in the delicious aroma sounded like a scene from some cute 80's or 90's romantic comedy. Well in a world where life inmates art, that is exactly the concept behind the now nationally recognized Donut Bar.   I work in a hotel in Downtown San Diego, and people from around the country ask for this place, by name! With a line out the door all the time, arrive early and expect to wait, but don't worry, you will not me disappointed. Its like willy wonka drank a bunch of local craft beer and conceptualized some of these out of this world breakfast desserts.   My suggestion is to buy at least 3: 1 to eat immediately. 1 to sit down upstairs and enjoy with some coffee. and 1 to give to someone else.

zp9305dkBzxFSvO_ZlnHTw.text: If you have an addictive personality stay away. The donuts are works of art and taste equally good. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and now unfortunately no other donut will ever stack up.

2uEh2d3sa2yqFqs32SdhBA.text: Hands down the best donut I've ever had!! The PB&J was INSANE! The staff is so nice and friendly, such a fun environment. Tried it while I was in town from Utah and this will now be a stop every time I'm in town.

Kqk6yCzGt7lfIjeWdtpuvw.text: I have made every attempt to come here for either donuts or there churro cone ice cream and each time they are either closed or they ran out. I'm done trying.

3eL_2LbaFgfcax1jVeQuPw.text: I, like everyone else, saw the creme brulee cracking video on Facebook, so i had to try this place. I was in town for my bachelorette party, but i visit every month so its like I still live here. I ordered a shit ton of donuts the night before because that's the only way u can try these donuts and guarantee you get what they make that day, without waiting in line. Metered parking out front, long ass line out the door. Walked right up and asked for my order. Was prompt, staff was friendly. Donuts were meh. The best part was cracking the donut in person. Everything else was grocery store quality.

FTZabTOlvAm8OYOzNA6kww.text: Passed by here after we got brunch since they had French toast donuts on Sundays and boy, did we get lucky! We got the last french toast donut and it was AHHHHMAZING! Not too sweet and very fluffy! We also got the pineapple, creams brulee, red velvet and birthday cake Oreo donuts and cafe lattes for the road. They were all superb! Really loved the donuts, cozy spot and the people working there. The donut chef was even working the register and chatted with us since we were visiting from LA. Super nice & yummy donuts!! We ate our donuts in the back where they had tables and murals, great bonding spot! Will be back again to try the rest!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ifGYOY4xs8yOX5-YHnxUZA.text: I am a big fan of the Donut Bar in San Diego so on our Las Vegas visit this weekend, we decided to stop and pick up some donuts.   The donuts are very yummy. But I feel like the location is kind of out of the way and the shop is VERY small. Basically five star donuts but three star location and shop size.

GT1wt07zc6J8kTYMMEqy3g.text: Had to stop by donut bar and grab to some treats for a date night with the lady. Donut bar is very creative with their menu, everything we had tasted great my only gripe was some of the donuts tasted stale, I think this has more to do with the way they are being displayed and stored which ends up drying them out faster, because the make all their stuff fresh everyday and when they run out they are out. This brings me to my second point, the earlier you go the better these donuts taste, and the more variety you get. Overall I would say try it for yourself  not sure what it's called (apple fritter maybe) was amazing. Definitely going back and recommending to friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mashup of goodness we went with

wxPyzuCJ10G7u6rwkIG0dw.text: I was beyond excited to finally try this place, because of all the hype about it being the best! We pretty much grabbed each flavor so I had a pretty good taste of most of them. Most of them tasted the same and not really their actual flavor, but they were soft and fresh so that was good. The one I enjoyed the most had to be the Creme brulee. The donuts are decorated amazing which is probably why they are so hyped, but overall they tasted just like average donuts. The price is pretty expensive compared to other donut joints. The service was very nice and sweet, they explained to us all their flavors and their number one sellers which was great. I'm glad I finally tried it and got to see what the hype was all about.

pZHpI-tANSaGW0B437xITA.text: The atmosphere was great. The staff is awesome. The donuts look amazing, but I was not overly impressed with what I got. I had the creme brulee donut and the Elvis donut. Maybe I was expecting too much. I regret not trying the other ones I had considered.   The creme brulee was weird. The burnt sugar didn't work for me with the donut. It was a little too thick and works much better when it's just over a custard.   The Elvis had a peanut butter topping and a banana Bavarian cream center. Loved the peanut butter but hated the cream. It tasted like banana candy. Very artificial. I love banana and peanut butter, but real banana is better.   Maybe I'll try it again in the future, but currently I don't think paying for parking is worth it.

NLoDVMjV5Rx_zuFM1nEtyw.text: Definitely was excited to try Donut Bar out after all the hype and rave reviews I was hearing about it.  Came here on a random Wednesday morning around 8:30 am and parked on the street for $2 (didn't see any other parking).  I had heard that this place could have a line out the door with people waiting to order...I was a little worried that there might be a line to get donuts and at this point I was getting a little hangry.  Fortunately for us there were only about 4-5 other patrons inside and we didn't have to wait at all!  We were instantly greeted by the peppy workers with warm smiles and hellos, the place itself is pretty small with seating for only about 5-6 people inside.  They did say they had seating outside, but we didn't check it out because we were able to snag seats inside.   My friend and I really didn't know what to order so they gave us a couple of recommendations.  I also was super excited because they serve Stumptown Coffee from Portland here!  We ended up getting 4 donuts, 1 chocolate milk, and 1 Stumptown Coffee cold brew for the both of us all for about $20-$25.  A little on the pricier side, but just remember people these are specialty donuts not your run-of-the-mil grocery store ones.  I don't remember the specific names of the donuts so sorry in advance! -Donut with Strawberry Pop Tart In It -   Delicious, but wow this is super sweet!  My friend and I felt like we had to make an appt with our dentist after eating this one -Creme Brule Donut - This was the best one in my opinion, the outside had a nice crispy glaze covering it and when I say crispy I mean crispy, it had a tasty cream inside that wasn't overly sweet either -Lemon Cream Donut - My second favorite out of the bunch, the lemon whipped cream inside was amazing and they put a ton of the whipped cream inside too! -Boston Cream Donut Bar - This was probably the most basic donut out of the bunch, it was your standard boston cream donut bar...why my friend decided to get a basic donut at a specialty donut shop I will never know, but I digress...it was still decent!  -Cold Brew - not as good when I had it in Portland, it tasted a little bit on the bitter side but still delicious nonetheless  I for sure see myself coming back here whenever I want a tasty specialty donut, probably on a weekday morning though because nobody wants to wait in a ridiculously long line (sorry to all you normal 9-5 workers out there, I'll think about you the next time I eat here).

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4 donuts, 1 chocolate milk, 1 cold brew all for about $20-$25
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Donut Displayyy
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside Store Front

LnFf-dHvyki82QozSdJyng.text: Based on the two mornings I went to The Donut Bar I can say they have amazing presentation but the basics are lost in the details. For example, this morning I had the fritter with bacon, the bacon was high quality and perfect, but the fritter was so done the edges were almost black. I could only eat the center of it. Yesterday I had an Old Fashion and a Strawberry Cheesecake donut. The Old Fashioned was dry , maybe cooked a bit hot, and the Strawberry Cheesecake just tasted like strawberry filing, no tangy cheese to give it that cheesecake vibe.   The staff are friendly, the donuts are very beautiful, and they brew Stumptown coffee. These are all good things but I have to have more substance with my flash.

KxwQfcjT3JLDIBOVxNlRXg.text: Recently moved from SD and was happy to find out Donut Bar was here in LV ! Extremely friendly staff and the donuts are to die for. Also don't forget your coffee the Mocha's pretty good.

MwJER_HuQ5s0bYQI--YkHw.text: I had the creme brulee donut as well as few others! Great coffee and amazing donuts. I especially loved the caramelized sugar on top for the perfect crunch! Amazing donuts!

uAC2SFB-hR3b3Z0BpyWAAg.text: Love this place can't say enough about it friendly staff clean location Donuts amazing highly recommend you should stop in and try a donut

t4NY70Al_8sQwzmocoZ8SQ.text: From a donut standpoint, Donut Bar is simply dope. They were one of my favorites while in San Diego, so for me, the fact that they took over where O-face used to be is a straight up upgrade. Every donut they do is gourmet and you can tell they make them with care and keep them at top quality. They are also very community oriented and are always doing things hat put them out there so that people can put a face to the names. They were absolute life savers at Life Is Beautiful. They are also super cool because they post their menu for the next day on all their social media, so you know if your favorite donut is gonna be there and you don't have to guess. My only gripe is that they open relatively late for a donut place at 7am and it's super cool that they are open until sold out. This works out well for me since I work downtown so it's easy for me to get to but if you're not as lucky as me then you better make sure to get in as early as possible. Also, another super cool thing I'll say is that you should heck out their bathroom. It lets you know exactly how dope these people are.  Long story short, find a way down here. Eat some donuts. Walk out like a boss

YoIlEevQN2Bh_IGbrMDObA.text: I'm not a fan of fancy donuts. I've always just stuck with chocolate and glazed. nothing else appealed to me. but I LOVE these donuts. I could eat them every day. the pop tart one looked cool but I thought it'd be disgusting. but surprisingly it was my favorite one. nutella over load was amazing also. I didn't like strawberry cream cheese, it was really dry and just tasted like stale strawberry cake. I also didn't like the creme brule.

8_Usq7MOOhWb385jq63RXw.text: I've heard great things about this place and for a good reason. First, the owner (who I forgot his name--my apologies!!!) was amazing. He was super friendly, and patient (willingly to deal with my awe of his menagerie of donuts.) If you like--love donuts, this is the spot for you. I was surprised it wasn't busier, because this business is definitely a force to be reckoned with in the Downtown scene.  I will even go so far as to say it's better than Pinkbox. So if you're craving something to satisfy that sweet tooth, look no further. Also, can we talk about the milks they have on tap? Innovative, creative, and fun! I will be back and with friends ;)

vAwLGPXbFHGwtin1b5IdmA.text: We love this place!!' Delicious donuts! My hubby loves the chocolate euphoria donut. Going to bring my sister here for bachelorette as well

YxkbH1XKiOmMUxCJ8HKm7w.text: I wish I loved you. I wish we would have worked out. Maybe I'll give you another go when I'm in the area. The workers there were friendly so I gave two stars.  WHY I DIDN'T LIKE IT:  -Donuts dry. I tried several too. The creme brulee which I thought I would love but the sugary top made it hard for me to eat. The birthday cake one with the oreo in it was super dry. The blueberry donut was the saving grace out of the donuts. Pretty moist and flavorful but not enough for me to want to go back there.   WHY I NEED TO GO BACK: -I came late, maybe that's why the donuts were dry? I don't know.  -I want that strawberry whipped cream one. It looks good, so Ill go early to try it. -Everyone needs a second chance.

vVmIf5mZo6AlvD324f6J5w.text: Pre-ordered on their website (available from 3-9pm the prior day). Choice to pick up at 8, 9, or 10 am. Minimum order of 1 dozen. Not all flavors are available for pre-order (didn't realize this was the case until pickup).   Friendly customer service. They have a coffee/espresso bar as well. The Sumpton coconut cold brew sold by the single serve carton was really good. Not too sweet with a hint of coconut.  Notes for the donuts I tasted this time:   db Nutella - didn't really taste like Nutella, more like milk chocolate with crushed almonds on top. Really large size, frosting was borderline too thin for the size of the donut. The donut part had good flavor and texture on it's own, which is always a good sign.   Creme brulee - smallest in size, but I appreciated that. Really enjoyed the crunchy sugar crust. The cream was also the perfect sweetness. My favorite of the bunch.   Butter beer - larger size. I was expecting a pronounced butterscotch flavor, but didn't even get a hint. The Harry Potter theme was cute.   Lemon pistachio - larger size. Hey, this one actually tastes like lemon and pistachio! Good balance of sweetness with the lemon.  S'mores on fire - standard "normal" size. The most aesthetically pleasing. The only cake donut of the dozen. Didn't care for the actual donut part which was a little dry and lacking chocolate flavor. The marshmallow on top was good; probably made in-house?   Maple bacon - bar shape, normal sized. I'm a fan of the whole salty/ sweet thing, but this was just ok.  Caramel latte - larger size. Had good caramel flavor, but didn't detect any coffee at all.  I feel like the names of the donuts set up certain expectations, but when the flavors weren't there, it was disappointing. I am willing to give them another shot though, since I did enjoy the creme brulee.

X__Co_x9N8salk1E1bAwiA.text: Just happened to see the donut bar sign and decided to quickly stop by and grabbed a red velvet and coconut donuts! I must say they taste as good as they look. They also have variety of different donuts and they almost too pretty to eat. It's a small shop around Fremont but it can hold all those delicious donuts!

_QTRbs3PyBihbXfHLLp4SA.text: I wish you guys were closer. I miss your blood orange doughnut.

7zMmx2lRZ6YS_LWXOfacMA.text: We got there late and didn't have a lot of selection, but the donut cone was so fun and the ice cream was super yummy! Wish I had gotten there earlier!

7MgsWNejC86xT-vzZ_rW5Q.text: They have donuts as big as your face and flavors that sound plain awesome!  Luckily, they have more "normal sized" donuts on the racks behind the glass counter. xzJCszAW1w9Sn2h7E6OJ4g.text: We had high expectations for this place.  By 10am, they only had a very small selection left - none of the ones that the place is known for were available. u-WxLoxMaQPI6_UzTuhPGw.text: Wish I'd been able to get over here earlier. They closed pretty early (1pm) on a weekday and was only able to get leftover donuts. I get it though; they must want to prevent waste. I was just vacationing and wanted to try the place out. Service was quick, kind, and fair prices. Donuts that I got were good, but I'm sure would've been better fresh. Next time I'm in Vegas, I may try and make my way over here earlier in the day to get more variety.

rT1LlN2fjwkWL_twGFQ15A.text: This place was walking distance from my hotel so had to stop and check it out. Definitely would recommend to anyone visiting the area! Picked up 6 different kinds of donuts but the creme brulee one was my favorite! The butterbeer one was adorable! Would love to stop by again next time I'm in Vegas!

DleUu-RRFCDWHpOqagMZUw.text: 5 of us had 15 donuts to share between us.  Every single one was delicious.  The s'mores big poppa tart is an amazing creation.  The lemon pistachio was shockingly our favorite donut.  Lots of flavor.  Staff was very friendly.  The only negative was the limited seating area.

mTbefHhOt-73Zs519coUVA.text: Rightfully high in the ranking! These Donuts are just dreamy and so delicious! We had tasted at several other locations, but actually when stepping into their shop, we already knew we would end up here. The atmosphere is very relaxed, nice crew and great ambiance!  This is the place to go!

LgZahRG6QN8CJmRPpIVxlg.text: Great donuts with lots of fun flavors to choose from! Super patient employees who are pleased to answer all your questions or give great recommendations if you can't choose from the overwhelming choices of deep fried heaven. I highly recommend the lemon pistachio donut! Great tourist spot to check out too

ePCcs49_dH1rO5sRZB1bOw.text: Went here for the big poppa donut as I am a poptart fan. It was good but extremely sweet. Also tried the apple fritter just ok have had better and the plain was ok. The girl working there was friendly and explained all the flavors. This place is definitely not worth the hype.  I have had better donuts and is not worth the trip and certainly would not wait on line. Their claim to be the best donuts in the world is a definite no while I give them credit for creativity  they are not anything special.

c2d1VVvCOI7ZUyvZl6Z89A.text: They have a very good taste of everything. Few things that I don't like are loud music and the cashier (girl) she not smile at all , she should work at the back not front.

2AOgY-DNHgzL49ivrIZ04Q.text: My gf brought me home a box of donuts while she was working. They looked very appealing, looks can be deceiving. They honestly were probably some of the worst donuts I've ever had. They were very dry and super doughy. The donuts at Smiths are wayyyy better than this place. I will deft not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MXfa56wr_dQiIZjq22ayyg.text: Don't even ask me.how many times I've been here. Okay. Just 3 times. The creme.brulee is a vegan donut that has a candy like carmelized consistency on top of it with a vegan made custard in that sucker. It's my fave out of all the donuts! For some reason when I bite into it-it reminds me of a Filipino dessert. Sometimes the top may taste a bit burnt minus it actually being burnt. You'll know what I mean when you try it. Weekends they give away free themed donuts to the kiddos. Nothing like seeing your 3 year old elated to bite into an angry bird, minion, or even an avenger. But nothing like imagining a parents face knowing your child is about to bite into his last chunk of sugar for the month. Lol. I'm afraid to admit I've tried a lot of the stuff they have to offer and overall, think they're all right. Nothing worth setting your alarm to, although, coming in early would be ideal because duh...the fresher the better. Everyone knows going to any kind of bakery towards closing won't get the best bite. The big poppa tart donut they're raved about or known for is all right...says the person who can tolerate only so little sugar in one sitting. The one I've had was actually dry. =/ Overall, I'd still pop in on a Saturday morning with the fam...take our our donuts then walk over to the container park where the kids can release the sugar they just swallowed. Makes for a nice morning with the fam. It's worth giving it a try. I prefer this spot over Pink Box for sure...mainly because of their vegan. I dont think theyre one of those must cross the desert for. If you happen to be by and feel like a donut, then definitely give them a try. But if youre coming without a donut craving at all, then more than likely you'll find them to be all right and overhyped. Long lines some mornings. I'd skip bringing the stroller in if possible. But if you must...then you must...especially if you're in then out. Their strawberry milk on tap was pretty deelish too! And something I've learned...these donuts have beers out there that pair really well together. Mind blown.

m2OAT0UNOvUMQ8yMYaghAA.text: GET THE CREME BRULEE DONUTS! I'm surprised more specialty donut shops don't do this. Super fluffy donuts filled with vanilla custard and topped with crunchy caramelized sugar. Not only are they delicious, they're also fun to eat.   We also ordered a maple bourbon donut, a coconut donut, and a Boston cream donut. All were great! I wish we could've tried more. The shop is a cute little place and easy to find. I'm glad we tried it this time around.

TG_0xgPkyE1Kk_4RkEk8vg.text: Donut Bar is a solid donut place that is doing some fun and inventive things with their flavors. I've tried the Big Poppa (a donut with a pop-tart baked inside? done. i need it.), Butterbeer, vegan birthday cake, blueberry meyer lemon, creme brulee, apple fritter... They were all delicious. The Big Poppa and the Creme Brulee were my absolute favorite, I would highly recommend them. Their nitro brew coffee is also very good!  The shop is small and can get kind of busy, but the employees do a good job being friendly while keeping everyone moving. I think that the prices are pretty good for the product that you get. They also do free kids donuts on Saturday mornings. We've recommended this place to so many friends and have yet to have someone tell us they didn't love it!

bvjb_weBEsTBYN8T4t4Ngw.text: Jessica K. pretty much took the words right out of my mouth.  The only difference is that I had seen folks standing alongside the curb area but assumed they were waiting for some sort of church to open up,I mean the corner looked as though everyone was lined up for free Oprah giveaways Anyhow I digress.  Overall I had a lovely first time experience the staff appears to have a bond and truly show respect for one another (REAL TEAMWORK)! Also,Upon entering I took the liberty of writing down a list of donuts from their Sunday Menu. I ordered Caramelized Pineapple,DB Nutella,Coconut dream,Blueberry Lemon and Creme Brulee which were ALL simply delicious.  Indeed the BEST donuts I've tasted thus far

fMNIyvT0Z2VKAU9emR0LtQ.text: Nice people with delicious coffee and donuts. Decent selection of vegan options a plus!

RG6-Sf51_RzGbruUr7tseA.text: Not only are the donuts a work of art....but they taste amazing also.  Had the Strawberry Split and 2 of us couldn't finish it,  bit we sure tried.

yqrRE5xLQ7GDfG4Tsfy1-A.text: The Donut Bar resides in what feels like Portland in Vegas. The place smells of wonderful and fresh baked sugary goodness the moment you step in. You're immediately greeted by the sight of colorful mouth-watering donuts that line up the glass displays. Just be mindful that this place closes by 1pm so plan accordingly!  I tasted the Creme Brulee donut and the Snickers donut. The Creme Brulee donut was a bit smaller compared to all the other donuts but that shouldn't shy you away from experiencing creme brulee in this doughy goodness. What makes the donut so great is the experience of cracking that shell. The sweet creme oozes out and that first bite takes you away to some far off French patisserie. It's a donut you won't find anywhere else and is a must try if you're going! The snickers donut is good for two if you're not looking to start your day on the heavy side. I enjoyed the snickers pieces on the donut but other than that it wasn't amazing.   If you're looking to try something new off the strip I say stop in and grab a donut. They have a huge selection but they only make a certain batch of each donut. They have custards to french toast donuts and no matter what donut you're loyal to, The Donut Bar has something to keep you happy. Each donut is $2-4 so you won't have to feel guilty about your sugar fix.

Q-NZEaSgEOT1LRs42kAiPg.text: Overrated.  Stumbled upon "happy hour" and got a dozen of their donuts.  Was so hyped up due to the reviews.  Good ones:  - Cream brulee: small and creamy - Nutella overload: the nutella makes the donut - Special of the day: Rasberry pistachio - Good design on the donuts, huge portions  Not so good:do - Butter beer - Mud pie  MINUS one if not two star - the dough on almost every single one of their donuts are too dry and not soft/moist.  Example:  The butter beer donut was big and had great design, but when 85% of your dough is dry, you are left trying to eat the overly sweet cream to compensate.  Takes away from the overall enjoyment of the donut itself.

VuGlV7XCGGSwYhz5K7TTuA.text: The French Toast donut was amazing!! They only make it on the weekends or something but it's good!! The other donut I had was whatever but I'll return to try more donuts.

rbOOmw9a3hl30_tr1_CsoA.text: Wowza! We heard about Donut Bar and last week I was fortunate to have a weekday off for a change. We found Donut Bar, just off the Strip's northern end, and parked in front at the pay to park. The display is varied and colorful, while not overwhelming and the shop itself is warm and cozy. Staff are very helpful as we had lots of questions. We had already drooled over their photo of blueberry with Meyer lemon topping: amazing. So I, like a socially isolated cave hermit, right away asked "do you still ave the blueberry" while my poor husband was trying to speak. The creme brulee was the next choice, followed by Mexican Hot Chocolate and Oreo. We took some old fashioneds to go. Well, now. I post healthy foods and recipes online, but donuts are an exclusion and we do indulge! All of these donuts were superb!! We sat in the small indoor bench area next to the Donut fish tank. The coffee was wonderful- a good alternative to your run of the mill donut shop. The quality and inventiveness add up to a big 5 BFFDS for me. If you must ask, that's "best friendly fantastic donut supplier". Vegan options are here too, evidently. Check it out: DB Las Vegas is a winner!!

ECmJifUH1xXOigt7kQ0WRQ.text: Simply delicious. Always fresh and consistent. We love the customer service and the smile on everybody's face. We are visiting the location almost every Saturday with the kids and we never had a bad experience. Thank you Donut Bar for sweetening our family weekend.   I highly recommend this place to anybody that wants to try next level donuts.

H2UpznQyThAeuEb0X4KLlA.text: We loved this donut bar! Where else can you choose to have beer or coffee with a donut?! We also loved the donuts. They had such a variety. I tried their pop tart donut and it was soooo good. I had the strawberry and my fiance had the chocolate pop tart. They are a pound each. So we didn't eat the whole thing but it was awesome to try. It's cute and small and the staff is awesome. They give you suggestions on which donuts to try based on what you like. It's definitely a place to try if you're even close to Fremont Street.

kWn_O77Bz1yZ4vkTgqjdbg.text: So Glad they opened one up in Vegas (Downtown) I'm not up super early so I usually grab what's left for a dollar before  they close  and enjoy some of Donut Bars best creations. Nitro Coffee on Tap!! And don't miss the French Toast donut cooked to order on weekends only. These guys from San Diego know how to make their donuts that's for sure. A must stop while in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made to order &#34;French Toast&#34; donut  5 Buck, Huge, and worth it.  Only on weekends folks.

c7gsfb1iDsQZs4wDq9tkbw.text: Me & my kids love the Vegan donuts at this place!!! Best Vegan donuts in town! They have a nice lil patio area in the back that we also enjoy. Everyone is super nice & friendly.

sGHG_uG5lpUxKDPiLDBn0Q.text: We purchased a small box of doughnuts  Strawberries and Cream - HUGE but looks delicious Maple Bacon Cinnamon Roll - BEST Donut we have ever tasted, soft, luscious, not too sweet, real bacon... even my girlfriend who eats as healthily as possible, Raw fitness in the morning and spin at night took a few bites and didn't regret it for a second.  Vegan Creme Brulee- coworker liked it but said the top was too burnt... that's how I prefer my creme brulee so I would'v loved it Birthday Cake - Free for their one year birthday today- Husband requested I bring it home to him so I have no review of this one Red Velvet - My husband requested I bring this home too  2X Old Fashioned Plain cake donuts- My girlfriend who again is into fitness, told me this reminded her of her childhood. That made me feel so special, a taste that triggers a memory is worth WELL OVER THE 2$

b_BI0nfWgc07QMIYX8UMlA.text: Slightly off the beaten path but close enough its a can miss!  Even mid-day the place is a buz with a great mix of locals and visitors alike. They flock in and sometimes line up for the very best donuts in Las Vegas perhaps nationally.  Always fun and tasty custom creations like French toast or creme brule'. You would never find beauties like this in a grocery store or chain. They are big, but still light enough to enjoy your own, but I suggest being ready to  share a bite if given that look. You know the look.  Service is top notch, the entire crew is cool, especially Mathew

wazByXta9m69AuDc_mooVQ.text: Last morning before class, so I stopped in. I saw the Strawberry Split and had second thoughts! That's too big for this morning.  If it ain't Krispy Kreme, let me get a cake donut! I ordered the Apple Crumb & Old Fashioned w/ Vanilla Bean glaze. The Apple crumb was delicious. I expected a heavily sweet taste, but it didn't have that. The old fashioned was a tad bit crisp, but it was good.  Not a bad Yelp suggestion!

RfSpGhkd8kIGwuypMNjA9A.text: Don't limit yourself to Fremont St when visiting downtown Vegas - especially at breakfast time.     The donut bar is a block away and serves up some pretty righteous gourmet donuts.      This aint Dunkin Donuts here - they've got some funky flavors like Reeses Peanut Butter  topped with chunks of the candy bar.    The flavor is fantastic and they dress em up all fancy like =)     And the price is right too.   Coffee and a donut here costs less than just a coffee at Starbucks.

0rE9e2Vp67kNCKbhWt2pnw.text: I have been looking for a great donut place in LV for the past couple months. After maybe hours of YouTube suggestions, I decided on the Donut Bar. We were staying at a downtown hotel and decided to have a donut for breakfast. As soon as you walk into the store, you are immediately overwhelmed with the amount of choices you have! After carefully deciding, we went with 1 creme brulee and 1 Boston creme. The BC was just alright, nothing special just your average Boston creme donut. Now the creme brulee was awesome! The best part was hearing that crunch when pulled apart. I may have to figure out how to bring some back home.

4fNeKATGli2R03gi3NTspw.text: The amount of donut choices is overwhelming but the prices are reasonable for the giant donut you get! I ordered the homer and an Italian roast coffee. Both were excellent and I couldn't finish all of the donut it was so big! They have out front parking so you can easily run in and pick up your items.

tqIOLg6ldREpB0yqwhkqrQ.text: If there's one thing I love, it's fancy donuts! So knowing that I'd be in Vegas I was already doing my Yelp research on the best place to grab the best donut. Before I even left my house I had Donut Bar bookmarked.  I was staying on the Strip, but luckily our friends had a rental car and agreed to drive us to Fremont for breakfast on Sunday morning. Street parking was plentiful at 9am and Donut Bar was super easy to find. We walked in and were immediately hit with the amazing aroma of fresh donuts and I was thrilled to see the variety available.  The four of us picked out 5 donuts, and the friendly employee being the counter recommend we try out the french toast donut, so we added that to our order as well. Everything I tried a bit of was absolutely delicious, but the creme brulee donut blew my mind with how good it was! And I think it's vegan too!  I hit my sugar quota early on and threw in the towel, but boy was I kicked myself later in the day for not ordering more to go! Next Vegas trip, I'm definitely planning on returning to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unicorn donuts
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake batter donut
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee donut!

l6E8nkyK2qv8NYeqkTIzzQ.text: Forget Dunkin' or whatever other donut treat you may seek look no further than the Donut Bar. Their wickedly sinful treats will break anyone's will. My most secretive haunts when you need that sugar pick up: indulge here.  The service this last visit was amazing as always. When one eats here you seem to become family. They care that you buy their donuts and in return provide consistent service that is always amazing.  There is not a donut on the menu that I have not tried; among the top favorites are the red velvet and the birthday cake. The prices here are fair ranging from $3-6 for a single donut. Mind you a $6 donut is well worth it for the flavor, delectable taste, and size too.  When it comes to the selection of their donuts they make average size small ones that are unique and decorated to the nines. They look like pieces of art. They also make donuts where indeed size does matter! These donuts are so I demand and will curb anyone's sugar desire.  This visit I had an iced coffee as well which comes iced of course. They make it fresh brewed daily. It comes unsweetened; this is how I enjoy it. If you desire sugar or milk they have a place to add those things.  Normally I do not talk in depth about the bathroom being a place you should visit. But one should check the Simpson art decor in the bathroom. It is stupendous, hilarious, and so unique.   It is not a question if I will return here: this review was in need of an update so go get some sin donut style!!

It is on the to do list anytime I am in Las Vegas. Heads up they will sell out sometimes go early for best results

d4Xk6dBDHWtgIjaS_FkiEw.text: I'm going to start this review with a bold statement. THE BEST DONUTS IN VEGAS.  Seriously, the best. Ever.  After moving here, I felt like I would never find another good donut again but then I stumbled upon Donut Bar and all my donut dreams have come True. Donut bar just doesn't serve regular plain donuts-- you know those shops that only have cake donuts but they all have different colored frosting. meh. No, this place is the Willy Wonka factory of donuts! Some of my creative favorites are the creme brulee, homer's donut, butterbeer and the big poppa (poptart). Big giant donuts that are completely shareable with some friends, unless you are on that donut diet like I am.   If you see a crazy long line, don't leave! The line moves quickly and the customer service is on point. I strategically plan my visit during their happy hour, when they are about to close. You can fill a box for $10 and get all the donuts. Parking can be stressful since it is mostly street parking. Get ready to parallel. But no worries, a cup of their nitro cold brew will make all of your parking troubles go away.

LqpBG6e2-UeG2Mx3QUIl7g.text: I wish I had taken a picture of the teenage boys when they opened the box of the #bestdonutsintheworld. The picture would have said it all!  The donuts are as pretty to look at as they are delicious to eat.  Coffee was perfect and the blueberry, Meyer lemon donut out of this world.  Staff was super nice, friendly and helpful!

wwozD_G_VZm1q-lnpjKbkg.text: Don't miss Donut Bar on your next visit to Las Vegas! I first heard about it on the YouTube channel SayHiToMatthew and checked it out two days ago over Labor Day weekend. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the donuts are amazing. The shop is located in the downtown area which I normally try to avoid because of parking issues and vagrants wandering the streets, but it was worth the visit. I had a donut nearly as big as my head that was topped with chocolate, cinnamon and marshmallows and tasted like Mexican hot chocolate. So good!

QHZaoH_dGVD3A5bNC4ibTQ.text: All the hype not the best donuts I've ever had.. looks aesthetically beautiful, but lacks flavor and all the donuts were pretty much just all dough. We bought 8 donuts and most of it went in the trash. I live in Summerlin paid $20 for Parking and spent $35 for donuts. Wanted to see for myself what all the hype was about.  The donuts are just BIG Oversized donuts that look pretty, some average as far as taste and some were really dry.

PY4uT2iarsixNu4Lqorj2w.text: Really good donuts, but not as great as we imagined. We ordered the crepe brulee and big poppa both strawberry and s'mores and were sadly less than impressed. We thought they would have a very airy soft texture to them and they were a lot more dense than we like. They had good flavor but we definitely have to knock them on that dense part. The big poppa goes with the name because it's huge! We could barely finish one together. The do have nitro cold brew here which I'm a huge fan of and will recommend it to everyone that loves coffee! Paid around $20 for two big poppas and two creme brulee so it is a bit pricey. Overall good donuts. With the reviews though we just weren't as wowed as we thought we would be

yvAeJQsg5F-aOgsUMJxGyQ.text: I was indifferent towards Donut Bar until I tried the creme brulee donut. It's vegan and I had no idea until someone told me the second or third time I ordered it. I end up walking here from my office at least once a week now. It might take a few tries because there is such a large selection, but this place will have at least one donut you'll love.   The coffee is what keeps me coming back though. Coffee & donuts are like peanut butter & jelly! There's hot self-serve drip coffee that is solid and the cold brews are on point.

j-s-1aaffyT2txft5rccMw.text: Always my favorite donut shop but I am not downtown enough to enjoy it. Always make sure to stop by early to get prime picks or else you are left with the dreaded leftover offerings! Which are still going to be amazing, let's be honest.

HOswrWjwLmJDFEa83JzGEA.text: Creative donut and flavor combinations. Located on Carson St downtown but are only opened to 1:00 or until they sell out, so get here early if you want to try some of their favorites such as maple bacon (long donut with maple glaze and glazed bacon), cake batter (a festive frosting laden donut with sprinkles and white icing), blood orange (a sweet tangy glazed donut with tart sweet blood orange glaze and filling), birthday cake (cake donut, festive frosting and toppings), red velvet, Homer, Mexican Chocolate and so much more....they have coffee offerings, small seating area, street parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NclHd3Bs8Mpko7iHzIl-Kg.text: I'm not a huge donut fan, but Donut Bar's funky treats are hard to turn down- their DTLV location and available-til-sold-out hours make an actual visit fairly rare for me, but I've come across their donuts at various events and on appreciation tables at work pretty regularly.   I've enjoyed the Salted Caramel, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Blood Orange and Creme Brulee donuts, while the  Big Poppa Tart makes a good one to share, huge and stuffed with an actual Pop Tart and likely several days worth of sugar. I tried the Matcha on a recent visit and it was okay, small and not too sweet, but the Strawberry Split has my heart- fresh fruit, whipped cream, photogenic and shareable! Eventually I need to go back for the Caramel Latte donut and their Grilled Cheese.  TIP: Go early and check their online menu to be sure they have what you want, selection varies daily.

uhMkR1SxhoCxkjZxeJ4uaQ.text: How did I forget to write a review here!?!? What's not to love about this super awesome donut place? My favorite here is the Pop-tart Donut. It's literally a WHOLE pop tart INSIDE a donut with a sugar glaze on top and sprinkles. It's Huuuge!!! Top that with a cup of Stumptown (my favorite!) Coffee and I'm gold!   **A super plus is that on Saturday's, kids get a free donut!   I don't have any pictures to post but as you can see, The Donut Bar has lots of pictures already posted. :)

8sBdN3hG7JWjBdVaNiTxyQ.text: so reading the reviews for this shop, I was expecting some deliciousness, some extraordinary, some awesomeness and all I got was another "wtf" moment, and a feeling of "should I call and complain and ask for my money back"...I mean, I dropped $25 for 8 donuts...ya let's get to the review...  so I found myself in the downtown area recently, and remember hearing about a donut that crunched on top, looked it up and was happy it was there. so I drove over to the spot in downtown, and checked it out.  walked into the shop, it's small, narrow, but it gets right to the point. the display of donuts was very nice. they all look delicious, and in my mind I was excited to finally try the assortment I was putting together. I went for 2 of the creme brulee donuts, one that I think had a velvet cake inside, one of the poptart donuts, a white sprinkle, and a chocolate top one and some others. total was $25 (price shock hits, it's donuts!!) but ok I paid it, drove home and dove in with wifey. this is where it just went wrong.  now, I usually don't take photos, but recently I have been of the meals and stuff I'm eating or places I'm going to, and this place got the picture...  every single donut we ate was dry. they were all over cooked I guess. the batter used had no flavor or sweetness. the flavors were not there, it was like trying to enjoy it but not...I only took a bite or 2 of each donut and trashed it. throughout the day just picked at them all. when I got the one that crunches, the creme brulee one, I was just SO let down. the taste was honestly gross. that mixture of the crunch on the top of your mouth, then mixing it with a soft/dry donut that has no flavor was just really gross. and I'm not picky, especially when it comes to what should have been sweet and delicious, was a major fail.  again, every donut was dry, and they all had no flavor or bland flavoring. even the pop tart donut was a bust. the cake mix they use is just no good. I don't know if it was that day or what, but no go for me.  now, I've tried pink box donuts which was ok. the only donut shop here in town that seems to be excellent every time is Winchells on Meadows Lane with the subway. that place is 5 star superb.  I understand though, this donut bar place, it made it on tv or whatever, and people want to see it, but all these 5 star reviews  is just not possible if it's consistently like my experience when quality comes in. check out my photos...you'll see what I mean.

EWiGRsdZqmTltEJmxdIy7w.text: Love this place!! I've been here twice and both visits proved that quality is consistent. I went with the peanut butter donut and the maple bacon one and although more cake like than donut, both were delicious and worth the visit. I came late in the day on the second visit as I was with my brothers, so the selection was still good, but not everything was available. My brother loved the Nutella donut and the cream pie eclair was a hit with both of them. Coffee was strong and will definitely wake you up!  Check out the new fish tank they installed in October 2016 and this is no ordinary tank. It's filled with donut shaped ornaments that almost look like the real thing. How clever!   We'll definitely be back and maybe even try the french toast donut next time. This place is a hit  as far as I'm concerned. Parking is on the street and is metered, but I can't see anyone staying more than an hour in this place. They are open until 1 pm or until they sell out of donuts, so for the best selection, get there early. Mmmm....can't wait to go back!!
