Slxi_hfYP55jnsiNxrblTw.text: The good: service was great! The Filipino girl at the front line is a great ambassador. She's really warm and super helpful. And despite getting our drink order wrong, she was apologetic and quickly made good on their error.   The not so good: the donuts are okay. Great novelty flavors, names and combos. But none it them really knocked our socks off. They make for great photos but none of them made me feel like I had to go out of my way to come back here.   I didn't realize it's the same franchise as the Donut Bar in San Diego.

Uu9gzlRP3HO6m_X3c2_CPA.text: SHORTEST DONUT BAR LINE EVER (3.7 stars)  It was shocking to see a 4 person line because the one in San Diego runs out the door and down the street.   so many selections.... can i order them all ;P  When you can't decide ALWAYS STICK TO THE ONE THAT CAUGHT YOUR EYE FIRST. And that delicious fattening fried batter goes to....  OHH MY BIRTHDAY CAKE OREO   It was a very good donut but... I like my donuts with a little more fluff, a lot less sugar, and a custard texture in the middle. This was different. This was a donut with a reconstructed Oreo in the middle, with cake icing on the top with crumbles of Oreo and cake confetti. Sugar sugar and more sugar. If you strip all that and taste the donut, it's actually nothing special without that extra flavoring. The donut itself was dry. Again, good donut... I just have had a really good donut elsewhere that I hold high standards too.   I'll be real honest though... donut bar seems to only be good because of the flavoring that covers the donut. Strip all that way and you have a boring stale and dry donut.   Until the next review...

BgeAC89aA4rPyZ3lekKOfg.text: I have a love for cakes, cookies, pastries and most of all, donuts. Especially on vacation. Because when you are on vacation, everyone knows that all the rules of physics go out the door and any calories you consume are offset by all the walking you do. #truth My first order of business in Las Vegas was to find some delicious donuts other than the Krispy Kreme and Dunkin Donuts variety. Located in downtown Vegas, I found Donut Bar! At the time, I didn't know Donut Bar (original shop in San Diego) was listed as the Number 1 Donut Shop on lists from USA Today, Thrillist.com, MSN and more. But as soon as I walked in, I knew I had found a gem. The donuts they offer are huge, over the top, and look downright amazing! Their most popular is their Big Poppa Tart Donut which is made with a full pop tart and weighs one entire pound! I wanted to try everything, but I decided on three: creme brulee, blueberry with meyer lemon, and maple bacon. The creme brulee is a yeast donut filled with creme topped with a hard candy shell. For those with a sweet tooth, you will love biting into it. For those that like their donuts a little less sweet, the blueberry with meyer lemon is perfect. The cake donut is topped with a perfectly lemony frosting. My favorite was the maple bacon bar. The yeast donut is so soft and topped generously with thick and chewy bacon pieces that paired with the sweet maple frosting like a dream. Mmmmmm.... It's a bit of a gamble as they close when they sell out, but if you visit Donut Bar after 10am, they serve donut ice cream cones!!! I will get one of those one day!

I like giving other businesses over Starbucks my money when it comes to specialty coffees but I have to look for someplace other than Donut Bar to get one.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mrs. enjoying a doughnut with Sunny

etYv-LnqQQflVUj2fPlFSQ.text: If you're a donuts fan, this is a must-stop shop during your trip to Vegas! You'll be surprised how big half of their donuts are! Yes, you'll also want to order one just to see if it's possible to finish one. Plus, they have very appealing regular sized donuts, so you may as well order one of those as well!  I am also curious if the fish tank has real donuts at the bottom or fake ones - that was the hot debate in our group. I still say no way those were real! Bonus tip, use the restroom before you leave for the wall art!

aZXPmYom46zqTOWStR4XlQ.text: This is an amazing spot.  East Fremont is already an incredible alternative to the over-priced sheen of the strip dining options.  Add in the warm service and awesome, reasonably-priced delicacies at the Donut Bar and it's almost heaven.  I tried the signature Creme Brulee donut and loved it. The donut itself was not too sweet and the creme in the middle was delicious. The hardened glaze on top cracked in a fun way as I bit in.  They had dozens of other delicious looking donuts, ranging in sizes, which I liked too.  If you're just there for a quick bite, grab a small donut.  If you're in the mood to indulge, they have enormous donuts in all sorts of unusual flavors and with great decorations.  I was especially intrigued by the grilled cheese donut but will have to check that out next time I'm in town.  We got iced americanos two days we were there.  So refreshing.

YoqQMC6xkGb_vx4PZDQmTw.text: Lots of specialty donut places to choose but Donut Bar is our favorite! Donuts are fresh and yummy. Not an over abundance to choose from which makes it easier to have a favorite (caramel latte). Weekends they add some more specialty donuts. Coffee is really good also. Easy to get to and parking is plentiful.

8Tg08OZR2PG3TSr4mYik6w.text: So 200 plus reviews later not sure anything else can add.....but here we go anyway. I am just about positive am the last yelper that I know in Vegas that finally checked out Donut Bar. I noticed recently Donut Bar has started to open maybe once month or random times at night. So was like NICE finally get to try the pop tart and the creme brulee. All the videos seen of the creme brulee and one of the stables pop tart looked delicious. I do love my donuts from time to time.   I heard that generally there a line when first open and the earlier get here the better. The later you come not really the best idea cause they make only so much donuts everyday and by the end slim pickings (truth nothing worst then stale donut). I got down little earlier because not sure where the place was and parking downtown flat out sucks. Honest if you park near Donut Bar they have self pay parking meters. If ur lucky depending time of day its SUPER easy and cost is cheaper then paying any hotel or parking structure. Dollar on the meter gives you hour. More then enough time (maybe if the line is long then that another story). I was surprise but the line was not that bad only four people ahead of me. Just the fact there was LINE for donut shop still blows my mind. Donut Bar does carry strong name brand.   Chef Jeff is not only a passionate owner. The guy knows his donuts and all positive vibes. The minute he open the door greeting all five or six of us come on in. Friendly, all smiles, and love the atmosphere. The smell was awesome minute walked in!!! Fresh batch of donuts, the display case truly gives the donuts even more eye candy, the diversity crazy (oversize homer donut, rectangle pop tart, small circle creme brulee, traditional size ones but nothing traditional with the flavors or colors, and untraditional ones with donut cones fill with ice cream or strawberry split), and it long line of donut goodies. You might forget the selection at the top of the line. The place is small so gets filled up fast if want sit down. It located literally next to Carson Kitchen or look for the famous Donut Bar sign outside.   The stumpton cold crew deserves shout out. I never had that brand before. I decided try the coconut flavor cold brew in carton. It was perfect compliment go with the donuts. They have other flavors. I believe one was chocolate and the other not sure. They also offer it on tap if you like.   The donuts the pop tart is HUGE. If one person can eat one that pretty good. The way pop tart melting into the donut not sure if tasted any of the crust associate with pop tart. The filling you know if fan of pop tart is True and True. The icing and the goodies on top just pushed it sugar overload. I loved it. The creme brulee was good. I think that one better eat it on the spot cause the longer it sits the crack on top break it apart. Rock solid. I had fill out my box was got strawberry split. The strawberries was fresh, juicy, and I keep thinking strawberry shortcake.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Split
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop tart (strawberry and blueberry), creme brûlée, and strawberry split!

4FBnuCkzaHGIX-_hkbGGxA.text: The donuts looked beautiful and several of them were jumbo sized. But the flavor was a bit lacking. Definitely more bready than sweet.

PguRNml8oWESLNhlIy4IPw.text: SO GOOD AND SO MANY OPTIONS! I had a field day when I walked in here and it took me at least 10 minutes to make a decision.   I first tried the Boston cream donut and while it was delicious, it tasted a little bit too fried. I'd get it again but I'd prefer if it weren't as oily.   I tried mud pie next and I couldn't stop eating it, it was so good. It has a peanut butter drizzle on it, which I don't like too much, so I'd probably try something different next time but the donut part was so good and not too fried like the Boston cream.   I'm obsessed with the look of the homer donut and will have to try it someday. FYI the menu is posted every day on their instagram!  Get there EARLY I've heard they have crazy lines. I went around 830 on a Monday and we were the only ones there. I'm sure the weekends are insane.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boston cream
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mud pie

4lGd48PB8EHreVWzJLFIeg.text: Tried a donut, interesting selection. I always drive by and they have a sign that reads SOLD OUT on the glass outside. Was late at night so not many donuts left. The cake donut was kind of dry but the topping was good. Apple crumb looked much better than it actually was. The servers were very nice and friendly. I will give them another try when I know the donuts are fresh and the shelves are full.

4bzxTvxYS5zwlTNnr1GoIg.text: This place is very cute! I stopped by to buy a few donuts and I was not disappointed some were sold out already but I still had a good selection to pick from. Customer service was excellent and the prices are very reasonable if you're near by stop by :)

h0L0B_wYn03IFA6grGTUQQ.text: Overrated and overpriced. We went first thing in the morning and the donuts were really dry. They tasted like they were old, not fresh. We tried five different ones and I wasn't impressed. I didn't even want to eat them. They did have good chocolate milk though.

zK1ot_Siww7MiEckl55INA.text: It must be a dream...don't wake me because I never want to leave!  This place is a little slice of heaven is all I can say.  My girlfriend and I were in Vegas visiting her family and I thought I'd try my luck at a local donut shop. I really enjoy cake donuts and specialty donuts, so let's see what Vegas has to offer.  I came across the Donut Bar. The shop is pretty small but the donuts are enormous! I walked in and thought I died and went to heaven...this place is amazing!  I was created by friendly and helpful staff to assist me with my order.  Sooooo many choices and they all look delicious.  I got a dozen because I didn't want to miss out on anything!  I also shared with my girlfriend's family...to help educate them on the finer things in life!  The apple fritter with bacon, I think it's called "the Brad" but it is fantastic!  Apple and bacon together is a match made in heaven.  I also tried the "big daddy" which was a donut with an entire s'more inside (there are other flavors)..genius! The pumpkin spice was also good.  My girlfriend's mom had the creme brulee...she loved it.  My girlfriend had the birthday cake Oreo donut and wouldn't share so I'll take that as she liked it.  You can't go wrong here.  I highly advise anyone to go here if you're in Vegas...these donuts are life changing!  If I could give them 6 stars I would.

6YvjaolSt7jR1XCGCio6rg.text: We went and ordered strawberry cream donut and maple bar.  My daughters were in absolute delight.  They loved the strawberry and cream.  My husband loved the maple bar.  The owners are extremely nice and pleasant.  The place is clean and inviting.  Long line but they move very quickly.  This vegan will definitely be back!!!

SIjmu9GSHTqSAVIpAfLxpQ.text: These donuts saved me. I once was lost, but now I'm found. I once was blind, but now I see. Thanks do the Donut Bar, my chains are gone and I've been set free.

HTg9ttGA3_qYgtdUCDw7OA.text: Absolutely amazing! They had so many delicious donuts, we had bought several different kinds because we couldn't decide and had to try them all.

CG5umqfqJvBz0ZziTvsIBw.text: Pretty amazing assortment and appearance. However, it's really hard to justify spending $3 on a donut. The donuts were good, but not so much better than regular donuts to really justify it (unless you're just visiting and want some exotic donuts).

2q0AjNwJAnUu7MWYnJF-Zw.text: Donuts bring families together! This place is heaven. My family and I had just finished a 4 day vegas trip, and to say we were all sick of each other was an under statement. As we were leaving los vegas i decided to take my family here unannounced. They were not thrilled, donuts? Is what I heard from them.we had not had breakfast yet but we were in downtown and I decided to treat my self.  Pleasing my family is never easy, but the Donut bar delivered. My sister is a vegan and a food snob, (guess what they make amazing vegan donuts,  so amazing they don't even want to tell you so that you don't try them!)  My parents are very set in their ways and we're not thrilled by  donuts for breakfast......it's so good once it hits your lips!!!!!!!! My family were taken back by the creme Brule donuts, than the strawberry cream, and the lemon pistachio.  But when I got the maple bacon donut (I've had dreams about this thing ) they looked at me like I was crazy. It was amazing!  I had to force them to try it but they ended up loving it. Thank Donut Bar because of your donuts our family tension  was gone we were able to bond and have a good drive home. Your donuts saved the day!

VCS4Kg7eDRQdyfbQHHzWxw.text: These are real gourmet donuts with a nice price their coffee is also good and the staff is so friendly you can tell they put a lot of time and effort into not only their donuts but to their coffee also I like the maple bacon donut and I got a latte which was awesome!

-euLBYROoA-d3Q9QoGdFaQ.text: This place was amazing. Drive by on my way to the golden nugget and decided to check it out. They had a great staff and great selection of donuts. I tried their strawberry shortcake and it was amazing. I was amazed by their selection. The prices were not too bad either. Definitely returning again.

xPgsIJaEcRvK0Vymj3h-7Q.text: Awesome donuts, more expensive than the Krispy Kreme and Dunkins of the world for obvious reasons. Don't go expecting a dozen for 10 bucks, but go expecting some awesome donuts in flavors you never thought of.

BjznbGyJqq4Qm8p3OIlCxA.text: Was super excited to hit up this donut shop for a long time. It was nice to know that this time around, an hour before it closed, they still had tons of choices still. This time I was smart to call first before heading there because downtown can be a pain in the butt. The first time I went was disappointing because an hour before closing, everything was already sold out. And that was the time I had a friend in town as well. But this time around, I wasn't disappointed about the options per say, but actually the taste tbh. There was a deal going on that they sometimes do on the last hour of opening and they either do buy one get one, or fill a whole box of donuts for $10. Of course we ordered the famous creme brulee, strawberry cream cheese and the pumpkin spice. I was too juiced to crack open the creme brulee. As far as taste, it wasn't that great. It was very sweet. Too sweet. The hard top of the creme brulee was nice and crunchy but overal it was OK. at least the donut itself was soft. The donut on the strawberry was weak. I could make it at home. The pumpkin spice was the tastiest. The filling was good too. Next time I need to try the ice cream donut cone when it gets warme

hREak3npwdhUxz8CKLruRw.text: First timers for the Donut Bar tried the creme brulee for the first time it was really good I have to say is one of the best nights I've had in a long time I recommend the place highly little busy but it's really good.

6s0gRsB3QW5-6hpBrIBQiA.text: Omg the donut bar is so great if you haven't tried it suggest you do so.  sooooooooo yummy

wm6gArW1gDEscgGxsk8O0A.text: This is now one of my favorite donut shops. When I came in, I was excited to see a lot of fun options ranging from pistachio to strawberry cheese cake to the classic and delicious maple bacon. Most of the donuts were huge and still very well priced ($2-$4)! On top of it all, the staff was sooo friendly and that made my experience even better!

rfEygwX_y5uFtHfNCAfbCA.text: Absolutely perfect donuts. Owner was so kind and staff was so helpful. We went everyday we were in Vegas. Very cool establishment!!!!!!!!!!! :)

ZBefd-xe4buc6Kzl4FSVNQ.text: Ok so I only stopped here once for literally 2 mins or less, I was running late for a work function and i was passing by and just had to have some sweets in my jelly belly to make my day more merry. I waltzed in and was greeted by a nice lady who was behind the counter, she was giving me the spiel of the place but  i was in a mad rush so abruptly looked around and saw the oreo birthday cake one so just pointed and said "that one 2 please". and rushed my dough boy butt on outta there. Upon my hasty retreat I noticed that they offer a YELP CHECK IN DISCOUNT: of a cup of fancy  coffee. I didn't even have time for that :/. I was literally eating on the run and my donut was a tastebudgasm and a half of phenomenal yumness so i can only imagine what their other sweet wonders behind the counter must be like. So your's truly Benjamin glutton shall return to this purveyor of fried dough to further investigate but so far i'm a fan :D.

WDWdK2Q9nDKiJabR9L08Uw.text: Tasted like a regular donut place. I prefer krispy kreme than this place. The donuts here are unique, but their donut bread was dry.

BAS5LG1xcnxalTEhXk1DjQ.text: Had a great time this morning!!  The staff was really friendly and patiently waited while my wife made her selections.  Can't wait to go again!!  Made to order French toast is a must try.

LTpbY4KF-NpE-nvNL-Hsng.text: Only giving it 3 stars because I'm NOT a donut afficionado but the donut coconut dream that's pictured didn't taste freshly made. The batter tasted like yesterday. But I do love the array of amazing choice. It really is spectacular and creative and my husband who loves all things sweet, ahem, enjoyed his donut immensely.

SdVHP4dNPaAHulO7v0hrfg.text: Got the vanilla bean ands my daughter got the pink birthday cake.   They were huge and LOOKED impressive and yummy but. ...we're NOT.   Felt like I was eating a loaf of bread with cheap cupcake frosting.  not sure what the hype was ask about. Bleh.

x6q4W7dDA4wt38-1n7xRvA.text: Loved it! So much variety and a great venue just off the beaten path. The maple bacon was amazing!

2bPsA187536WjCs7lyTjDw.text: I'm a huge donut guy and people always mention Donut Bar in SD and they tell how great and amazing they are. I've never been to that location but I was in LV right when they had a soft opening of their new location there. Being the donut snub that I am, woke up at 7am and took an uber from the strip to their shop DTLV.   I liked the shop a lot. Warm and inviting with lots of donuts on display and the staff was super friendly. I came all the way from the strip so I wasn't just gonna order a couple donuts, specially when everything looked so good. I ordered a dozen.   The good donuts: homer, mexican chocolate, triple chocolate and big poppa tart.  The not so good: old fashion, red velvet, s'mores and chocolate bar.   As you can see they are good at making your typical donuts, but not so good at making cake donuts (which are my favorites). The old fashion donuts were really dry. Extremely disappointed by that since it's one I always enjoy. The red velvet and s'mores were also dry. Since I was paying a premium for each donut I was expecting high quality.   However, the homer and mexican chocolate saved the trip. Those were HUGEEEE, really good, fresh, soft and delicious. If I ever go back those are the ones I would order again.   I've come to realization that the over-the-top donut shops aren't my favorites. I've visited several ones with high expectations but I always end up a bit disappointed. Donut Bar was okay but not dying to comeback.

scwLFT5zR3dqK8Q6SRf8Tg.text: Not sure what the big deal was on these!  Even though we stopped by at noon, the donuts should of tasted fresh if bake today.  The 4 different ones we got all tasted dry, like day or 2 days old.  Paid $11 for 4 donuts!  Felt was too much!

mnuThSas8Rh_nWU98IVKGg.text: If you're going to Vegas you've got to make time for a stop here!! It's not too far off of the main strip but make sure you get here when they first open because the good doughnuts sell out FAST!!! My favorite was the one that had an entire pop tart inside!!! A very neat & yummy experience! There's also a beautiful patio to eat and relax at in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Make sure you get here early to get the best selection. They sell out fast! The big one has a whole pop tart inside! So good!

N8uZGa3MRDjnvUq06P7_0Q.text: So, with this place receiving so much fanfare I had to stop in and see what all the fuss was about. I arrived when almost all the donuts were gone but still managed to score a dozen with the help of my good friend. We walked right in and were greeted by the friendly and fun staff. We viewed the menu for the day and could not believe the variety of donuts. There were at least  20+ flavors to choose from and this included vegan choices which I can totally get behind. These aren't just donuts, some were like mini cakes and were almost big enough to cover your whole face (No Joke)!  I had never seen such large donuts before and could not believe how creative these people are with the large variety of choices. We managed to score some delicious options, such as the Strawberry Split, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Blood Orange, Boston Creme, The Oreo Donut (with an Oreo inside) and a couple of creme brulee'. My favorite donut from this batch was the Boston Creme. The creme oozes with flavor and tasted heavenly. The donut itself was moist and fresh. The creme was so rich that I found it a little overwhelming to eat in one sitting so I ate half the first day and finished it off the second day. Yeah, it was rough....   The Strawberry Split was layered with fresh strawberries and whipped creme in the middle of a large sugar donut. A different take on the strawberry short cake and perhaps a step up. I almost added a small drizzle of chocolate since I had it for dessert that night. I shared the other donuts with my staff and family and they were all very complimentary.  My daughter really liked the Oreo Donut and was surprised when she found the cookie in the middle. The service was outstanding and so friendly. The shop is quaint and very clean with not a whole lot of room and it makes this place nice and cozy. They also have a new t- shirt for advertising that is available for purchase. It has a great color scheme and it gives a shout out to our city! I can hardly wait to go back early in the morning when the donuts are fresh out of the fryer. I think I can hear a Homer donut calling my name.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool Shirts!
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VuXFHf3JaFW9MB55G3aS6w.text: woke up to the screeching sound of my alarm.. sun was already out to greet me as I remembered why I had chosen to wake up at such an ungodly hour..   D O N U T B A R  .. It was my first time & I heard this place was the place to be for donut lovers, which I am. Drove over to a still sleepy yet incredibly sunny downtown LV where I parked in an empty parking lot.. The heat was already starting to sear the air in my car..  I had gotten there a bit early to my surprise so it was about 11 minutes before I made my way to the entrance. I walked and turned the corner as the low murmur of the crowd awaiting reached my ears. There must have been about 7-9 people in front of me.. And by the time Donut Bar opened their door- I was no longer last, but found the line had started to wrap around the corner I had turned on earlier.. People made their way in and I trailed behind. As I stepped in, I relished in the coolness that hit me (thanks A/C). Then I saw the sight before.. Donuts, all shapes and sizes.. All different from each other and so many to choose from. But the one that caught my eye was the classic strawberry donut, you kno with the whip cream and blueberries and the stuff sits in between two halves of a donut. Oh yeah, that's the one.   I got my goods and saw that the line had only grown even longer.. And I was immediately thankful for the rude yet early awakening. I sat outside in the little courtyard and ate the delicious thing. I could NOT even finish it- it was so giant and so good.. It was quite overwhelming ! But it was so worth. I left feeling stuffed but so happy.   If you're ever around, pay this place a visit and set your alarms because you will want to come here to try their vast array of donuts. Service is speedy, efficient & awesome. Prices are more than reasonable. And donuts are FANTASTIC.

8Tf2f_WRZQ-20qfdvaLtyQ.text: Def a fan.   Keep in mind these donuts are very fresh and do not do what I did and leave a Strawberry Shortcake one out in the box on the counter overnight.  It will turn into a green fuzzy science experiment.  Hubby went at 8am one morning and when I woke up I woke up to a dozen vegan donuts...ummmmm no way we were going to eat all that madness.   This review is for the vegan donuts only.  I found my fav was the green tea. Second fav was the creme brulee.  Just get what you are going to eat that day...they will hit the bin the next day if not :)

They could be busy all day with fresh donuts if they had different model where they baked them fresh. But the wife was happy regardless so we will be back.

_QqoNmD5KySrgQF-JucbaA.text: The donut was a little stale. Not hot or fresh as I would've expected it. The location was cute, restaurant was cute as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time here. Pretty good. They weren&#39;t warm as I was hoping or expecting but it was still pretty good.

vjcpX2bfA6wEl_POYVbgvA.text: This review is for the Creme brulee donut. Texture was great---crisp caramelized sugar glaze with a creamy center. However, the taste was very lacking. The caramelized sugar tasted burnt and had a slight bitterness to it. The donut itself and the creme barely had any taste. It wasn't too sweet (which is a bonus for me) but it wasn't too ANYTHING. Im kind of disappointed and I've definitely had better donuts for cheaper prices. On a positive note, very cute inside and service was great! Parking can be a bit tricky--the parallel parking available near the store is all pay-to-park

Xi5Bx-7WcJe2R5o16vgn1A.text: Cute little place in downtown LV with some unique donuts. My personal fave was the Lemon Pistachio giant donut. The staff is friendly & the shop is clean with a trendy decor.

NlhKosZDOzTw3j3hVuSKXw.text: Items Sampled: Cinnamon Roll Blueberry Pop Tart Blueberry Meyer Lemon Cake Maple Bacon Bar Vanilla Cream Bar with Chocolate Glaze Red Velvet Triple Chocolate Samoa Vanilla Glazed Chocolate Glazed with Peanuts Snickers - Peanuts, Chocolate, Caramel Twix - Peanut Butter, Caramel  Fresh off an Orange County shutter reportedly due to inflated real estate rates, an import from San Diego intended to replace O-Face Doughnuts which recently closed in Downtown Las Vegas for reasons just the same, it was during the soft-opening that a stop was made at Donut Bar, the friendly manager and his team all-but giving away product - a total of three purchased by myself and a friend yielding a total order of sixteen.  Having myself already visited the San Diego location, parking a serious issue for good-yet-expensive goods that failed to wow in the same way as Sidecar, Blue Star or Stan's in LA, arrival at Donut Bar Las Vegas shows little to have changed from the space's previous occupant and although coffee has been replaced by Stumptown the prices are equally as aggressive while a general lack of seating remains.  A bit picked over at 1:45pm on Saturday, the Fritter gone but a dozen novel options including cake, raised and Specials all accounted for, service at Donut Bar takes a page from the youthful kids at O-Face and currently using a few staff from sunny SoCal to educate cashiers as well as customers the knowledgebase and readiness speak to experience and the Turn-Key location, though quality of the fried dough will certainly need some tweaks.  Taking the goods elsewhere to eat, conversation about everything from music to donuts and the local dining scene spanning across two-plus hours of small tastes, a first look at Donut Bar's raised options speaks of sharable portions that may help to soften the $3/each pricing and with a soft center somewhere between Brioche and Angelfood the texture shines in the setting of several glazes, classic candy bars no doubt playing a role in several of the variants.  Clearly needing some time to adjust to the desert with items featuring cocoa powder, both the triple chocolate and red velvet far too dry to be enjoyed, additional cake options were hit-and-miss in terms of consistency, the Blueberry Meyer Lemon unfortunately tasting as though it comes from the same mix sold for 69-cents elsewhere while the Girl scout themed Samoa was far more toothsome, perhaps as a result of coconut oil that several local Vegan bakers use to retain moistness in their cakes.  Not really shocking anyone with Maple Bacon Bars in 2016, the Vanilla Cream-filled Long John equally yawn inducing but more tasty overall, Cinnamon Rolls kept under warming lamps fail to hit the same highs as nearby Glutton or other artisans like Mothership or CRAFTKitchen despite a similar price per portion, the signature "Big Poppa" appropriately compared to "Fair Food" by a youngster joining in our tasting, the added jelly almost admitting that the Pop Tart alone is nothing but a gimmick and nowhere near the housemade quality of jams, creams and compotes made daily at O-Face.  TWO AND A HALF STARS:  Recently seeing a growth in diversity as relates to donuts, nearby Pawn Donuts and Coffee sourcing better from Donut Mania while Real Donuts on Charleston fares slightly better in texture at nearly half the price only half a mile away, one hopes that Donut Bar received a more favorable lease than that which doomed O-Face or their OC Location...or that they have some tricks besides freebies to help bolster their branding before they are too far out of the gate.

TVP-DYs0M9DqcwoNmGZ6vw.text: I realize this is an outlier of a review, but I did reach out to Donut Bar via their website with no response. Overall, these are some good donuts. I had the maple bacon cinnamon roll before we headed off to Death Valley and Northern California. The first few bites were pretty amazing, but things turned when I got closer to the center, which by this time we were in Indian Springs. The girlfriend thought it was a molten center, but it just turned out that the center was COMPLETELY RAW!  I'm not saying this was the contributing factor to some stomach problems I had for the following few days, but exactly rule it out either.   The other thing is the kids donuts they have on Saturday. And while they are cool, they are really no different than those over-iced heavily food colored donuts you can get at a supermarket.

DY11dcv1DDBonNYI3qE3hg.text: We used to go to this other donut place close to our house, but have stopped patronizing them because of their rude costumer service. Last Mother's Day, my hubby asked me where I wanted to go, and since I have been craving donuts and had the donut bar bookmarked for a while, I asked to go here. It was quite a bit of a drive considering we live in southwest, but we decided to go anyway. We got here around 12:30-1ish, and they only had a few selections left. Don't know if it was because it was Mother's Day, but the lady behind the counter informed us that because of the limited selection, we could get a box for $10 and fill it with as much donuts as we could fit. Although the creme brulee donut was sold out and it was slim pickins, we were still able to get a decent amount of very yummy donuts. What would normally be a donut worth $3 a pop, we were able to get a full box for only $10! My favorite amongst our choices was the caramel latte donut. I thought it would have been too sweet, but it was actually just the right amount of sugar. Another favorite was the espresso donut, even though I'm not a big fan of the cake kind. We brought the box back to my in-laws house, and everyone was raving about the donuts.   Fast forward to today-- My husband, son, and I had a hankering for donuts and braved the early Sunday morning drive to downtown. We got to the donut bar just a couple minutes shy of 8am and there was already a long line outside the door, waiting for the store to open. When 8am rolled around, the chef (?) opened the door and gleefully greeted the people waiting in line, and then proceeded to usher everyone in. We could smell the freshly made donuts before even stepping foot inside the store, which only fueled our hunger more. Upon stepping inside, it was such a different experience from when we went during Mother's Day. The cases were full of different flavored donuts, both fried and cake donuts alike. I truly felt like a kid in a candy store! The girl behind the counter offered our son a free inside-out themed donut, which I thought was really thoughtful-- they really cater to their customers at this place! Anyways, it was so hard for me to order since I wanted to try everything!!!! But we settled on the French toast donut (which was made to order ), a creme brulee donut (obviously a crowd favorite), a Samoa, and a chocolate euphoria for my son. The French toast donut was good, different, and well worth a try. The cup of stumptown coffee they serve there went great with the donut. The Samoa was pretty good but, as I'm not a big fan of cake donut (my hubby is), I think I can pass on that next time. My son enjoyed his chocolate euphoria, and started picking on the chocolate shavings as soon as the donut arrived. Last but not the least, the star among the donuts we chose, the creme brulee donut. It was quite small, but for only 2 bucks, it was a steal! My hubby did say that the caramelized sugar on top was a bit thick, but we both agreed that the donut was great and surprisingly not as sweet as we thought it would be. The creme brulee filling was smooth and velvety, just how it should be, and accompanied the donut very well. I would honestly come back here just for another one of that donut, but I would be lying if I didn't say I want to try more. I might just have to make it mandatory that we go here every Sunday so we could try out a different donut each time. The strawberry shortcake donut they had looked mighty good, as well as the s'mores donut... I'm drooling just thinking about it XD  Although there are plenty other donut shops close to our house, the drive to downtown just to go to donut bar is well worth it. Not only are their donuts great, but all the associates we've had the chance to encounter were all so sweet, helpful, and personable. No wonder people keep flocking this place. Customer service is obviously a priority on their list, and there is nothing better than that... Aside from the donuts, of course lol. Donut bar, you have just gained new loyal customers who will try to frequent your place every Sunday :)

e2IGqq3jFI15wJGHIvZsTA.text: Accidentally stopped in. Saturday morning after a 3 mile walk to mail 2 post cards at the USPS across the street to no avail,    Ugh...... Low and behold........ a "Donut Bar" across the street.   And many folks know me and donuts.   Well, even though I have 4 donuts waiting for me back at the hotel (which I have to walk back to), I figured.. What the heck.   What discipline. After serious consideration, talking to other patrons and using the boys room.... I settled on 1 donut. It was the cream brulee. $2  Was it worth it?  Yes. Yes it was.   Now to roll back south.   Happy eats.   BTW, the other donuts I have waiting are from a very early run to Pink Box Donuts. Pretty darn good there too and at reasonable cost. I guess this is what helped me stop at 1 donut at Donut Bar.   A wise choice. Go with the Brulee.

wVQj9hR84z-8vQ2ngUYaNA.text: We bought a dozen of there donuts and then had a sampling. There was lot of hype that built this place up. First off they don't open until 8 am on the weekends, for someone like me 8 am might as well be noon on the weekends.  The glaze and toppings they put on their donuts is really good, the dough though is too much. It's too "bready".  To me it doesn't taste like a cake donut, it taste like 4 slices of white Weber's bread (sans the crust of course) with topping on it.To me a donuts dough should be on the light side of sweet and cakey.. maybe they bake them here, I can't say for sure. I can be a bit snobbish about my donuts, but everyone in our group agreed on that one point, I listed above.

2x8FxxBTZkWcJOD4JydHYg.text: I get to Vegas about once each year and we always stay downtown.  I had seen Donut Bar on Instagram one day when I was getting excited about my trip.  I decided to follow them for a while, and after dreaming about their donuts for months, we mad it in.  This place does not disappoint!  The service was helpful and friendly.  Come hungry.  The donuts are massive!  My hubby got the Creme brulee, a yeast donut and I had a cake donut called, a buttermilk it was covered with some type of chocolate ganache.  My husband decided to order. Nitro cold brew coffee.  Everything was delicious!  It's not cheap food at all but, everything was so well made and delicious it's worth the expense.  My donut was crispy on the outside, light and cakey on the inside and the chocolate was the exact right amount of sweet.  My husband's was just like Creme brulee.  It had s nice crack on the outside and delicious vanilla custard inside.  You could even see the Vanilla bean speckles.  There is a small sitting area outside with adirondack chairs.  This is a must visit and lives up to the Instagram photos. Totally worth the check in.

dyNyjIMUCmsJ511CliqCxA.text: Not to long ago I tried donut bar for the first time at the farmers market at downtown summerlin. I enjoyed just about every single donut they had and the guy who had helped me pick out some of them was super nice and friendly. So today I decided to drive from the other side of town to get some more of their donuts cause I enjoyed them so much the first time. Well I got there, first off the building is way to small they need to have a bigger space to walk. People kept running into each to get to the line or from the line to check out. Second off we were waiting in line and no one was helping us it seemed to be they were helping everyone around us, including the people that were behind us. Finally I had to ask someone to help us. Third after I had gotten home I dug into the donuts and they weren't as good. I had bought some that I knew were good from my previous experience at downtown summerlin and some new ones to try. I had gotten a maple bar, how can someone mess up on a maple bar? Honestly their donuts need more flavor. The donut itself is amazing, it's soft and moist but they have lack of flavor from the fillings and from the frostings.  Honestly you'd be better off going to a grocery store than here.

Not my cup of tea BUT someone else may love it. The vegan selection was smaller than I thought because there were only 2 options at the time I went in but it's nice they have some. The filling was good and the people nice. Again the review is based on my taste and preferring a glaze versus the crust of the creme brulee. So don't hesitate to try it.

I brought home four different kinds of their amazing donuts for my family to taste...the chocolate bacon, cake batter, mud pie and French toast donuts. XLPlDp6QmWCycZtgcWKS3A.text: I never got to try the donuts because the manager at this establishment was very rude.  We were so excited to try these donuts so we showed up at 7 am on Sunday morning because when we called the day before the employee told us that we could preorder and pick up at 7 am.  However, we decided to just to go right when they open.  So once we got there we were greeted rudely by the manager telling us we weren't allowed in to buy any donuts since they don't open until 8 am.  We then decided to call to make an order on the phone which the employee told us that we could pick it up right away even though they haven't opened.  So we decided to place the order and were so excited waiting outside for our donuts: however, we waited for 40 mins and no one came out.  We decided to give them a call back and the employee stated that the manager wouldn't allow him to sell us the donuts at that point we were fed up and decided to leave because they were rude and unprofessional.  They should have given us a call back instead of making us wait for 40 mins.  Now I will never go back to an establishment that has bad customer service even if they are rated highly.

The French Toast donut was AMAZING!  The creme brulee donuts were not very good. The sugary top was very hard and the doughnut was honestly just not good at all. The 4 star rating is more for the French Toast....the creme brulee would have gotten 1 star.  I'd eat here again.  Their menu was awesome and they still had options around 10:15am on a Saturday morning. Go early though, certain donuts sell out quickly!

VeM6DIGRpFVN5oOPBjhugA.text: Definitely fills Vegas' missing gourmet donut niche, an it's certainly very pretty and lively and incredibly friendly inside. But is it worth lengthy lines and the hefty price tag? Unfortunately, I don't believe so.  Some donuts tasted quite old. What a sad state of affairs to reach DB on a lovely Saturday morning to have stale donuts already in the case. Bro and I were excited to try the salted caramel raised, but... it was kinda tough. How heartbreaking!  Creme brulee donuts are delicious, but so small. This may be the one force in the universe that can actually make me enjoy cake donuts. Here I actually preferred them! Red velvet, Butterfinger and blueberry Meyer lemon were divine!  Coffee is on point, and music selection selection is pretty sweet at that! Despite so many upticks, in a neighborhood that sure could use upticks and has been gradually, proudly, bringing them in/keeping them here, the stars of the show -- the donuts -- were just meh. An overall A-OK experience.

tHO6yLtR43U9S5y5mTdAVQ.text: This place is my go to breakfast in Downtown Las Vegas. The donuts are made fresh everyday and of course my favorite is the Creme Brulee donut. Other than the donut, my favorite part was the vanilla custard/ ice cream in a cinnamon sugar donut cone. Yup, you heard me right. And it was drizzled in caramel sauce. I kept hoping the next one would be better. ended up throwing everything out. they need to work on their glazing technique too. looked like a bunch of 5 yr olds were in charge of that part of production. very messy .

zBVBw--n4o8CckSLBlVxIg.text: The donuts were pretty good. Flavors were tasty but they were a bit dry. The coffee was good. We got there at 10:30 and the selection was already very limited which was disappointing.

yvfjQZ-H3ytSNvRNqY9Xog.text: Donut purists may not love this spot, but for those of you looking for super creative donuts, rush over to Donut Bar.   I was one of the lucky few that got to attend the Homer's Wet Dream event where I was able to sample many of the donuts sold by Donut Bar, so when making plans to dine at nearby Carson Kitchen one Sunday I decided to stop into Donut Bar first to sample more of their offerings.   I already knew that the Bigga Poppa, with a entire poptart inside, is the bomb. At $4 it's on the pricey side, but 2-3 people could share one of these, it's THAT big. The Creme Brulee is another donut I like, it is priced at $2 and is more of a standard sized donut.    For me.... it is all about the French Toast donut, cooked to order. If I had to choose one kind of donut to have for the rest of my life, it would be this one. Paired with a Stumptown Cold Brew, and you have one deliciously sweet breakfast.  Even if the over-the-top, stuffed donuts don't do anything for you, Donut Bar is worth a visit just to try the delicious French Toast Donut. (Sold weekends only)

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast donut

lEl1XYcBw2qUofP9Oz6Ptg.text: Wasn't a big fan of the creme brulee donut as the sugar on top was very thick and hard and the donut was very dense and doughy. Also tried the cinnamon sugar donut cone with the vanilla ice cream in the middle and was also disappointed. The vanilla ice cream was nice and creamy but the cinnamon sugar cone was also hard to bite into and little dry. Bookmarked this place for months and was very disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée donut
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon sugar ice cream cone

HdbY7cE1bsi3owoOQzldGw.text: I'm not a huge donut fan but they advertise they have the best donuts in the World so I had to check this place out. I came in Sunday 5/15 around 10:45am. Pictures "donut" do this place justice as many of the donuts looked like they were on steroids, they were huge! Those ones seemed to be more of the plain variety though whereas the specialty donuts were of the smaller size. They have lots of yummy flavors and I couldn't decide what to get. Luckily the employees were patient while I waited to make my selections. I finally chose:   Strawberry big poppa tart Creme brulee  Blueberry cheesecake  Maple bacon My dining companion got the french toast donut and holy crap that was delicious. I should have gotten that.   I thought they were all pretty good. The blueberry cheesecake had a yummy blueberry filling, but I didnt find the flavor to be very cheesecakey. The creme brulee was a fun one. It had a hard caramelized sugar coating on top of it that was totally reminiscent of real creme brulee. I had a couple bites and the inside was a sweet vanilla cream. I brought the other half home to my brother who said he almost broke a tooth on the hard shell, so watch out! The maple bacon was probably my favorite. It was a maple bar with real chunks of bacon on top. The salty/sweet combo never gets old and was a delight to my taste buds. The big poppa tart was really just like an oversized poptart. I thought it was fun, but was honestly my least fave. For 4 donuts it was $12, I dont think that is very unreasonable for what you are getting. I can see myself coming back here for sure.  Pro Tip- If you follow them on IG @donutbar, you can check out their daily menu. They post it the night before so you know what to expect the following day.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maple bacon, creme brulee, blueberry cheesecake and strawberry poppa tart.
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PlHjN8TBzs2St_uKgL_40g.text: This place has been hyped up because of it's delicious well presented donuts. I Took my boys there to try out some of their creations. My one son decided on the donut "cone" with vanilla Ice cream, I decided on the apple fritter and my younger son got the birthday cake donut.  Here's where the review goes south:  My son tried and ate the cone with ice cream and  said that the cone tasted like pre made pilsbury pastry dough, the apple fritter I was expecting to taste full of apple and moist was VERY DRY, over cooked and had not much Apple to find in it and as for my younger sons birthday cake donut it too was very dry and made Dunkin look like the king of the cake donuts. The 3 donuts total were $11.00, yes that was for 3 donuts.  So for them to claim they are #bestdonutsintheworld not in the eyes of this consumer. Pink box donuts can easily out do donut bar on quality, taste and price.

9hcEYl1rp9fti600ibEx0A.text: Tried their blood orange (big ol' donut) and strawberry cream cheese. Both are very sweet and soft. Lots of good choices. Latte was good and right temp. Stop by early as they close early.

bnwLvJAsxzxRUcYnix5Kng.text: I don't get the hype over these donuts. I was so excited to try them after following them on Instagram for some many months. I went on a weekday so the French toast donut was not available. I got a dozen to try almost every flavor. I was disappointed in their popular creme Brulee donut. There was barely any filling in them. I ordered 3. Aside from the large size, there is nothing unique or worth coming back for. Although, I did enjoy the salted caramel and apple fritter.

wH2JqxW02d8eUbbxbyJU5g.text: Love me some Donut Bar. Sorry Ace, Ronalds, and Real Donuts, but Donut Bar has the BEST yeast-raised donuts in the Valley. This has become my go to stop for donuts in Vegas.  Donut Bar is my usual go to stop for dessert after I take a visit to the ol' PublicUs. I heard a lot about the buzz going on, how it was considered to be the best donut place in the country, so on and so forth. I just had to check it out for myself, and for the most part, its awesome. Awesome-sauce even.  Donuts are a personal thing, everyone has different likes and expectations when they have a donut. Let me tell you mine. I'm a big fan of brioche-style donuts, ones you normally see on dessert menu's at high end restaurants. So that means I like a sturdier type of donut, one where the chewing experience is very important to me. There are some that like the lighter versions of donuts, where they sort of disappear after you start chewing on them. For myself, I'm not a big fan of those types of donuts. That's where Donut Bar comes in. It does remind me of those amazing brioche style textured donuts, with an incredible mouthfeel, and flavor that is on point. I do like the fillings and creams that they use, they are all balanced, without being too sweet, and they are full of bright, impactful, flavors. IMO, their yeasted donuts are the perfect donut.  The coffee here is outstanding. They use a Stumptown bean, and they offer drip coffee's as well as cold brew, all of it is on point. The service here is also outstanding, everyone is helpful and friendly, and they do a great job.  So you are probably wondering why this isn't a 5 star review. Well, I'll tell ya. While their yeast-raised donuts are 5 star all the way... their cake donuts to me are just OK. And trust me, I've tried my best to like them. I've ordered them on three separate occasions, and it just wouldn't click for me. It might be a texture thing, I like my cake donuts to have a slightly crisp, thin exterior, with a super soft interior. But oh well.  I'll be back, their yeasted donuts are one of my obsessions. Haven't had a fritter yet because they are usually sold out. But you just wait, I will find you, and I will have my day.  By the way, Best Music Playlist.. Ever.

89WjRyuCVIYX4dcu9dd-ug.text: I called on Thursday 4/14/2016 business was closed for day. But, manager Joe answer phone called. I was excited was able to speak to someone.. I placed a order for a birthday party of 23rd of April. I was told I would get a call back to confirm. .Well I've been calling  them myself  for 4 days straight. Seeing if order was place and will be ready for pick up on 23rd.. sent business emails.. all i have to say is Don't bother with this place!! Not reliable. . Rather take business else where..

zhV8Ja95w5SVhEtB-GlkFQ.text: Soooooo sooooo good! Really happy I can still find yummy vegan donuts in this town. Only down side: music is so loud you have to yell sometimes to place your order.

88zTgzB_QRH_zlC10nUa-A.text: Took a bunch of teenage kids and they were blown away at how great the donuts looked.  Had a great time seeing all the massive donuts.  Must see Las Vegas destination.

lRIq_8cHWv2a6NMCmTtC5w.text: 100% naughty goodness!!! Yum meter is 11 out of 10!! Gourmet donuts done right. You can't go wrong here.

LLsDXBmOvCv3FRS3QUprKg.text: First of all, the donuts are out of this world!!! Secondly, the staff are so happy to be there. Walking in their store is like a breath of fresh air. Lovely experience overall.

r7hAPsvAU2O7VPNm5fh_GA.text: Amazing! I tried a creme brulee donut and the strawberry cheesecake, washed down with a nitrogen infused cold brew coffee. Boom! I was buzzing for hours... (In a good way)

038s4PMpBAhgDlRheOazpw.text: I love the selection Donut Bar have to offer.  It's great for all occasion and especially gifting it.  Well, the truth is, they're delicious and sometime just to beautiful to eat.

as7IRM1wH96MqlZ6fFegng.text: Beat donuts in the world. Never fails when I'm craving something sweet. Been buying donuts for years now & Donut Bar is still my favorite! I recommend to try the Oreo Donut

LArokzlrs4mh6V2mRoBa1w.text: This place is a must go to if you a donut lover and in Las Vegas. Plentiful parking in the area makes it easy to pop in and pickup these treats. The building itself is a cool little place. Upon walking in you are immediately greeted and welcomed. The person helping me was able to explain each and every donut and asked me what preferences I had and suggested items to try. The selection was great on the morning that I arrived. I chose the Creme Brulee donut and a lemon cheesecake donut with a milk to go. The donuts are pricey, until you bite into them and realize the quality ingredients that they are made with. I was a few miles away before I tried my selections and immediately wished that I had purchased more. Great selection, priced right for the quality, and a friendly helpful staff. Do yourself a favor and check this place out, you'll be glad you did.

hKAgM3g5RdTm60YDJgW-MQ.text: People seemed to go crazy for the creme brulee donut but it's alright tbh. I was also excited for the flavors I was hoping would be good like red velvet and strawberry cream cheese and it was also just alright. However, the oh my birthday cake oreo donut was delicious! That one by far is my favorite. I would probably only come back just for that.

Tcte5UXj6f1wW5fv1jnscw.text: Really good donuts! I had a creme brule and Nutella donut. Both donuts were beautiful, big and yummy... all you can ask for in a donut! The staff was friendly and helpful and the coffee was good. The outdoor area in the back is really cool to sit and enjoy your donut and coffee. Great spot!

3N_AIhJIszh3F83ESE-oFw.text: Not bad doughnuts, but way too big in my opinion. I know  bigger I better, but if you don't eat them warm, they dry out pretty quick.  Good selection and different flavors. But I'll probably end up staying with some other local doughnuts for my regular everyday needs.

wY4O1DrDWjmQZaLM4VPU7A.text: Great assortments of gourmet donuts. I haven't tasted a donut to be on the least of my favorite. All was delicious to its creation. Definitely need to try the rest!

_BKUCEUJUQKjKJdg1ehbKQ.text: Um what do you say about this place?? The donuts are amazing, the people that work here are super nice and helpful and the place is super cute. I wish it was in Orlando!

jFiBuH_yovvWBFiVoevFXQ.text: My first experience with Donut Bar was at at Yelp event where I tried their pumpkin filled yeast donut and it was pretty disappointing. The dough wasn't as perfectly light as I like. And I really prefer for the entire donut to have a thick layer of glaze - this did not. Also, the filling was barely sweetened and basically tasted like butter.   However, after brunch at eat. I figured I might as well stop by and give it another chance. This time I knew not to get a yeast donut and to try the cake instead. I went with one Strawberry Cream Cheese and one Apple Crumble. The latter was nice, but the Strawberry was even better because it was super sweet and flavorful. (In case you couldn't tell, I expect as much sugar as possible.) But both were moist on the inside (the Strawberry even had little juicy specks of red) and the outside had a nice thick glaze.   I went on a Saturday and there was a line to the door that moved at a pretty decent speed. There was a big family behind me and I believe I heard someone behind the counter say that kids get a free donut on Saturdays. Pretty cool! Does my three month old count? Haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Crumble and Strawberry Cream Cheese Donuts (both Cake)
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Strawberry Cream Cheese (cake) Donut

O_1oH9fAIgCV4R2gTnII8A.text: So cute and the donuts were delish. Love watching downtown Vegas come alive! This place is a must stop for belly filling breakfasts or dessert

0QvI-I6soFTUhpmKgg9XmA.text: So disappointed by this place. The donuts were just sad. They look amazing but taste like disappointment.  We got there in the afternoon time so they were doing $10 boxes (as many donuts you can fit in a box for $10), we were so excited to get to try a variety.  Smores on fire - eh & cake donut was sad Triple chocolate - more like 1 chocolate  Blueberry & Meyer lemon - decent Creme brulee - eh, cream was gross Chai - okay Chocolate covered old fashioned - gross Poptart - okay but so overly sweet  Nutella - the only one where the donut dough was good Chocolate milk - don't get it, not worth it  2 stars cause we would eat 2 donuts again (blueberry & Meyer lemon & nutella) and the staff was really nice

GTYw5eTTSoTADp0BuFs6zQ.text: I woke a little early to make sure I didn't miss the infamous French toast donut and it did not disappoint.  Dropped in this morning around 9 am and ordered a variety of donuts and of course the French toast "only sold on weekends" and it was absolutely yummy!!!   Highly recommend if you in the mood and in the area!

hK5xOn2CmqtkGQzgsPKDjQ.text: Easy breezy walk from Fremont--I know there's been talk about where you should and shouldn't walk in Vegas but I had zero issues. Or you could uber lyft it, but I enjoyed the stroll.   The place had an amazing selection, super night staff. The donuts were visually dazzling and did not disappoint in the taste department. Walked a box back to the Nugget, had a great breakfast, ziplocked the left overs.   Turns out they were still pretty flipping yummy the next night (two days later? Can anyone be sure of date or time in this magical city?) after a 4am hot streak on the tables when Hubby has a contagious sweet tooth.   Thanks for the treats!!!

elog3G8P0B5UXWqghpfXcA.text: Donuts were delicious as expected and I am so glad I stopped by for them before leaving Vegas. I ordered the peanut butter chocolate donut and it tasted like crushed Reese's blended into a cake.   I wished some of the donuts had chocolate/Nutella based filling though for chocolate lovers like myself.

eIbI46mE0dxmMzOqD0baNQ.text: Service girl was pushing French toast donut. Told her didn't want that. Asked what some of them had in them and she mumbled something. If the donuts didn't look so delicious I would've walked out. By the way, none of them were very nice. After choosing what I wanted to buy, she tried selling the French donut again. And again while she was boxing my donuts. Oh boy, was she going for the grand price, was she going to get a bonus??? When I got home, the donuts were very disappointing. Pumpkin spice donut? Not at all taste like pumpkin.  The donuts with filling in them? What filling, had to find the cream filling in most of them. I will not be back. Would've give them a one star, except that the Boston Cream was the only one that were very good.

4jCItAEWzJW-sZpp0XzrfA.text: Ok donuts. Flavors weren't there. Ok coffee. Bitter as hell. Cute outdoor eating area. Would not come back.

qWybtqfYPZXd8XrlqLmrwA.text: Came here after seeing a video and several pictures of the grilled cheese donut sandwich. To my disappointment, we were told they were sold out -so that was the start of it.  I got the mexican hot chocolate donut, which was $3. I thought it was worth it, not because of the flavor, it didn't taste much like mexican hot chocolate, or chocolate for that, but it did taste like a good yeast donut. It was huge, which totally made up for the price.  My bf got a s'mores donut, which was a big fail. It tasted like a less sweet version of something dunkin donuts (a favorite of mine) would try to make. At $3, and a quarter of the size of my donut, I didn't think it was worth it.  All in all, this is pretty much hype. Try it out and tell me what you think!

3dSgebOEPKyqCK-HEmcFIQ.text: AMAZING!!!!!!  Growing up in Vegas we used to stop at Winchell's on our way to school.  I tend to compare today's word of donuts to those of my bomb ass childhood.  Anyway, the cream filled chocolate bars at Donut Bar are to die for.    They have an awesome and creative assortment of donuts so there is something for everyone.  The best part of our stop was the iced latte's.  Good Lord the coffee here is incredible!  I live way up in Summerlin but I can honestly see myself take a spin to Downtown Vegas just for some of their donuts and crazy good iced latte's.  While we felt prices were a bit steep, I guess you get what you pay for as we, Cesar Q. and I left happy and wanting more!  The staff is outgoing and quite helpful when you don't know exactly which donut to indulge in.  There is street parking right our front of the shop so it's very easy to run in and out.  Damn, as I write this review I feel the need to go NOW for my afternoon pick-me-up!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valentine Donuts!!

OU0apKtTHG5E6FmiiPLy_A.text: Yum, yum, yum! Never have I been so excited to eat a donut!   I parked at the meters on 6th street and the walk was not bad at all. You just turn the corner and all the donuts are staring at you. You walk right in and the prices of the donuts are to your immediate right. They may have different donuts depending on the season, but majority of them are the same. They're all very delicious though!   I just got a variety of donuts, choosing the ones that looked good. You NEED to get the Birthday Cake donut with an surprise Oreo inside. I was so excited for it. I heard a lot of hype for the creme brulee donut because of that *crack* when you break it... I tried doing that while recording it... fail. LOL. It's harder than it looks, literally. And I wasn't a big fan of the taste of it. So I went back to enjoying my birthday cake donut. YUM.   Come early because I've heard that donuts sell out quick and once they're gone, Donut Bar closes. Enjoy!

hJy8Q8_JrxaPfFlqNIfvMg.text: The donuts looks way more appealing than the actual taste. A co-worker brought a bunch into the office. There were literally so much to choose from. Green tea, creme brulee, strawberry shortcake, pop tarts in different flavors, blueberry cheesecake, maple bacon, pumpkin spice, cookies n cream, birthday cake oreo and a few others.  Some tasted better than others. Donuts tasted fresh and the cake wasn't dried. I had half of the green tea one. No green tea taste to it at all. In fact, it tasted more like a lemon flavored donut with green colored frosting on top. The strawberry shortcake and blueberry cheesecake however, was FABULOUS!!!!!! It really taste like it sounds.   I can imagine if you have a major sweet tooth, this place would be heavenly for you. I'm glad I was finally able to try their donuts though. But personally, I'm more of a cupcake kinda gal. Remember...choose your donuts wisely.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry cheesecake, strawberry shortcake, green tea, pumpkin spice and a huge strawberry flavored pop tart inspired donut.

Pi7gsqi_3zFyBXqsXVMnpw.text: The donuts here are beautiful & tasty!  Cool atmosphere. Friendly & helpful staff.  Bonus, while we were here, some cops came in, so you know it's a kickin' spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SP8l5pqW0IOOrNgcwcnRMA.text: I absolutely LOVED this place! My boyfriend and I are die hard donut addicts and we couldn't believe that this place was close to our home! The service is always so nice and attentive. It's a small little place but it's super cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R8eJg-aOSxNvnlnDf9_Q8g.text: I've been to Vegas quite a few times, but never have I searched out for a breakfast or donut place. For some reason I did this time and it was probably the best decision of my life!!! Quite possibly the best donuts (gourmet) that I have ever had. Located downtown, near Fremont Street (sp).  By the time we got there on a Saturday morning, maybe 9am, I guess their signature strawberry shortcake or whatever was sold out :( but we were able to try some amazing other donuts.  1. Creme brulee - they try and immolate the real dessert, and it doesn't disappoint. I normally don't like cream filling donuts, but this was light and sweet all that the same time.  2. Oreo / Bday cake - tasted just like it sounds  3. Some sort of strawberry filled donut  All three were amazing, coming from a chocolate and glazed kind of guy. The even more amazing thing is that they only cost around $2-3, so hopefully they don't raise their prices, bc that is an insane deal! There are some higher end donuts near where I live and they definitely don't hold a candle to Donut Bar!!  It will probably now become one of my Vegas staples!!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wRXjTwfWzysGAH2ucgkS4w.text: I wanted to go here our whole trip, and we finally made it on the last day. The donut selection is amazing and everything looks divine! We ordered the creme brulee donut, as the girl working told us it is their best seller, as well as the maple bacon bar.   Creme Brulee Donut: Very good, except for the fact that it took four bites before we got any filling. We genuinely thought it was just dough with a sugar topping and were sooo disappointed, so when we finally got to the filling we were relieved! It was tasty, but I wish it had more filling in it, as the bites without it just weren't good.   Maple Bacon: Super yummy! There was a ton of salty bacon on top, which balanced the sweet maple frosting well.   I would definitely come back here, and next time I would order something more exciting. A lot of the specialty donuts are HUGE, which is what kept us from ordering them this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maple Bacon Bar &amp; Creme Brûlée Donut

qRstIPNSnVFG_1M6IoDE4A.text: Doughnuts to me are one of the Single Best items for one to indulge on and enjoy, Fried Perfection that is either Glazed, filled with Cream or even a Tart Fruit Jelly or topped with Sprinkles and nuts or bits of Chocolate. You might feel guilty by indulging on the Fried Goodness but live in Moment and be taken back to this Childhood Delight, when I was planning coming to Fremont Street for the very first time coming here for Breakfast was a must. After getting off the Deuce Bus, looking through some of the Stores, playing in one of the Casinos and walking down all the side streets and looking at all the Unique Graffiti Arts.   I found my way here located in a little Suite sized vicinity and as if the Sign wasn't enough of a Dead giveaway I'd say the Pink Donut on the Wall was one too. It was pretty late when it came to my Breakfast as it was nearing Quarter to 11 when I stopped in here. Seeing the menu outside they have 28 different varieties ranging from 2-5 bucks each from exciting things like Mexican Hot Chocolate, Triple Chocolate Threat, Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo and Chocolate Bacon (you can have Bacon for Breakfast in a different format). To even the simplest of flavors such as Red Velvet, Boston Cream, Creme Brulee and Pumpkin Pie, walking through the small cafe and seeing row upon row of Donuts made it even harder for me to pick.  I only limited myself to 2 Donuts but which 2 was the Question, although not a big fan of Boston Cream I thought it had the best presentation (with the Frosted Ghost in the Center). My choices were the Lemon Cheesecake and Nutella Overload, both placed in a Cardboard Box for me to take, then I sat down to enjoy. I started with the Lemon Cheesecake which had a light dusting a Graham Cracker crumbs (more powder like) with Vanilla Icing coating the top, as I broke into the Donut to find a light amount of Lemony filling packed with a Profound citrus flavor enough for me to enjoy and not give a lip puckering Punch.  The Nutella Overload was an extremely Decadent Experience, question is how many of us have taken a jar of the Chocolate-y Hazelnutty Spread and eat it right out of the Jar. We've all probably done it, but have you ever had it inside a Donut ?. I got past the Powdered Sugar as I yanked it open to find it almost completely filled to the brim and it oozing out all over (hence the Name). I felt like half the jar was put into this thing, I felt like Elvis Presley after he had his Peanut Butter and Banana Sandwich. Also interesting that they had a donut named after one of the most iconic Cartoon Characters of all time (Homer Simpson), its also awkward to run into him in the Bathroom with a literal speaking as there were lifelike drawings of him all over the Walls (that would be the last place I would ever run into somebody).  Their signature shirt (Donut kill my vibe) really got me as I do love Puns, I wanted to get one but they didn't have any 2 or 3X's. But I thanked them and was on my way to try and work it off, their Doughnuts are equivalent to Paula's Donuts in Buffalo. Rich, Fluffy and Enjoyable, like Michael Jackson said - Donut Stop til you get Enough !!!

N-BwQHwbbsrXNx4nh6nwRg.text: The difference between a gourmet donut and an ordinary donut from Winchell's or Dunkin Donuts is difficult to appreciate. At prices that start at $3, the difference is dishearteningly small at Donut Bar.  The donuts here are visually enthralling. On an enormous, thick bed of fried dough, each donut is adorned with a thick layer of colorful frosting. The Homer donut looks incredible. It's hard to not want to at least try one of these bad boys.  While the gut-busting Big Poppa seems to be the popular choice here among Instagram enthusiasts, I opted for the maple bacon bar. This amounted to a lackluster maple bar with burnt bacon on top. I was disappointed as I dished out $4.

qG0WnKgBatasb2oiuapbqg.text: Best donuts in town! #ToDieFor Been to the one in San Diego, waited like 30 minutes in line, I'm glad we have one in Vegas and don't have to wait that long. It gets pretty busy though, and they close once they sell out. Aside from their sweet donuts, their grilled cheese is very good, its huge too! They have vegan donuts and you can also order online to pick up!

du4GEXlDar_OtMu2A-8AQQ.text: Don't worry: the calories consumed in Vegas, stay in Vegas ;) Donut Bar Las Vegas is very well-known, but I wasn't searching for this gem when I stumbled across it. In the Fremont Street Experience Area, Donut Bar is a cute, small donut shoppe that was put on the map with its signature Big Poppa Tart donut (it has a PopTart inside of it!). Let me tell you: if you have a sweet tooth, you'll LOVE this donut. It was simultaneously filling and light letting me get my fill without bloating me. In addition, the workers were SO sweet and patient, telling me about all the donuts I had a question about. This place is the MOST recommended foodie destination for anyone visiting Vegas (well, Most Recommended by me, anyways). Love, love, love!  Service, donuts, and price are all five stars :)

MuPIw0ouGouh7oe6GZmiuA.text: Just stopped by for a snack and I was blown away. First, the theme is great. Second, there is such a huge assortment of options to choose from it's overwhelming. I opted for the spiced chai donut which was $3 and delicious. Very flavorful and the actual donut wasn't greasy, but instead light and airy. We got two coffees which were also on point. I will be back- especially with the awesome and shaded outdoor area perfect for the Vegas weather

My family got many flavors to split so we could try more. My top three (and in no particular order) was the strawberry shortcake donut, the Oreo birthday cake, and the creme brulee donut. Every time we come to old town Vegas there is a line out the door for this donut shop so I knew today would be a good day to come and try it as I had a little time to spare.   Everyone here is super nice and they open fairly early however they're open until they sell out so if there's something that you're looking for and get there early and stand in line.   Yes if you have butter and jelly and Oreo doughnut both were excellent.

6jyVAiECHdZYxC4cQeatFw.text: SUGAR HIGH! These donuts have to be the fluffiest I've ever had. I'm a fan of the simple, glazed, classic Krispy Kreme donuts BUT this definitely raises the DONUT standards. If you're in the mood for extravagant, flavorful, delicious donuts, try the DONUT BAR. I have to admit, their donuts are huge but worth the try!

qKWqpOuwwdSFqhJLPcXh3w.text: I'll be honest, I am pretty disappointed with my last visit. I really want to support businesses but I have to be honest...  Short Review:  - Been here a few times, and each time wasn't great.  - Spent $30+ on my last visit for 1 dozen donuts (not the grilled cheese/french toast btw) -- $35+ w/ 2 espresso   - I know my donuts, been nicknamed by others "a donut expert" haha, thanks)  I've been to several around the Vegas Valley and other cities.  - Yes, these donuts are large, pretty & Instagrammable, (a lot of people love this place) but they taste more like bread, not donuts. Dry, thick texture & seems like they were made the night before, while other places make theirs fresh a few hours before opening and throughout the day.   - the donuts are lacking in flavor.  - Customer service is lacking as well, pushy sales girls don't listen well over the loud music. She tried to sell me the french toast & grilled cheese donut 3 times after I politely said no thank you each time. Gave me confusing answers when I asked her questions. Cashier wasn't friendly or nice either. (Btw... they were not busy when I went in, 8-9am)   - They will still do well in business despite my review and many others like it. - I'm not sure what they use in their recipe but it made me sick for a few days :-(.   - If you were disappointed with the donuts or service here, and want tasty, fresh, flavorful, soft, affordable donuts go to Ronald's Donuts in Chinatown or Friendly Donuts if you're near Boulder Hwy / Southeast Henderson / Hendertucky area.  Long Detailed Review:  -- worth reading if you want to know why I dropped a few stars (about their donuts and service):  If you know me and my reviews I am honest about my reviews and tend to look for the positives (what's good) in a place, unless I got sick or something. I went on a Saturday after breakfast, would've came here for breakfast if we thought of it sooner. Glad we didn't. Read on to find out why...   At first, I thought the girl helping us was friendly until she suggested the grilled cheese donut and french toast donut at least 3 times. After I said no thank you each time.  I wonder if they get commission off of each french toast or grilled cheese donut they sell? I'll call them sales girls because after a minute or so they turned into pushy sales girls.  The music was so loud in there, I asked her a few questions and she gave me confusing answers. Somehow we still ended up spending $35 THIRTY FIVE DOLLARS FOR ONE DOZEN DONUTS & 2 Espressos. That's unheard of at any other donut shop.   I wouldn't mind if they tasted good but the dough in the donuts had no flavor, it tasted more like bread.   Basically, most of them tasted like bread with flavorless sugary frosting on it. I'm not sure what they use in their recipe but it made me sick for a few days :-(.   The donuts with filling in them, had a pea size filling, very small amount. The toppings and frosting didn't taste like their name.  The specialty donuts, like the Blueberry cheesecake, pumpkin, all the donuts we got were flavorless and disappointing.   I gave some to my family, hoping they'll like it and eat it all up but my brothers didn't even want to try any donut LOL. That is saying something. WHO REFUSES OR THROWS OUT DONUTS?! Not this girl or anyone that I know. We ended up throwing out a lot of the donuts.   If you like large donuts, Instagrammable donuts this is your place.   If you want tasty, fresh, flavorful, soft, affordable donuts go to Ronald's Donuts in Chinatown or Friendly Donuts if you're near boulder Hwy / Southeast Henderson / Hendertucky area.  2018 Yelp Challenge Review #14

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qDS9Q1fxjAwp6QsHLKahYg.text: Donut Bar has to be one of the tastiest and most unique donut spots in Vegas! I came across here about a year ago when I was visiting for the Life is Beautiful music festival. The environment felt very cozy and the donut selection blew me away.  There were so many different flavors to choose from and they had many specialized donuts that you can't get elsewhere. These definitely weren't your typical donuts. They also had coffee on their menu, which was a plus!  If you are ever in the Fremont St / Downtown area, I highly recommend going here. Make sure to arrive early while the donuts are fresh and still available. I guarantee everything you see will be absolutely droolworthy.  IG: @ravenousfork

exlePj9XJ5u7vN9_u2xpuQ.text: I love the donuts here! They always have different flavors. The Nutella one is my favorite but it can be overwhelming. I feel that they have a flavor for everyone. You always have to go early to have a variety to choose from since they sell out so quickly, usually by noon.

lGxjIXMQPyEGHGvNp7bibA.text: Came here with family they had a good variety of donuts flavors and interesting ones too.  I ordered creme brulee, apple,chocolate cake donut and boston cream. The apple was a lil dry but tasted ok. The best of the four I picked was the boston cream. I hope they have other flavors the next time I come back, which if I had a taste for a donut, and I was downtown at that moment, I would come back here. P.S. Pay for parking across the street every time, the meter maid will give you a ticket.
