M3_c9Om3PHVmUh1dOrb64g.text: OH MY GAHHHH!!!! I've been wanting to go to Donut Bar for years, and I FINALLY got a chance to go! Creme brulee donuts are life!!! I'm so glad the franchise is expanding. There are three more coming to California in 2019 and one opened up in Pasadena (Hallelujah!!!).   The creme brulee donuts are worth setting your alarm for because they sell out really fast as soon as the shop opens. I was lucky enough to try one and immediately regretted not getting at least three like people in line suggested that I do. I wanted to get a box of a dozen to sample, but honestly, I think three creme brulee donuts per person seems like a reasonable serving size portion.   The big poppa (strawberry flavor) was out of this world delicious! The strawberry filling inside was perfect and the drizzle on top tasted like heaven..   I'm having major taste bud withdrawals right now writing this review.. I can't wait to go back for more! :)

zs9dEJEjq9LRz-GvambQUA.text: Meh. We were there at 11 am on a Saturday morning after we'd gone to Donutmania and found a poor selection. Donut bar had even fewer...maybe 20 but not a great variety. We got a maple bacon apple fritter--the last one. It was the only one left that wasn't just a "regular" donut. After all, we went there to try a fun, different type of donut, not just an old fashioned or a glazed donut. So, the "bacon" is just bacon bits that you buy in a jar--not real, fresh bacon crumbles like I expected. The fritter was dry and didn't have nearly enough apple in it nor glaze on it.  Had it been real bacon, and more apple, maybe it would have been worth the $4. Otherwise, I'd just stick to a national donut chain who knows what they're doing.

aAhEflX0s-ECOd-12cQ6Fg.text: Big. Ass. Chewy. Lemon. Pistachio. Donut. Drool.  Also they close when they sell out.  We were very sad yesterday.  Can you come back to California with me?

Chef Jeff came out with a handfull of balloons and put smiles on my kids faces with the choice of a free balloon and one free "insideout" themed donut. Zq3WeuzBlq5OnvQC0v8iug.text: Promised my daughter I would take her here to try the nutella donut she has been dying to sink her teeth into.  Came in on a Saturday morning around 11am to find a small line of about 5 people formed waiting to place their orders.  Donuts are priced individually.  Picked up two nutella overloads, one strawberry cheesecake and one toasted coconut; total came to $13.   Nutella Overload: Nothing to call home about.  In my opinion, there was no 'overload' of nutella present.  This donut is basically a nutella-filled donut with powdered sugar dusted heavily on top.   Strawberry Cheesecake: This is a jelly filled donut (I believe strawberry jelly - hence the strawberry in the name), with a glazed topping and a dusting pile of what I believe is graham crackers.  I don't get any cheesecake from this donut, so I don't know why they find the need to call it a strawberry cheesecake donut. Toasted Coconut: An old fashion cake donut with toasted coconut on top. If you like coconut, you will enjoy the coconut topping. Overall, these donut were not terrible but they were not donuts that I 'gotta have' next time in Vegas.   Side note - there is metered parking right in front of the business which only takes credit cards.  Best bet, have someone drop you off and circle around and pick you up to save money on parking!

B-qUNPQcvCrRSqa4_Vy1zg.text: How do you give this place a 3  1/2 star?  Anyway, this place isn't bad.  To me, and this is just my own opinion and taste, this place is like any ordinary donut shop but with certain perks making this donut shop a tad bit different from other places.  1)      A few of their donuts are "Vegan" 2)      They have clever names that complement the donut 3)      They have treats for your furry friends  My first time going, I went right before they opened.  I was the first in line and lines form fast right before opening.  I ordered, which was the day after the news of music icon Prince passing, the Price Donut, Creme Brule, Banana Caramel and the Boston Cream.  The Prince donut was well decorated with his symbol and filled with raspberry.  I liked it.  It was okay for me.  I did notice that the donuts I ordered, weren't as sweet as some other donut shops (not including frostings).  This was a plus for me, the amount of sweetness to the donuts were good for my liking.  The Creme Brule (Vegan), I wasn't a big fan of the "caramel drizzle" over the donut.  Some will like it, but it wasn't my cup of tea.  Everything under that topping was okay as well.  I love bananas so I tried the Banana Caramel (Vegan), and that was okay too.  At first bite, banana runts came to mind.  Last, Boston Cream.  I love donuts filled with custard, so I couldn't leave a donut shop without getting one.  This too was okay.  The breading wasn't too sweet, but the sweetness of the frosting complemented this donut well.  I really wanted the cinnamon roll with the bacon, but that wasn't ready when I got there.  There was a 15 minute wait :(  I'm still coming back to try that cinnamon roll with bacon and the french toast donut. :)  With that being said, Happy Eatings!!

PEQO_H5tMSeAR7BS47bbrQ.text: What is the hype about? I have been want to try this place for a while and I was so disappointed. Got there at 1140 on a Friday so there were only three types of donuts left; Crete brulee, strawberry cheesecake, and Nutella overload. I wasn't disappointed with the lack of selection as I would have chose two if the three anyway. They were dry, and all disappointing in flavor. The brulee topping tasted burnt and not sweet and the cream was almost tasteless. The strawberry cheese cake was a jelly filled with cheesecake icing I guess? Not enough filling , couldn't taste anything like cheesecake, and the filling tasted cheap. The Nutella overload an underload with not enough filling. It was straight Nutella which was the only saving grace of the donut experience. They did have nitro cold brew which I tried and it was good but their cold brew was bitter and not smooth. Will not try this place again.

z-ieOGkKFcFwxNMNB84AxA.text: I had all but given up finding a nice, big cup of coffee for a reasonable price downtown until I discovered this place!!!  I just moved about a block away and love swinging in for a cup of coffee on my way into work. They offer various iced coffee options (not really my style) including a "nitro" iced coffee on tap! The donuts are always delicious, but can't go for donuts too often if I want my clothes to fit! My go to is a large Hawaiian Hazelnut drip coffee, delicious and at only $2 a pop I can treat myself pretty often! The one and only downside is that the shop closes when they sell out of doughnuts, sometimes noon and sometimes 2:30-3 so I have missed my afternoon coffee a few times.

sv439vYFG0ojyEOt3Qlxnw.text: Customer service was worth the trip! Four to Five stars for service. Product quality was merely so-so to lacking.

_DduPpqloeIOO0DgS_wXDw.text: Pretty good. The donuts were a bit 'fancy' for my taste, but I would visit again.

wGrrMdOOL_rVkM-y1Rjk_A.text: Located downtown right next to Carson's Kitchen downtown makes this quite the journey for me but I still do it. Love the maple bacon cronut! The best! They typically sell out of the most popular items really quickly. Almost everything is pretty much gone by early afternoon. If you want to get the goods head there early.

PqqhfnAxkaUU32cm6pLohg.text: Busy place both times I visited but lline moved quickly. Wanted to buy a butter beer but they were out so that is a little disappointing but nice to have so many flavor varieties. Got a bostom cream...it was perfect, not too sweet. Customer service was good, prices fair.

lMEwyLkJp13XMwg2AJQJ9g.text: I have to admit I was a little hesitant going to the donut bar.  After all, imho it had a large shoes to fill because of the prior tenant O Face Donuts. Sure, O face is now gone and one should not compare a defunct business to the next. But I cannot help it and I feel if you take the time to read what I mean, you may just end up agreeing. There is only one single difference between the two shops yet the difference is such a critical element. Creative originality. The Donut bar attempts to dazzle you with concoctions that are really just kids play. The creme brulee is creative in thought yet executed with no afterthought. Yea, the sugar is cool however only after one bite.  Attempting to get through the constant crunch soon became annoying.  I found myself trying to taste the center cream however once the sugar coating finally dissolved and my taste buds came to I found it to be just commercial custard filling. Very disappointing. The maple... O face had was one step ahead of everyone on this.  When you go to a donut shop,no matter what part of the U.S. you go, you know what a maple bar taste like. It doesn't change and when you have one, you have had them all. O face however took the time to develop their own maple glaze which complemented the bacon. Donut bar..the same usual maple. The oreo cookie Jeez...how much sugar can you give? People, this is a regular glazed stuffed with an oreo cookie.  mmmm Lard  O face made donuts that were not only creative but containing other unique flavors. Mexican chocolate with horchata creme...yea, their own homemade horchata,not a tub filled with flavored gelatin goo   Apple fritter. Dark. Happen to notice this to as the tray containing the fritters all looked the same,over done. To their credit, the inside was not overdone and actually the best of the group of donuts I had.  In a nutshell, this is no O Face and probably never will be. I suppose this means I need to find something more on the level of my expectations. Which leads me to a final thought. Donuts that cost 2-4$ per should be on the level of artisanal. Otherwise, what am I paying for that I couldn't already get at Von's?

2pXB6N9X5uVZN_dLCfDndw.text: Incredible donuts.  Beautiful and tempting to look at, delicious to eat.  Very reasonably priced.  A grand slam!

tQIEaZKswU5OobNifycjug.text: We went overboard, but it was totally worth it!  We limited ourselves to 6 (Big Poppa Tart, Salted Caramel, Creme Brulee, Maple Bacon, Pumpkin Spice Cream Cheese, Butterfinger)  Our favorites were the Big Poppa Tart, Salted Caramel, and Pumpkin Spice Cream Cheese.  The maple bacon wasn't anything unique and the butterfinger was a cake style donut, which we preferred as an afternoon donut.  The creme brulee had no flavor (or maybe it did but the others were just that overwhelming)  Overall it was amazing, the staff was very patient as we made our decision, well worth the early wake up and drive.  We got there just after 7am and had no line, however while we were inside 4-5 other people came in.

fQRwJ6xBLmU0VzCrF3Jisg.text: My friend showed me a video on Facebook about the Donut Bar and the creme brulee looked amazing so I knew we had to stop by when we were in Vegas. My friend actually went to the Donut Bar by Fremont Street and got us donuts while we stayed back at our hotel with our babies. The person that took my order was helpful and her recommendations were excellent. She even up sold me on other donuts and coffee. The checkout was excruciating, I had to ask for my coffee. The coffee was spilled by the cashier.  The cashier forgot a whole box of donuts. Ultimately, I had to make a second trip which took an extra hour of travel time to retrieve my second box of donuts. The cashier mistake ruined my whole experience at donut bar.

aLjCLf7-rWxS-FlxoUglBA.text: I finally came early enough to get a French toast donut! I had been teased for weeks by this donut, from Instagram and yelp! I tried the Sunday before last and missed out as I came too late, surprisingly 9:40 is too late even though they open at 8! This place is very popular. Unfortunately, you have to arrive super early to get a FT donut which they only serve on the weekends. I arrived last Saturday before the doors opened and it was well worth it! The donut was so soft and tasty, it went down smooth with the milk I ordered. I have to say it sucked sitting at the eating area as the air is blasting which made my French toast cool after a while. I only ordered the French Toast so I'm not sure about the rest of the donuts. I do plan on going back this weekend for another FT donut so maybe I'll try some others as well. The 4 stars is because I feel they should have the FT donut all week and because the hours they are open is so short, some days they close at noon. They could be making so much more business!

YaqFpqitYF3fi8aQiqhn5A.text: I love donuts & I love donut bar. My favorite is with out a doubt the bacon cinnamon roll. (It's not a donut, I know. BUT BACON) I went for their grand opening, and really enjoyed it. Even got to taste their chi tea latte which was pretty good! And fret not, if you're like me, they offer dairy alternatives, like soy!  they have an incredible selection of crazy awesome donuts and your basics that you love. And they also offer VEGAN & gluten free options which, while I am not vegan, think It's awesome that they offer a sweet selection for everyone!

H5A-QAm_9PtZoBEdgRUftw.text: Neat little place north of the strip. However donuts sub par. The Homer was a unique big donut. But that's about it. It's dry and topped with sugary frosting. The creme brulee was hard to bite into. If you want good donuts - try Voodoo donuts in Oregon or Denver, CO.

XTvPQ0I30GtmlS-C_CwZTg.text: Found out about the donut bar through a Google search. It's a gem of downtown Vegas! They gave us two huge donuts at a bogo price of $3! Definitely recommend and will be back

o2mkiPOAex2KckGl17awHQ.text: I'm not a donut fan at all but this place I absolutely love! They have the best donuts. Everything I've tried has been delicious. My favorites are blueberry cheesecake and the French toast donut! I go every chance I get.

PbkSXCWgXxFejJA4a0S9mQ.text: Ended up in Vegas for way too long. Thank god for this donut shop. After moving from the strip to downtown, this was a daily go-to. We actually got healthy smoothies (from the market down the street) and donuts for lunch 4 days in a row :) sweet staff, vegan options, 2 for 1 happy hour. Overall great experience!

0Oo76PoQ_sn-P-JxNDedkA.text: Donut Heaven. Nuff said. But for real this place is insane!! The donuts are gigantic and taste delicious. Their coffee is also great. The service is cheerful and professional. The only thing you need to know is get there early. They are open only until the donuts run out. I recommend getting there early in the morning to ensure you get the best selection of awesome donuts.

3CDd5P0VeLJDHEOgJx2jMw.text: The donuts here are unique and tasty, but I am not crazy for them. I like to take friends who visit Vegas here because they have donuts like the Creme brulee and pop tart donuts, which you can't just find anywhere, but you won't find a regular glazed here.  If you like really sweet donuts, this place is for you. If you like simpler donuts, you might want to find a different place.

c4hYIoW7z0oCK93pkBETxw.text: Doughnuts are great, music is super loud, cashier was shown checked-in free espresso Yelp offer and didn't make eye contact, said "I don't know what that is" and went about her button pressing. Didn't get free espresso nor did she even try to find out what it was. Product is why people check a place out and customer service is why people come back.

juyZ4V4KtZu-iRepzKYgRQ.text: So happy I finally got to try donut bar !! I've been eyeing this place in San Diego but to my pleasant surprise they also have on near downtown Vegas !   We got the mud pie donut which is huge !!! And also a creme brulee one. I personally didn't like the creme brulee one that much even though a lot of people recommend it! I thought the shell was too hard on the top. The mud pie donut was pretty good ! Had a hint of peanut butter & was covered in Oreos !!   The workers were super pleasant and friendly ! The price was very reasonable. My favorite was the outdoor patio in the back where you can sit and enjoy your donuts ! It was cute and quaint !   I would definitely stop by if you're in downtown Las Vegas to get some delicious donuts !

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée donut &amp; mud pie donut !

a0JQcmKf8Uzc-2reig94dw.text: Good donuts love how they have so many unique options! I couldn't speak to anything else because I ordered online and had my mom pick up.

XAM776YXj6RJEzh7tFtOXw.text: I've been coveting the Creme Brulee donut from donut bar ever since I heard that satisfying crunch on a viral video 4 years ago. (Give or take) l. Well, I finally returned to sin city and was able to get my paws on one. The crunch was just as satisfying as I was hoping, but the donut was overall just ok. Totally worth the money, but surprisingly dry inside.   The filling is a custard, which helped the inside texture and kept he middle moist, but towards the sides, there was a staleness that was probably from the time of Day we went. I'm not sure how anyone wakes up before 10am after a night in Vegas, but if you're awake, I bet they are better.   The place is incredibly cute, they have a donut fish tank that was adorable and a bathroom with every donut lovers favorite Simpsons scene. Worth the stop if you're visiting or the consistent visit if you're a local!

UL8RDiVAaulccVjUmLCU6A.text: This place by far is my most favorite place to go to when I am downtown!  They alway have the best selections especially for the sweet tooth cravings I alway have!   There location isn't too far from downtown Fremont and the Container Park, So this is alway a good option to come to first thing in the morning.  That's probably the best time to come in is early, they alway sell out fast and all the good options are gone if you decided to come in later in the day.   I have been lucky so far to alway grab my favorites before they sale out. My go-to's are alway the birthday Cake, the Homer, and a Nutella one. I even love the Churro Cone with Ice Cream.  My favorite time to come here is on the weekend. It should I say my little ones favorite time to come here is on Saturday or Sunday, they alway give out free donuts to kids. They make them a featured character and have it all decorated out.  Last time we came here and got our free donut they were handing out Ninjago Donuts, my son was super excited and absolutely went crazy with pure happiness. He has now made it a point to request we go there everyday, but unfortunately my metabolism won't be able to keep up with that request, so we opt for the weekends only lol.   If your lucky enough to come on happy hour you can grab a box full for $10, the only sad part is you don't know when they will have it or if they will. It's usually before they close and depending on how much they have left. So it's alway a win win when you come in, you can grab a speciality donut, or a free kids character donut, or a happy hour box.   Either way you will definitely not be displeased with the quality of the donuts, and you can always walk off the calories at Fremont or Container Park.

-UQ2Zhq3cGRPvlpHaIUWIQ.text: If there was an option to put more than five stars, I would. Got a baker's dozen donuts which was more than enough. I am not a fan of the designer donuts trend... but this place blows Pinkbox and O Face out of the water. We tried all the 'fun varieties' including the delicious and decadent S'mores pop tart donut. My colleague loved the vegan creme brulee one the best even not as a vegan. I loved the maple bourbon and the caramel latte one the best. Absolutely delicious and welcome to Vegas.   PS if you buy twelve they give you a free donut!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

csrjaujvsfL2dDAbnRmAMA.text: I eat approximately two donuts a year on average. Not really my thing. Someone brings in a box of donuts to work and I'm not even tempted. Bad for you and I just never find they are really very good.  On our trip to Vegas in April I was doing my research on Yelp and saw the rave reviews on Donut Bar. Heather and I decided to grab a coffee and wander over on our first slightly hungover morning in Sin City. Am I ever glad we did.  The donuts here are next level. So many tasty, colourful creations to choose from. We decided to share a Mexican Hot Chocolate Donut and a Maple Bacon Cinnamon Roll. Both were out of this world. The Donut was fresh and fluffy like nothing I had tried before. The chocolate and marshmallows were perfect. The Maple Bacon Cinnamon Roll stole the show however. The huge chunks of crispy bacon and the perfect blend of crunchy, chewy, sweet and gooey Cinnamon Roll made for an amazing morning treat I raved about all weekend.  A place you must stop in and try just blocks from Fremont Street!

2yfYf8uW4MwYVygu7yrekQ.text: East coast gal visiting. This place was to par with the donut speciality shops near Manhattan but I was disappointed in how they were sold out within an hour of opening. They were also expensive in my opinion. The donuts were great, coffee was okay. The self serve coffee bar needed to be restocked.

Uh1tqTkwIffWALV1YRarKA.text: The donuts selection is amazing and everything looks divine! Everything is to DIE FOR! It's that good!  I love the "Brad."

vigbY4lL2zlz9viyKHhjbQ.text: So I stopped by to pick up donuts for work....it was very overwhelming!  So many choices! And just let me say that every donut of any and every type was mouthwatering!  Just looking at all the choices and making a decision was completely difficult....I got 12 donuts....the counter people were very helpful explaining the donuts...plus it was completely packed!  The crime brulee's was allegedly their number one seller, so I got one of those!  It was delicious but very sweet.  I also got a maple bar with bacon very delicious...how could you go wrong with that combo anyway?!   I highly recommend this place but get there before the days donuts are sold out!!

My family and I picked what looked good to us, but we're most impressed with the strawberry and whipped cream donut. It is so BOMB! I could eat it everyday. My kids got an Oreo cookie donut and I believe a strawberry cheesecake one. The lady that helped us also put in a few emoji donuts. I'm not sure if I paid for them or not but even if I did I was impressed with what I got. Will definitely be returning :)

bhPB1p4oqipfyTcfumkNzg.text: I visited this location because of all the hype surrounding Donut Bar and because I love Donuts. This location is in Down Town Vegas so it can be a little difficult to find if you've never been to DT. There is a parking lot across from it as well as meters near so that was a plus. As soon as you walk in you are face to face with all kinds of huge and pretty donuts! I came in specifically for the Big Poppa Tart. Which is a strawberry pop tart stuffed inside of a donut. It ended up being very overwhelmingly sweet but a fun donut idea overall. We bought an assortment of yeast raised donuts and cake ones to get an overall Donut Bar experience. The staff were very genuine and helpful.

VQNzsm4RQpp9NGdGp1kujg.text: If you've ever thought that strawberry shortcake wasn't an appropriate breakfast food, but wanted to do it anyways, get the strawberry split. This was by far my favorite of the donuts. The cream brulee was a close second. The glazed sugar on top gives a perfectly satisfactory crack when hit and/or when bitten into and the filling was delicious.   We purposefully visited on the weekend for the expanded menu and, of the specials, chose the French toast donut which did not disappoint. We'll try the grilled cheese on a later visit. I suggest you do the same. (Or take enough people that you can order all the donuts and do a sampling.)   The staff was very friendly and the donuts, yummy!   They are open until they sell out, so get there early.

c5HgyC2-99HnH3gLM0080Q.text: First time coming here and the donuts were pretty good. I had the Nutella donut which were good. My nieces thought the birthday cake Oreo donut was really good. My mom thought the salted caramel was a bit too salted for her but overall good taste.

R0OEUkdCcUNPiwFTRyop9Q.text: 3 stars... This place was recommended by local friends so we were sure not to miss it. There was a short line to get into the joint so we had high expectations. I got the Nutella and my wife got the salted caramel. Both were good and were large donuts. Ambiance is stripmall cafe, service was friendly, and prices are slightly above expectation. Not sure we picked the best of show, so at first glance this joint does not make the list, but we will definitely give them another shot next time we visit! We will be back!!

y1e2-qsBxYyOxOjtbdZDqQ.text: Things go fast, so make sure you arrive early to ensure you get the best selection, because once they're out, they're out.  On our first visit, we got here around 8am and there was a good amount of people in line to get donuts. They had everything from creative choices like their version of a Pop-Tart, a variety of sugary cartoon characters, jelly donuts and their take on the classic cake creations. The problem with going first thing in the morning is that your eyes are bigger than your stomach, and you end up ordering a ton. Totally worth it. Nothing beats remembering you have a box of these treats in your hotel room after a day of drinking, or whatever it is you do in Vegas.  If you come around 11am, which has been the case on most of our visits, they box up the remaining donuts from the morning and sell them for $10 a pop. You don't get to choose, but it's still a steal if you don't care which ones you get.  They also have variations of Stumptown Coffee if you need a caffeine boost. It's offered in hot and cold forms, but the cold brew is my favorite between the two, especially if you're going during the warmer months.  Plenty of metered parking on the street and behind the building in a shared lot. If you want to sit and eat, they have some counter space inside, and a shared outdoor area with some tables and chairs too.  Totally recommend if you haven't had a chance to check them out in San Diego. They're awesome!

0T2ptC6eGzH2U53o0kmY7w.text: If u love donuts  u have to try these. Strawberry shortcake is my fav. But wouldn't turn any other flavor down. I first tried them at a friend's. And have been addicted since. Be sure to show up early. They tend to sell out fast

cb600g8-n20elDvh-oa57w.text: Great place for a sugar rush and stomachache!   Jokes aside, these donuts are something else. I would HIGHLY recommend you share a donut with a friend (or two) and not take one on yourself like I did.  Go early as they do sell out throughout the day. My first time here, I was browsing the huge selection but what caught my eye was PISTACHIO. All time favorite, had to try it - even if it was pistachio lemon. Boy was I impressed. The lemon flavor punches you in the face, but the pistachio caresses you and makes it all better. The balance of flavor they manage to pack into the donut is spectacular. The size is on the outrageous side, but it definitely makes it worth the price. Their coffee is also top notch and pairs well with any donut you decide to devour.  I would take visitors to town here, but I would hesitate on coming regularly. Although it's a damn good donut, my stomach would hate me.

9vjwu67Q8N9VokjQQpkH4g.text: Phenomenal. Came in early on a Sunday morning and was lucky enough to snag a French toast donut with the butter, jam and syrup sides. Got a birthday cake donut stuffed with an Oreo, the creme brulee donut, the strawberries and cream donut, and a s'mores pop tart donut. The strawberries and cream donut was hands down my favorite, light, fresh and absolutely incredible- 10/10. They were all awesome- my only gripe was I wish the birthday cake donut had actual birthday cake filling in it besides and Oreo, that was the whole reason I got it lol. Nonetheless, love the vibe here and all of the amazing creations! Wish I would have gotten more than 5 but could not physically fit more in my stomach lol. Will be back!!!  Atmosphere: 10/10 Value: 9/10 Flavors: 10/10 Service: 10/10

p4-yKHQiWsXC-0hkRgvMxw.text: Quite possibly the best donuts in Las Vegas. Donut Bar creates super fun & delicious donuts like their maple bacon bar, huge big papa tart or the creme brulee just to name a few. Make sure to come in early because they will sell out, FAST.   We've had their donuts in our office multiple times and they're always a nice tasty treat. My favorite is the PB&J. It has real peanut butter in it which I love & the dough tastes just like a cloud. I also have tried some of their coffee before. They use local brews like Vesta which I'm a fan of.   If you're a sweets lover this place is a must visit! Also a good hit for impressing your coworkers.

op-R2SZ2I2KbDJxMjAHg8Q.text: Donut Bar is your typical hip donut spot located in Downtown Las Vegas. They have mainly fancy donuts, not the og stuff.  Street parking. Open until they sell out. Inside has limited seating.  Prices are decent for the style of donuts they have. Came in at 11:30 am on a Saturday and they had happy hour, fill a box with anything for $10. Literally 10 donuts for 10 bucks. Normally 10 donuts here would be close to $40-50.  Won't review each donut, All the donuts I got tasted like how they should. The dough was good and chewy. Sweet but nothing to bad where it hurts the teeth.   Big Poppa Tart - $5 - Huge jelly filled donut shaped like a pop tart.  Salted Caramel - $3 - Huge! Vanilla - $3 - Huge! Birthday Cake - $2 - Sprinkles! Boston Cream - $3 Peanut Butter & Jelly - $3 - My favorite! Creme Brulee - $3 Raspberry Cheesecake - $2 Nutella Overload - $4 Cinnamon Roll - $4  Sugar high!!!

23SuOgHMDG2WwueYlmGHuw.text: I visited Donut Bar on a whim because I was nearby at the court house and it was National Donut Day.  I was planning on getting a dozen for my co-workers, but they had no deals on buying in bulk - at least none that were offered to me.  The girl behind the counter said they are all individually priced no matter how many you buy, which is kind of ridiculous considering the most BASIC donuts are $2.  I ended up getting half dozen instead and just cut each one in half.  Luckily, my office isn't that big.  They looked beautiful, but not anywhere close to the best donut I've ever tasted.  I'd say 3/6 had the same flavour with different food colouring/decorations.  $18 for mediocre donuts....I'll stick with Glaze Donut from now on.

jRZAAyjDAoRuD4Doz_DvAQ.text: High marks for the Donut Bar. Cool little donut shop away from the Fremont Street nonsense. Besides the wide variety of donuts, there are plenty of coffee options, a water station, and an outdoor seating area. Shop was clean, staff was friendly, and we got an incredible deal on a box of donuts as it was near closing time. Really enjoyed the smallish creme brulee donut. Pop tart donut was gimmicky, but had to try anyway. Fun place.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We got there relatively close to closing and they were selling an entire box for just $10. Best part was you pick the ones you want.

s4hyfqsxmz9Vdr6Syb2fIg.text: This place is hands down the best donut shop I have ever been in! The vibe is amazing, the staff is super friendly and very nice. And Ofcourse the donuts are just beyond delicious!!  I stumbled upon this location while looking for coffee options by our hotel and decided to walk to this place to check it out. I am glad I did coz the donut options are creative and just hands down delicious but not overly sweet where you don't taste the flavor other than sugar. To me the staff of this place took it to 5 star. We got the creme brulee and French toast donut at first and both were delicious specially the French toast was so fluffy soft.   Took the maple bacon cinnamon roll for the road and it was very tasty as well with good balance of sweet with bacon! They open early 7 am on weekdays and 8 am on weekends and close till they sell out which the staff said is around 1 pm.  If you're in Vegas then I highly recommend stopping by, we got here at 8:45 am and it  got busy with people coming in and out with pickups. They advertise with a #BestDonutsInTheWorld and I agree!

9i7NNPq5rPDMT8zd2qepGw.text: If you're visiting downtown Las Vegas a stop at Donut Bar is a must! What sets this shop apart from the rest are the creative flavors packed into each donut, friendly and helpful staff and an instagram worthy back patio.  As a bonus on the weekends Donut Bar offers two specialty donuts: The grilled cheese and a fun take on French toast!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Donut Bar&#39;s grilled cheese donut! Only served on the weekends.

sa7x-lDukVa3YrrGzJ-h0A.text: Donut Bar is one of the best places for breakfast. It has to be breakfast. They're only open until the donuts sell out. Most days they're out of them early. They also have coffee and vegan versions.   It doesn't have official hours. It usually opens about 8 in the morning. They're only open until they sell out, which depending on how busy they are can be soon after they open. It's not a big place, and there's usually a line waiting out the door. The best thing you can do is get there soon after they open. I like the apple fritter. It's about $2 each. This is massive. It's crispy and not excessively sweet, and it goes good with coffee. This donut is also vegan. It usually has several vegan options. They also have donuts with Oreos and Twix bars in them.   It doesn't have that much room inside. It only has a few seats against the wall where you can use an outlet. There is a courtyard that's shared by Juice Stars.

7UHNtrt-IevjU3JVqRW32g.text: Not your typical donut shop which makes this place unique and great. Went before 9 on a weekday and the wait was not long at all. Would visit this place again if ever in the area. Arguably the best donut I've ever eaten.

zAN2XnYYH7MWMm1JOI-FVA.text: Maybe I'm used to something a little different on the East Coast, but the Donut Bar was all bark and no bite.  They all looked very aesthetic, but not one of them was memorable or had any real outstanding flavor  Tried 3 donuts from their large selection.  Cake Batter(Oreo Mini) $3 Big Poppa Tart (Strawberry) $5 Strawberry Split $4  The big poppa tart was the biggest let down, the filling of the donut was the same dry sticky filling as a actual pop tart, it did not blend very well with the soft doughy texture.  It's a little bit of a hike away from the strip, I would say not worth the journey.

p03Qae7fiWXZqaeX16deUw.text: I hate to do this because in theory this place is awesome. However I paid for parking to come here and get the Game of Thrones and Unicorn donuts plus ones for my kids like the strawberry split .  The female that helped me knew that I wanted donuts for pictures for things like yelp and my instagram but when she placed my unicorn in the box before I even left she let it get messed up .  Not to mention when she grabbed the unicorn that I picked she let sprinkles roll off. To say she didn't speak or even offer help in suggesting donuts is an understatement .  My Mom was asking about what bacon options they had and it really felt like she was a zombie that was not happy to be there . But I ended up asking if those cinnamon rolls in the back had bacon and my mom opted to pick that .  The donuts quality is still decent but  when  she had our donuts at the counter to pay we noticed the cinnamon roll with that she grabbed was burnt she wasn't wanting to put it back and couldn't even ask if my mom wanted something different like what in the world . Another employee chimes in to ask but again Hyleah is what I was told is the name of the girl helping us but the female who I asked said she's one of their friendliest employees if so you need to do work. The lady at the coffee place knew I was upset and didn't even apologize .  I paid to park to be treated like my $17 for the small amount of donuts wasn't good enough to even respect the fact I do not want them to look raggedy cause I legit am trying to promote you guys yet my unicorn got jacked up . She didn't ask which house I wanted on the game of thrones donut and she also gave me one that isn't that photo ready so sadly I will probably not be back to donut bar anytime soon.  I used to love this place but even when I tried to ask of that was the tip jar cause yes I still tipped The chick walked away ignoring me didn't thank me for coming and overall service was terrible and giving me non messed up or burnt donuts was the morning mood.  I suggest you work on treating customers especially your local ones better . Sorry if I typoed her name but I had to ask the chick at coffee for it .   You guys weren't even that busy I've been there and waited with much longer lines but your employee really hurt my feelings and killed my excitement for scoring a unicorn and game of thrones donut .  Overall I won't be back especially since my mom left with no donut because we didn't want to pay for a burnt one and the girl helping us didn't ask if she wanted something else it was the Asian chick at the coffee who even agreed to put it back .   Super sad to place this review but I even warned them while I was there that this wasn't the service I was used to plus she didn't even want to give us a li

b14KZ6VAperjXNN8wddceg.text: This is a new-wave doughnut place which has a an interesting range of different and unusual doughnuts plus an attractive and well-thought-out decor but where the doughnuts often seem mostly to look better than they taste and don't seem to taste as interesting as the ideas would indicate.  We tried a range of different ones, including maple bourbon, Homer, mud pie, and creme brulee.  Of these, one of the best was the Homer, despite the fact that it was huge and seemed likely just to be plain and sweet (and seemed more of a novelty and likely to be characterless).  The Homer actually had the best "doughnut" flavour with good fried-dough character and the icing was actually nice, not just plain sweet.  The creme brulee and maple bourbon just seemed bland and unexpectedly just sweet with little other character.  The mud pie was pretty good.    I'd try this again when in downtown Las Vegas but though it seems a worthy effort so far it is not nearly on the same level as other doughnut places I've been to.

wwKBpboLPUepcHC0W3spZA.text: Looking for a place that delivers creative and delicious donuts?! Look now further because this is your place !! I hope they bring this a little closer to the strip because that would be a game changer. I went to brunch a couple of miles away from this location and thought - I'm on vacation ... I need donuts. This place did not disappoint. Make sure you get there early if you want a lot of options because this small joint is so popular that it sells out quickly. Oh and guess what ?!?! They have vegan donuts tooooooooo and a selection of coffee to pair your sweet donut with. I actually tried a cinnamon roll and it was the bomb dot com. Okay moment of truth, I actually ordered from here two more times during my stay from Uber Eats because they were just that good. And guess what else ?! My favorite donut actually turned out to be the began creme brulee!!! Please visit this place and try as many donuts as you can- you will leave stuffed but wanting more.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow. That cinnamon roll what&#39;s out of this world amazing.
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan donuts

LawYs2-Kwj6EH4dDNHvvng.text: Happy Birthday Donut Bar- 3 years old today!!!!!  Such an accomplishment, and continuing to rock and sell out all the time. They have made the top 10 donut establishments across the country.   When we arrived there was a line of patrons waiting and wanting to try these amazing delectable delights. There are so many to choose from. From Unicorn to  Peanut butter and Jelly.   Each is made fresh and they are differently priced.   Upon entering off of 6th and Carson entrance, you walk up and are quickly greeted by wonderful counter people. They have so many options and are willing to take their time with you. They have espresso and coffee options as well.   There is a small counter you can sit at, however seating is very limited.   I obviously got several to say the least. The owner is very personable as I got the chance to meet him today.  Pricing is a reflection of quality and presentation.   Would def recommend. Once everything sells out, they close- come early  Location is 6th/ Carson - parking is street or lots

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet,  mud pie, birthday cake,  raspberry,  cake batter,  spiced chai
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brulee,  caramel Latte, mud pie, red velvet, birthday cake
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast donut- has to be made, a little wait, but worth it

4V7GpDZVZvzoPORExebtAA.text: These donuts are good! You need to come early because  they sell out only after a few hours from opening!   I went on a Monday around 11:45am and they only had $10 donut boxes aka happy hour. You select a box which contains 12 donuts; a great bargain and each box has a good selection. You just can't pick which donut goes in a box; staff already has them ready. It's a steal cause some of the specialty donuts like the Big Pappa Tart is $5.  If you're in Vegas it's worth a trip down to Donut Bar and you can take in the sights and sounds of Fremont St.  Delicious donuts, good coffee, clean interior and friendly staff makes me want to come back every time I visit Las Vegas.

Lu1GYEXr9QNOYG07qJrsvg.text: I know donuts, by god if there's one thing I've accomplished in this world it's a palette for donuts... VooDoo, Dynamo, Bob's (SF) Blue Star & Donut Friend, I've conquered them all & I have to say this place is comfortably in the same stratosphere of its brethren. I hate the word Artisanal especially when it comes to donuts, but this place is pretty fancy as it comes to ingredients and style of donuts. Stump town coffee & yummy selections such as Nuttella donut with chopped hazelnuts on top. Maple bacon bar, the Homer for those of you that remember the Michael Jackson Simpsons episode! We paid $27 for 2 coffees, 1 bottle water & 7 fancy kine doughnuts! Yes, winchells or Krispy Kreme is like $6-8 for a dozen, but why do you hate yourself? Pay up and treat yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got here around 11am on Thursday and the assortment and freshness was yum-moo!

roxnNYeDvr-W5X8p9u_vcA.text: I really hate rating this place 3/5 but it's my duty to be honest.  I have been looking forward to trying this place since it's opening and two times made the journey downtown from the west side of town to see a sold out sign.  This third time we came on a Monday a little past 10am and it was open.  First off location for me is not convenient so I really was expecting something mind blowing. Bummer that it wasn't the case.  I did appreciate the different variety of choices.  I went for Reese's peanut butter cup since chocolate cake donuts are my favorite and the pop tart donut.  The topping on the Reese's donut was great but the cake donut itself was blah.  This opinion from the girl who thinks pink box chocolate cake donut with chocolate frosting and coco Krispy on top is crack!  The donut didn't have much flavor   Kinda felt like is was just eating a Reese's peanut butter cup. The pop tart donut gave me a little more satisfying feeling but the inconsistency between the edges and the middle was a let down.  Wish the jelly filling was spread more evenly throughout rather than a bit splatter in the middle. In the end I'm very sorry to say I threw them away after a few bites each.  Anyone who knows how much I love donuts know that's shocking!  If I'm in the neighborhood I would give it one more try and try a few different types but definitely will not go out of my way again when pink box, Dunkin' Donuts and Winchells are within 2 miles from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pop tart donut 4/5
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bavarian cream 3/5 hubby had it

z5qGDO3cKFCmU4DuSTrg6A.text: This morning was my first time going in here, I had heard so much about it I had to go in. Unfortunately, the woman with blonde/brown curly hair in a ponytail in the front was so annoyed by me being there I literally didn't even have time to look at the donuts before rushing out a decision as she was wide eyeing and huffing at me. Granted for the first moment I was on the phone in order to VERIFY DONUT ORDERS for other people, god forbid I purchase more from them. To which I got quite the eye roll from the lady. If the donut I rushed out an answer to get because she made me so nervous to browse the selection as I had NEVER BEEN HERE before wasn't so good I would've given one star!!! There was one person in line in front of me it wasn't busy, so why seem so bothered to the point you're rolling your eyes at a customer because they aren't sure what they want. I've never been there how can I know if I don't have the chance to look with out being made to feel bad by their employee. I can't believe the customer service in Vegas is so poor when it's a customer service town. So disappointed at my experience here when I've heard so many good things, must've had bad luck and caught the wrong employee on the wrong day I suppose.

xIVi_O6PXvbZZBaLrlkQhA.text: Used to go to O Face Doughnuts for maple bars so I thought id give this place a try. Was surprised to see the variety they had. Almost too overwhelming but I didn't let that stop me from trying a variety of things. There's maybe too many to list, but what definitely stood out was the French Toast Donut. It's only a weekend run but who really needs doughnuts 7 days a week ;) I did the FTD on a weekly routine for awhile with my bf. It came with hot Vermont maple syrup, whipped butter, and house made blueberry jam. It was usually big enough for me but he's a bigger guy and would also get the blueberry cheesecake donut which he said was the best sweet pastry hes ever had. In addition they also have homemade chocolate milk and cold brew on tap which alone is worth the trip. Awesome friendly staff and a quick in and out experience. I suggest you get here before the donuts run out

XYm4AdUxqz_84cGolr4xUA.text: Plus:  kids got a free 'spongebob' donut, close to my house, very trendy.   Great if you need a sweet fix.   Downside:  overpriced ($29 later for 2 bacon maple bars, 1 caramel latte, 1 mud pie, 2 plain buttermilk, 1 chocolate glazed cake, 1 vanilla bean and 1 pink sprinkle...maybe the spongebob weren't free?);  very heavy and bready and super sweet.   When I left, I just kept thinking 'wow, I just spent $30 on donuts...' Donuts are very large and very sweet.   They don't even make a simple plain glazed.   Not sure if they are going for locals or more tourists, but for locals, I think a much more simpler donut would be nice...along with a lower price.

6OBzXGLliHYZvIHHOgbP7A.text: Wow what a disappointment.  After waiting in the long line outside on the hot dirty city street. My curiosity was piqued by the pompous display of raving reviews and endorsements. But tasting the donuts I was thoroughly disappointed.  Overly sweet, monotone flavors presented in shoddy mass production bakery style formulas. An appeal to hype and popularity if this place has succeeded in anything, it's Marketing. After dropping nearly 40 bucks on a dozen donuts I didn't find a single one that I liked. The Nutella donut was filled with just straight Nutella. Greasy heavy and totally inappropriate mouthfeel for a donut. Would it have been so difficult to whip the Nutella into a Bavarian creme? Lazy patisserie commanding astronomical prices.

H8jxUmBkaTrNoUK6NHyapw.text: While I applaud their marketing strategy (Large 'Sold Out' sign in the window makes one wonder what they've missed out on and make an effort to come back and see) to say I've had better donuts is an understatement.   Getting there early one is greeted by rows of elegant looking donuts with creative names and flavors and a helpful staff.  Donuts aren't cheap but not as expensive as some have complained about ($5.00 for 2 - what do you expect for the "Best Donuts In the World").  I opted for a creme brulee donut for the BF and a (huge) Mud Pie one for me.  My friend got a Boston Creme for herself.   As soon as she took a bite of the Boston Creme I knew this was not the "Best Donut In The World" entirely too doughy not enough creme.  Creme didn't go all the way through the bar.   My Mud Pie tasted like a donut with chocolate sprinkles.  Fancy name for a less than average donut.  Again the thing was HUGE which meant a lot of dough for not nearly enough topping.  I ate about half and got bored (BORED! With a donut!!!)  The BF's review was the worst.  He took one bite and said it was the worst donut he'd ever had and that the cooking oil needed to be changed (he works in the food industry and I don't so he is more aware of such things).  He refused to eat any more (however, helpfully offered me a bite - which I declined).  He puts the creme brulee as "worse than Dunkin' Donuts" which is about as low as it goes in his book.   Maybe I don't have the refined donut palette of some of the other clientele, maybe I'm just looking for something different in my breakfast pastries.  But I will skip this one next time.

nZWyzUk4rCInlsvddIN4wQ.text: This wonderful place was included in a Foodie Tour that my husband & I took while in Vegas last fall.  Great donuts - we tried the French Toast, which was included in our tour.  Enjoyed our donut on the patio out back.  Glad that we found this hidden gem in downtown Vegas!!

zoP9SgZitbB0wDJtrMJwzA.text: Found this place through Insider Eats. I was drawn to the Creme Burlee dounut. They have a Homer Simpson donut. I not big into flavored donuts, but I liked the Vanilla Bean and Cake Batter donuts. They have your typical Bacon Maple and Bacon Chocolate donut. There are fun flavors like PB&J, Red Velvet, Mud Pie. All the donuts are made fresh. Some people may feel it's overrated, but it's an overall good find.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QKzZI-lZKqBfPRI5wOVcHw.text: To me I wouldn't call these the best doughnuts, but it was good! The shop is cute and staff are super helpful in helping you, if you have any questions. I was super excited about the cream brulee donut, but that was just ok the outside was nice like a candy shell, but they center was too much like vanilla pudding instead of cream brulee taste. But, my kids loved the Oreo, vanilla glazed and the Nutella dough nut. ---extra points for the vanilla glaze doughnut, one of the more simple doughnuts they offer but hits the spot---

6JzgGJ87OzqQlfAapogrSw.text: Great place, nice people, they sell out quick so come early. They have coffee self serve. Come for the donuts not the coffee really cute place.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S6Vpdvbphgcxcb0nYOCB4w.text: A good place to go to at least once. Depending on the time of day and weekend, the line will be out the door. They have a variety of different fancy donuts. It is a small little place with not much seating. There is a back patio area if you don't mind sitting in the heat. Staff were very friendly! Make sure not to miss the fish tank inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday donuts!

xqXigpMPJ3UGKfY1uY9koA.text: On a recommendation from a LV friend, we ventured to downtown to grab custom donuts. Now, I may be biased as I am a hardcore Simpson's fan and the shop paid homage to Mr. Donut (Homer Simpson), but the donuts we had were truly delicious without being an overly heavy donut. Which was good seeing as how it was 112 degrees out.   The creme brulee was fantastic, only to be trumped by the chocolate espresso donut. Loved it. Thanks Donut Bar!!!

lahZ6ceNYPzughcd17MpbQ.text: Best donuts... Hands down! I love donuts and this place has whilst favorites and other inventive choices. I highly recommend the maple bacon cinnamon roll.... To die for!

qXrp1ZNEKY-5LYCAaEb-gg.text: I had their pink sprinkles and creme brulee. There was nothing special about them. The filling for the creme brulee was one sided and minimal. The pink sprinkles one was not even moist on the inside. It was very dry. And even with a mustache, the lady called me ma'am lol.

DkEEQ74uOPIN6jOaCrzUyg.text: Man oh man can you drop a pretty penny here. Donuts start at $3 and go up to $6! Watch out for those pricey ones though, they're monsters..  I believe between four friends, we ordered to our hearts content (which ended up being 8 donuts and about $35, including chocolate milk for all). They supposedly have homemade strawberry milk on tap but I have my doubts since they were sold out the last two times I tried to stop in. (Maybe the trick is to go early? But how do I know the strawberry milk is worth getting up at 7am???)  In any case, the donuts were magic. I highly recommend the creme brulee donut since it was one of the more unique ones we had. Personally, not my favorite. The caramelization on top tasted more like honey to me than anything else but I still recommend giving it a go since I've never seen anything like it anywhere else. Also the big poppa tart donuts are INSANE. Way too much volume for my belly. It was tasty but hard to enjoy such a monstrosity. I ended up taking two-thirds of it home. We also tried the strawberry split though I wasn't all that impressed. It's a sugar donut with whipped cream and strawberries in it.. plain and simple. There are definitely better options here, in my opinion..  If I were to offer a few pieces of advice: stick to the classics (they do their simple donuts very VERY well) and GO EARLY TO GET THE STRAWBERRY MILK. I think it's one of those mystical menu items that may or may not exist in real life.. hmm...

lDqtKVqW3zZ3egr3a56tzw.text: Donuts are okay. They have an interesting selection. Pricier than average, but you pay for the novelty. Had a caramel espresso donut. Seems like a regular yeast donut heavily iced. It was huge. I didn't taste coffee but it was covered in caramel. Tried the birthday cake donut. It was okay. After the hype from others, I expected more. I prefer Crunch donuts for novelty.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iHyvAJD7ho7NhUOsRYVAYg.text: I finally visited Donut Bar after a few weeks of stalking their Instagram and frequently checking Yelp. Overall, it was okay. I came in around 11 AM on a Monday, and they still had quite a selection left to choose from. It's a cute shop with a nice outdoor section to enjoy your donuts, too. The music is a bit loud inside. The staff is friendly and helpful; I asked a few questions, and they were happy to help me pick out my donuts.   The only donuts I really enjoyed and would probably come back for are the creme brulee, Homer's donut, and the "Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo." I didn't get to try the strawberry split I was also interested in, but maybe that will be for another visit.   Not a bad experience at all, just a little bit less than what I was expecting.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 12 donuts and the 13th one was free!

jcL8q-p719EmITfs_Ra_qw.text: Went here on vacation, donuts and staff are excellent.  The Carmel, and strawberry whip cream donut were delicious.  The mud pie was ok was a little different with peanut butter, think the one we got was a little dry but still good.  Overall will be back to this chain as donuts and coffee are always a good breakfast!

jS833Fk7DU61sSgw-y5Ynw.text: AMAZING! AWESOME! A whole new level in donuts... Very friendly, customer oriented staff, easy street parking but I live close and walk... Get in early because the line begins at 7am. Definitely a pilgrimage for donut connoisseurs!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZoIg3L5qca4DeEC03jHvzQ.text: I heard about this place and the amazing donuts they have. You need to be early to get all their amazing donuts because they sell out fast! Definitely try their daily specials and be prepared to want everything on display.

6C_Jwg7LHUMCxr3sOwm9kA.text: 1 star for their hours, 5 stars for existing because they really do have the BEST donuts in Vegas. How can you possibly go wrong with such divinely inspired, ethereal masterpieces? With a wide variety of delicious treasures, the Willy Wonka's of donuts has something for everyone, whether you're five or ninety nine.  With donuts as thick as a paperback, one can easily be shared with two. Find your happy morning in Donut Bar. Once you try one, you'll swear off Dunkin forever.  Just get there REALLY early. 12pm closing time may not be convenient for you. It never is for me.

E-rI4oiCuN7gnSGL41c_Gg.text: Blah, stale donuts. For $17 I got 3 Donuts 2 coffees. Selection was small for 10:30 on a Monday so I had to pick what was left or they offered me an ice cream for breakfast.... apple fritter was rock hard, strawberry cheesecake donut tasted like a regular jelly filled donut, and birthday donut was a regular sprinkled donut... nothing special. Very disappointing. Used to newer donut shops were donuts are made fresh per hour (sidecar, dough donuts)

npxb-sYYDN10g6eXe_osOw.text: All donuts were yummy. So many choices wish we were there long enough to try them all.

SqepZYm6xPRdNf27aL1_uw.text: Wow wow wow there doughnuts are amazing delicious and there coffee is delicious also they have a cute patio are we're you can chill and have you coffee and donuts love this place.

vWfzi-WJtPKKy9ccfkSMHg.text: The donuts are amazing! It's no wonder why they go quick. Whatever Jeff and his staff are doing behind the scenes they definitely should not stop. I had ordered an assortment for a birthday party donut wall and Donut Bar LV did not disappoint, it was a total hit!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pHkECeLKBmZ28PFc_z3MHg.text: Place is amazing.  Let me say that donuts are my weakness!!!! So many people would be surprised to pay 3-6 bucks for a donut, but I honestly say... worth it!  I had the French toast donut!  Amazing.  Served with butter and syrup, also with a side of blue berry jelly.  I destroyed it.  I've also tried the pop tart donut, the birthday cake, Creame Brulee, samoa, oreo, and red velvet.  All ok.    I would say try the pop tart one, but it's share it.  It's super rich and filling.

U5BQzWUZnx6c7h0sq8A33A.text: So okay donut fans!  I didn't think I would ever break away from my 40 year DD habit, but I found something better than those "wicked donuts from DD".  I had forgotten how tasty a donut can be until I stumbled upon this place while hanging in Downtown LV.  Seriously, these guys know how make a donut explode with tastiness on your tongue.  Somehow they found a way to artistically create a culinary composition of a clever captivation that just wows your senses.  This is the kind of experience that one must repeat, and I would strongly urge you to make this a regular spot for you and yours!

oQJMwAsruonmVtuPt4OpJQ.text: Go early!   Holy selections Batman. During our short trip to Vegas, we visited this location twice. First time was already close to their closing time, despite a fewer selection we still left happy enough to return for more choices.  Second time we came back, we basically overloaded our capacity as everything looked amazing.  You NEED to try the creme brulee donut.

7YU9GgTLhR8bfNz-qFgosA.text: I don't like donuts.  But l love these donuts. Dunkin, Krispy Kreme, and Winchells never really impressed me. My issues with donuts is they always smell better than they taste. But at the donut bar, they taste  just as good if not better than you imagined. I can tell that the donut bar uses fresh ingredients and takes pride in their craft. I wish it were a bit bigger but that's only because I'd like to sit and eat all the different donuts they offer. Definitely going back. Again and again.

Z0yhLvtLehit4AQeD9nucA.text: Giant.  Giant donuts.  Delicious giant donuts.  Amazingly puffy delicious giant donuts.  Fresh and amazingly puffy delicious giant donuts.  Great variety of puffy delicious giant donuts.  I failed to eat just one giant donut.  It was a delicious giant donut.  Giant donut!  Giant!  Be sure to get there early because they are open until they sell out.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pm_v2lBOiBKAC6Xj8cgX3g.text: The best vegan doughnuts I've ever had. Everyday, the menu had something new and tasty. If you go you have to try their apple fritters, they are delicious and huge. Their chocolate cake doughnuts look average, but are like nothing I've ever had...they are light and airy. They even have a whipped cream and strawberry vegan doughnut...amazing. Only tried the vegan doughnuts, but this place sells out everyday...get there early!

QNDBJZ5bsNss9ii3dbZFUQ.text: Absolutely wonderful. Everything is so fresh, the nitro coffee is phenomenal, and every single worker was extremely pleasant. Loved the holiday treats they put out as well. As a local, I will be returning.

7FTTI60N2GioCqL1RCVxoA.text: This place is wonderful. The donuts are as delicious as they are creative. I like how they change up what they offer daily, and keep some of the staples. French Toast Donuts? Creme Brulee Donuts? Hello!   Also, the soft-serve in a donut cone is to die for.   The place is pretty tiny, and the line can be confusing since they have two front doors and don't specify which you should enter from to get in line. I've seen some shade thrown over people jumping ahead in line because they came in the out door. For future reference, it's the easternmost door.   They have a good concept with keeping limited hours, and closing when they sell out. Sad when you want a donut when you're waking up at 1:00 pm after closing a restaurant the night before, but smart for them.

UQGxrM0JAKaaOc2EI-GU7Q.text: The biggest donuts in town friendly service music coffee drinks easy parking did I say donuts? Offering custom French Toast on Sundays. I recommend you treat yourself here often

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy

cZRYjLtBuwVPbX4AYsr5lw.text: I am big fan of Donuts and believe me I have been to palaces where they have amazing donuts.  This is by far one of the best donuts place I have been too.  It is like hidden gem in downtown.  Place opens (on Sundays) at 8am (pst).  You will find line forming from 7:30am.  8am store opens and some one comes out from store and counts how many kids they have in line with their family at that time...Chef and his assistance comes out with plate of freshly made donuts for kids and gives them each.  Assistance hand over balloon to kids.  Then they start serving you.    You get in the shop and welcomed with smile and amazing smell of fresh donuts, cream and coffee.  They take time to serve you, answer your questions and get your order ready.  By the time you get to cashier, your order is ready!   Place is clean, great happy environment, awesome service and amazing donuts.  MUST VISIT THIS PLACE AND HAVE DONUTS....

Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line... Out the door II

q3mSVXkq9bTFH-iBmlf6rw.text: Amazing donuts and fun staff! Come hungry and with a sweet tooth. Their donuts as so delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vAe0eWsSRYulyRZKvjOWqg.text: Came by for the Strawberry Split.  Last time we came at almost closing time and they were pretty much out of everything.  I walked in and was so happy to see the Strawberry Split!  It was huge!  My husband got the Expresso Chocolate and my chocoholic friend went for the Triple Chocolate Threat after being disappointed that they didn't have the Chocolate Euphoria today.  Theirs were both cake donuts and we felt they weren't anything too special.  My friend commented the Chocolate Threat was not even Chocolatey enough and I agree.  I came here for the Strawberry and I was not disappointed.  The donut is bit crusty like a croissant.  I would prefer like a soft donut but my husband and friend enjoyed the "crust" the way it was.  My husband also commented that it reminded him of a Chinese birthday cake.  I felt satisfied with what I had been waiting for....months or years...

3mHOKsllf9XMtI2lORQbMg.text: Everything about this place is fun and fattening.  Yes, they actually do have a grilled cheese donut for your dining pleasure.   Lots of specialty donuts.  Too bad they aren't open later in the day.  Get there early!

JdLR4CW2whwsbW5RIcNleQ.text: Cute shop with amazing donuts! Great tasting Mochas and friendly staff. We'll be back again when we visit Las Vegas.

wns3mP1UM1HquifQ8_ah4A.text: Fun donut shop with really interesting flavors. Try the Big Poppa Tart or Creme Brulee!

7RUSeoc7PJi1b256RuRrzw.text: I had to see what all the hype was about. I am NOT a morning person, but I dragged my ass out of bed and headed downtown for a donut. I was there around 7:45a and there were still about 20 people in line ahead of me. Get there early because they close once they sell out.  They post their menu for the following day on Instagram. I decided before I got there that I was going  to get the Creme Brulee donut. I promised myself I was only getting 1. I lied. I left with 6.  I did get my Creme Brulee, but I also got a Vanilla Bean Glazed, Strawberry Poppa Tart, Twix, a Maple Bar, & Cake Batter. It was around $20. I seriously ate nothing but Donuts all day. And, they were huge, fresh, & delicious. Completely worth getting up early, driving across town, and paying too much for!  I already have my next must try flavors picked out. Caramelized Pineapple, S'mores Poppa Tart, Banana Caramel, Samoa, Apple Fritter, & Blood Orange.  Best Donuts in Las Vegas!! A MUST TRY!!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wFlV3kmDyMyU_XP_QDeqlw.text: They stayed open into late afternoon for Life Is Beautiful so I was finally able to try these gems on our way into the festival! We tried Butter Beer donut first, which was delightful, but the crown jewel was the strawberry Big Poppa Tart with a full size Pop-Tart baked right in the middle. This donut was DELICIOUS, with what tasted like strawberry jam oozing everywhere. Nicely done, Donut Bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Big Poppa Tart (top) and Butter Beer (below). Forgot to take photo until after first bite!

HRHW9RdmFV_NPjr4i9XOBQ.text: Absolutely fantastic. Such an approachable vibe, the people are helpful & nice and the donuts are WORTH THE HYPE. I recommend their famous Big Poppa Tart - it has a poptart INSIDE it. Other notable ones: birthday cake with an Oreo inside, blueberry cheesecake, and red velvet. Price is very reasonable for a "gourmet" donut. Also, Chef Jeff is the best  Truly the #bestdonutsintheworld !

I loved all the novelty choices like banana caramel, creme brulee, Nutella, etc and wanted to order more but ordered just enough for breakfast.  The Stumptown iced coffee at around $4.50 was delicious as always and seems to be in every store I visit! Coming here again for some AMAZING Donuts!!

EM1huu6qQhro1ne0LLAHRQ.text: This place was on our way and dang it, I wanted a fritter! So we stopped. Luckily the line was short. Among the usual flavors (glazed and cake etc)!here was a great selection of different flavors like the Creme brulee , French toast and grilled cheese donuts. I got my fritter, a chocolate bar, cake donut and a couple other flavors. All were sweet and looked good but ended up being pretty dry. The fritter seemed over fried especially the edges.

a0nu77M3vb14BtSd2SL7Dw.text: The hype is not real unfortunately. To each their own I guess, but I was only impressed with a few of their donuts. The pop tart ones are good. Strawberry being the best by far. The blueberry was ok and the smores one was WAY too sweet, like eat one bite and get diabetes sweet. Creme Brule is a good idea but that sugar coat on top makes for difficult chewing.  Their apple fritter was actually pretty bad. I took a bite and threw it away, had a burnt quality to it. Personally, I enjoy donuts with a glaze AND something on top or filled. Most of these are plain donuts with something on top.  I wanted to love this place. I was there at their grand opening and even met the owner. But I couldn't love it, only like certain things. That being said, their french toast donut is amazing as well as their churro donut ice cream cone. Both of those things along with their strawberry pop tart are worth it.

PrxODLHIKSqt5KkaE-2hdQ.text: I wanted to give the place four stars, but the doughnut quality bordered on "day--old bread." The kids loved the decadence of it all, though. The Mexican chocolate doughnut was fantastic. The one awesome thing about the Donut Bar is the monstrous portion sizes.

K1GeASoINtXDUkg0SeARnQ.text: After getting to experience Donut Bar in San Diego, I was stoked to find out they were coming to Vegas! Friendly staff, we were greeted with smiles and offer suggestions on what to order.  I chose a plain old fashioned donut, the Homer, a caramel latte and last but certainly not least....the Poptart!!!!  Which I topped off with a cold brew Stumptown coffee.  In the words of Ice Cube "today was a good day"!

MgzIMkUwTwVV89VRlM__fg.text: Ridiculous!  We tried the Lemon donut, Mud Pie, chocolate bacon bar and the maple bacon cinnamon roll.... YUM.  The mocha is the best I've ever had. Great coffee!!! Coming back!

92cDPkQcTKGCJmPh-q4PTA.text: So me and my mother came down because we heard about these doughnuts and unfortunately i wasn't super impressed. They were good just not for the price we had gotten the strawberry splits and the doughnut was a little hard on top and cream was a little stiff. We also had the creme brulee which was the more expensive doughnut and wasn't worth the price.

C4iqVNghIOxApba9SVdtcw.text: Honestly love this place! I'm not a donut person and don't have a sweet tooth at all, but I'd have a donut from here everyday if life allowed it. Donuts are a bit pricier than your regular donut place but completely worth every cent.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RdHp2f3Q-5xv2_-TQ4RelQ.text: Donut bar takes donuts to the next level. I have had three donuts from here (homer simpson, boston cream, oreo birthday) and all were great. There is a new menu each time with some staples. The donuts are $2-4 each but delicious and some are really meant for two people. They also have caffeine drinks.   The location is a block off of Freemont so pretty easy to get to. But, it is pretty popular so don't wait too long to go.   Go early, go hungry, buy some extra to go for later!

xqacTncIrTI9bbfyQee6eg.text: Stumbled across this place while looking for a sweet breakfast spot near my office. I had no idea what to expect since I'm a little late on the hype of this place. Walking in the doors I was greeted and I immediately diverted my attention to the array of donuts waiting for me to eat! I did not know what to choose and I couldn't just get 1 so I got 3! Creme Brulee, Strawberry Cheesecake and the Birthday Cake Oreo! The Creme Brulee had all the components of what you're used to, it's a bit dry but once you get to the filling, it just makes it all so much better. You bite into it and you hear that nice sugar cracking and then there's no going back. The Strawberry Cheesecake was my favorite out of the 3 because it was just so creamy and just perfect! It tasted like I was eating a cheesecake and once I had the first taste of filling, I just couldn't stop. The Oreo Birthday Cake was a great combination as well, it had a bit too much frosting for my taste but overall was a good one too!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gkowgZFyB09u2SBuiAXaVg.text: My first time here since they took over from the old O face. I have to say I am very impressed!! When first walking in the environment is hip. The smell is so amazing and could be smelled from a block away!!   We decided to order a dozen to make sure we all got try everything we wanted. We ordered almost every kind or at least the kinds that we wanted to.   My favorite is the French toast, so amazing and super fresh!! They make it right when you order it!! That could be breakfast alone.   Price point was not bad for the size of the donuts you get! The staff was friendly and the chefs talked to us as we checked out.   Check in on Yelp for your free expresso!! What a wake up call.   We will be back soon enough!!

6m6F45ZzgOJt0GjKH2xYuw.text: Damn good pastries.  A must try in the DT Vegas area.  I had the cheese cake and creme Brulee, both fabulous.  They even have the Homer pink donut.  The coffee's hot a fresh, and great tunes on.  There's also a cool relaxing fish tank to stare at.

eb8jzSqlVSz5zoYao48sQg.text: Well I'm on a donut review writing spree right now, so I may as well write about one of my top 3 donut places in Las Vegas.   I dare say Donut Bar actually makes my top 3 donut places in North America too!  (The other two being Blue Star donuts in Portland and Cartems Donuterie in Vancouver Canada)  Why is Donut Bar so darn good?  Donut standards keep going up, and these days, you can't just have a good donut.  You need something that stands out to make your donut shop - 'worth a journey'.  At Donut bar, they've got TWO things that I gladly journey out for - their ice cream donut, and their creme brulee donut.  That's not even mentioning their other donuts (strawberry, vanilla bean, maple bacon) that are full of flavourful donuty goodness and excellent in their own right.    Unlike Pinkbox, Donut bar closes when they run out of donuts.  That's usually around noon?  Depending on how picky you are about your donut options, come early.  They only make about 25 of their ice cream donuts every day, and they usually aim to have those ready by 10.  I know eating an ice cream cone at 10am in the morning feels a little strange, but it was worth it for me.  I haven't had their horchata donut, but I've seen photos -- looks pretty amazing.  As soon as I lose my donut weight I'm going right back to hunt for this donut!

LrR9NhjgrnNtmag7qRqWqw.text: This was one of my planned stops while in Vegas...SO GLAD I stopped in! The menu of donuts...omg...seriously,  how does one decide between lemon cheesecake, Meyer lemon blueberry and triple threat chocolate? You DON'T! You get them all! Not to mention the other delicious, creative flavors, like the donut with an OREO in the middle. Be still my heart! The coffee drinks were fabulous, the staff were so friendly and the bathroom, well, I'll leave it as a secret and just tell you to check it out! Will be back before I leave this town. GO. SEE. ENJOY!

wfRacGPKcymrSWmr_6q2Hw.text: Great! Huge, delicious donuts and super strong cold brew coffee. They are only open for a few hours a day so be sure to get there early before they run out!

VEqn1HYdMCFJPha78O7KmA.text: There was only few donuts to select through and it was just basic donuts. This was my first time going and will be my last time going. No high chairs in there for my baby.  Stay away from this place. This is not a donut bar with only 3 choices to choose from.

rsJwsL8X1LY2tvbA1ocE3g.text: This place is a hidden gem!  The donuts are amazing and so creative.  It's the perfect spot for a quick breakfast, and afternoon snack!  Get there early because once they Sold out they are closed for the day.  Dont miss out! We will be back every year we come to Vegas.

_IWudMDujEtfKvFupehYAw.text: My mind was blown today when I tried these delicious donuts.  I came in near closing time so there was only three options: coconut,  blueberry,and poptart. We went with the giant coconut and split it between 3 people. It was incredible!  By far one of the best donuts I have even had in my life! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this place and I will be sending my hotel guests to this amazing place.

VSeFtqa1eVjuUMxJj7UoVA.text: Tasty donuts! So many flavors it was hard to pick. The donuts are giant! Reasonable priced at $3/donut. We ended up with one red velvet, chai, strawberry cheesecake, and creme brulee. So good! I also got a creamy chai latte made almond milk, yes they have ALMOND milk, and stumptown coffee! They also have coffee brew on tap and I'm pretty sure they serve alcohol. They also have the option of putting frozen yogurt on your donuts. Wow! Try it!   Uber Eats delivers from there and they have been featured on many food websites such as Food Network, Thrillist, and Forbes Magazine. Eat up!

x3FtVCWgEoNuEw6WebFYeQ.text: Really good donuts. They have a nice selection as well. Never thought pop tarts in donuts would be so good. Only knock is the location and the price is a bit high.

e1h_ectH8xyePCdccZKIMA.text: Came here for the first time and I must say, this place is pretty amazing. From unique donuts to classic donuts they all tasted great. I'd say its pretty pricey for some donuts but it's so worth it. They even ask for your name to put on the box so that makes me felt a little special.   The staff is friendly and energized which is great for the downtown area. The drinks look amazing but I decided to get a simple strawberry milk and chocolate milk, which complemented the donuts even more. I'll definitely be coming back here.   Some tips I'd recommend  - Get there early preferably in the morning because they do sell till they run out of donuts. - If its a nice day I'd recommend eating outside in the back because it has a nice feel to it.  - Always get a drink even if its just milk!

The menu rotates everyday so you can have different options. I hope to try their other donuts on their menu, my favorite is the birthday cake oreo, blueberry meyer, and raspberry.

BwA1pbnYwXjtS9GYyUotJQ.text: Loved my experience at the Donut Bar. When you walk in the door the smell of freshly baked donuts is incredible. The music is loud and the energy in the restaurant is a great day to get the day started. There was a wide selection of donuts. I chose the Homer Simpson. It was perfectly baked with a nice pink rich strawberry frosting and sprinkles. I also ordered a large coffee, however I was not impressed. It was self serve for coffee with various blends. There was no dark roast to chose from. Seating inside is limited, but there were amble seats available outside with plenty of shaded options. I'll definitely be back!
