QK9DlIs6yPQZqQns-FRT5w.text: Spontaneity wins!  At 9am on a Thursday, my friend and I decided to check out Donut Bar. There was no line!   The photos don't do the donut size justice. The large ones are truly huge and easily split-able, which is great for trying multiple with friends.  I tasted 3 "small" donuts: toasted coconut, creme brule, and nutella explosion. They were all great - loved their consistency and Donut Bar's playfulness with the decorations.  To top it office, the prices were great! Totally reasonable for a "craze" food, quality, and quantity.  What a food adventure! Definitely check this spot out.

hSZWvjBog0IsCBIvD8IV8w.text: These donuts are dynamite! If you come near closing (in my case ten minutes before closing) you can get a box of donuts for $10 and this box is like the size of a pizza box. As tempting as that was, I opted for their other end of day special - 2 donuts for $5.   The pop tart donut was really like a pop tart...donut. it was so good! That fruity jelly on the inside. Frosting on top. I had no regrets eating this. Well, it was way too big so I only ate a quarter of it. Share.   The Apple donut was good even though I ate it the next day! Mind blown. That means they fried it well because usually poorly fried donuts are soggy the next day.   I love this place so much I even bought their shirt...Donut kill my vibe!

tfdMQ7iuiyNP4N8T-1Y0ig.text: Donuts after drinking in Vegas? Yes.   I came here the morning after a night of drinking and what a good idea that was. My comrade and I picked up three donuts to sop up what was left of our Fat Tuesday drinks marinating in our digestive tracts.   We picked up two giant donuts (one birthday cake and the other nutella) and one regular sized (strawberry shortcake). For me, the star was the strawberry shortcake. It's like one of those ice cream bars you'd eat as a kid (who am I kidding? I eat them as an adult too) but in donut form.  It's the cake donut type but it's all pinkish due to the strawberries in the donut. Yes. PLEASE.   The larger donuts we got were the yeast type donuts. Both tasted the same except for the toppings. One was topped with frosting and sprinkles (that tastes like the canned frosting, yum) and the other nutella. Both delicious and easy to share between three people.   I'm already yearning for these when I come back.

-wT8kB9HE6WVqgYMSKtZSQ.text: Donut Bar is located a block from Fremont Street Experience and their donuts are simply amazing.   I've tried to come mid morning but every time they were sold out. I suggest you come as soon as they open to get exactly what you want because they do sell fast.  I tried the sprinkled Oreo stuffed donut and my oh my was it good. They have a ton of selections and I highly recommend them.  I defiantly see why they were voted the best donuts in Vegas.

K4L5sa9tmJdNSA3ZZfLUAw.text: Great selection and second best only to District donuts Sliders Brew and brew. Definitely worth the visit

Uw9urr5-rvKlyLIaBoTj6A.text: I stopped by in August for a drink, thanks to the extreme heat! I ordered a White Chocolate Mocha. Unfortunately, no doughnuts were on display. Basically, I was getting to know the neighborhood. I was mesmerized by the doughnut ornament inside the fishtank.

yOO9hjNT4clGyHhGthK22Q.text: Was posted in the area for work and managed to make it in right after they opened. The selection of donuts is amazing! They dream up some of the most delicious combinations you can imagine as well as keeping a few simple classics on hand. The place is filled with energy and the staff really does show pride in their creations!

CUlRv8cgngNQIdF8VK5BOQ.text: Quick service great section of doughnuts. Was worth the short drive to find. Parking is cheap across the street from the shop. 1.00 per hour

YUoKWs6aPgiHPvFMHbWkkQ.text: Donut bar was a fun and good experience. The wife and I and friends tried a handful of different types of donuts that you can only get there. If you're looking for your regular typical donut this probably is not a spot for you. I really like normal donuts but I was in town and had to try them. We ordered the big vanilla donut and a apple cake donut or apple crumb donuts sorry and another cake batter doughnut. They all had phenomenal flavor and we're not your normal donut. If you're looking for a new spot then you should make sure to try this one.  Apparently there is a grilled cheese donut you can try, I think if I knew that I would try it again.

GcN_ww7gO5u5qxARMQNTpg.text: About a year ago we stumbled across this place and went in. Several of us and we all got multiple doughnuts to share so we could try more than one. Then the donuts were AMAZING! Great flavor. Fresh. Not just a typical donut and they seemed set apart.   We've been I think 3 or 4 times as we come back and visit vegas.   This trip we made the haul all the way from the other end of the strip to get some donuts for our few days stay. We got 6 - yes 6 big donuts. Unfortunately this time we were pretty disappointed. It seems they've changed something and the donuts are more cakey like, seem less fresh and the flavors just aren't there. They have the options of flavors but the best part about the donuts this time was things they didn't make: Nutella inside, Oreos on top, etc. The donuts weren't bad they just didn't seem as set apart and special or worth the hike from the other end of the strip. Not sure if we'd go back or venture to other donut places on the strip next time.

s-tTC-oqNpXCkMh42DYXsQ.text: I have a love/hate relationship with Donut Bar. Unquestionably, the donuts are good. Are they worth $5 a piece? Definitely not.   Donut Bar has an excellent variety and without a doubt grade A marketing. I'll literally be scrolling through Instagram, see a photo of their donuts, and instantly begin prioritizing my need to drive all the way downtown to pick up a French Toast donut.   In comparison to other donut shops throughout the valley, Donut Bar offers a variety of vegan donuts, made to order options, and some very "creative" choices- such as the "Big Poppa tart", a donut literally stuffed with a pop tart. As for the quality- arguable. Yes, they open super early and obviously if you get there later in the day they won't be as "fresh"- but hey, if I'm getting a "stale" donut it seems obscure to pay $4 or $5 for it. Definitely think they need a price adjustment.   Flavor is a 10/10. In all the times I've been to donut bar I can honestly say I've never not loved the taste of any of their donuts. My most favorite would have to be the strawberry shortcake and the Oreo birthday cake- both absolutely delicious!   The employees are also very kind and are very quick to give recommendations. I've been here super early at opening to when they were just about sold out and have always experienced exceptional service.   Overall, Donut Bar is great- I'd just recommend an early arrival and preparation to pay upwards of $30 for a half dozen donuts.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast donut

meiCrW7h_X_AESOLqeBB-w.text: There is a reason why Donut Bar was voted best donut in Las Vegas let alone in the country by numerous sites.  Donut Bar has a wide variety of donuts that can meet everyone's needs.  All of their donuts are made to perfection.  They are light, fluffy, gooey, and any other adjective you can think of.  The french toast donut is the go to donut.  Just imagine a massive circular french toast covered in powered sugar and then the drizzle of the warm maple syrup.  Other donuts to consider would be the Big Pappa Donut which has a whole pop tart inside the donut!  This thing weights 1lb!  Next you have to get the creme brulee donut which is a soft yeast round filled with creme brulee and topped with caramelized sugar!  The next must have would be the Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo which is Birthday Cake Oreo stuffed donut topped with cake batter glaze, pastel sequins, and cookie crumbs.  This place is also very welcoming.  The staff is super friendly and the head Chef Jeff is one of the nicest people you will ever meet!  So, if you are in Vegas and you are craving Donuts and coffee (They Serve Nitro Cold Brew Too) stop by Donut Bar!  Donut miss out!  BrandonFitFoodie

Some of the best donuts ever. Don't miss out on the poppa tart, which is a giant pop tart shaped donut decorated like a pop tart and then has an actual entire pop tart inside it when you bite in!! Also the candied bacon  apple fritter is banging!! Creme Brulee, PBJ bar and blueberry myer lemon all amazing! If you are a donut fan this is a must stop place!

NWr6NTkLhwECreDhZiCldg.text: Fantastic Spot for Premium Donuts  When I heard San Diego's Donut Bar set up a location in Vegas, I just had to have it again. In SD, I had the Strawberry Split (an unforgettable fruity donut stuffed with whipped cream, $4) and I was pleased to see it again here in Vegas. But on this trip I had to try something new.  On this Saturday morning we got there pretty late, around 10:30am, and it seemed like a lot had already been sold.  Of what remained, I had two donuts: Creme Brulee ($2) & the Twix donut ($2).  I gotta say, both Donuts were unlike anything I've ever had before. The brulee had a sweet sticky crunch layer of molten sugar and filled on the inside with sweet cream. I knew going into the Twix I would be smacked with an explosion of chocolate and it did not disappoint - Twix bar crumbs covered the top layer of thick chocolate dressing on chocolate dough.  Amazing!  For your coffee craving, there're several options to choose: espresso, mocha, chai latte, drip, etc.  I had the Americano - a super smooth black coffee.  Plans for my next visit, try two new donuts, try the drip coffee, and ARRIVE EARLY!!!

Drip coffee is $1 which is a very welcome surprise!  I would stop by even just for the coffee because it is delic.  The staff is so welcoming and friendly.  I cannot say enough good things about this place.  I tell everyone I meet to go try it!

cgqjqe8ZvbJXV73w7NtTVA.text: Stopped here last weekend while visiting Las Vegas. Because of the reviews, I made my husband stop by. First of all, they have many different creative ideas (as far as shape and flavor). Secondly, the donuts were fresh!  Third, the staff was nice and friendly and seemed like they liked their jobs. We purchased the creme brulee, red velvet, and blueberry cheesecake donuts. I think what is special about this place is the different types/styles of donuts. I thought the donut fishtank was cute too!!  I also liked the "barstyle" set up (bar table/stools) they have there. The one in San Diego serves beer so I think as this Vegas location grows they should serve different items to stay competitive. The hours are from 8-1 pm on the weekdays and 8-12 on the weekends because it is said they sell out of all of the donuts by those times, however, there were many donuts available around 11:30 am last Sunday when we were there, so I don't understand that statement. No different than other donut shop as far as taste goes but will be back again when in the Fremont district.

KKqg1y4v9yyz6qoqtUnRhA.text: on a recent trip a friend said to stop by and try the donuts and give him my thoughts... well not  a fan of the two donuts i had.... first i was surprised by the size of the donuts... huge. almost too big... i am not sure you can call them donuts.... doughnut planet in nyc has big doughnuts but these were far bigger..... the variety was varied and all interesting but the two i selected were flavor-less. vanilla bean and boston creme... the cakes of both had no flavor but the filling of the boston creme was delicious. the shop is cute enough and the people friendly but please donut bar invest in paper bags for the donuts..walking out of the shop with two donuts in a box seems like such a waste and not what the earth needs......

EyOvxAfjsS8TGCwYFeg_DA.text: Finding this place was a total fluke as they have a back enterace which I thought was an apartment building. There were people eating at table's in an open air type patio which reminded me of San Fran. I heard loud music, saw an incredible fish tank, and had to check it out. Shocked to find it was a donut shop since it seemed to be "hip". Didn't know such a thing existed.  Wasn't hungry, but I wasn't going to leave without trying one of their many unique donuts. Crazy combinations. Poptart inside a donut? Who'd of thunk? I got the Strawberry  Shortcake, or was it Strawberry Shortpuff, as it was loaded with whipped deliciousness topped with strawberries. Spent 10 minutes in bathroom taking photos. Check this place out! Must pay for parking, but no big deal. Machines take all forms of payment. Worth it.

Today especially I came in with my dog and as I was going out to the patio I spilled my cold brew on the floor. Immediately the staff came over and replaced my coffee, and were super nice after the mess my dog and I made. It's these things that are the signs of a well run business. 5 stars All the Way. Thanks Donut Bar.

zok0oGze6kPon2ijMbLXMA.text: I can't eat gluten but the coffee here is amazing. The customer service is impeccable and they remember you each time you go. I always bring in people from out of town and local groups. They are fantastic two children and go above and beyond to help you find the donut that you want. If it's available the French toast donut is a must-try. If you get there at the end of the day they will give you a deal on Donuts which is great because you never get yesterday's Donuts.

UvNB3IildGytciMOaJnU_g.text: Adorable place, with fantastic donuts.  The creative donuts here are the reasons why I wanted to give this place a try.  It's like a new wave going on with donut chains popping up in cities.  I feel a little bad for the mom and pop shops, they're going to have to step up their game.  It's one thing to have cute and creative donuts but the most important part is that it has to taste good as well.    I wanted to try the pretzel shape donut, but I didn't see it when I got there, so the the worker told me about a french toast donut that was made fresh.  It took about several minutes to make, and it tasted just like what it was called a, "French Toast Donut".  It was literally a french toast donut.  I also ordered the bitrhday donut with oreo inside and a glazed buttermilk for my boyfriend. All the donuts we ordered exceeded or expectations.  I can't wait to come back next time, and hopefully get my hands on the pretzel donut.  *When you're there don't forget to check out their incredible aquarium created by the guys from TANKED.

Wt9pqCoygOS10i26LyVtxg.text: Donut Bar is a place you must experience. Not only are there numerous options of delicate, savory donuts-- but the staff and chef always make you feel special when you walk through the door. I would recommend the French toast donut. So soft, crunchy and delicious that it melts in your mouth. Served warm directly to you with syrup and butter. I call it the triple B: buttery, beautiful and breakfast donut! The times I've visited Chef Jeff welcomes me and recommends options-- he treats everyone the same and makes your visit special. Great place for healthy gains  and not so healthy gains -- but let's face it? Donut calories do not count because they are at Donut Bar. Great place for indulging and calming your sweet tooth.

AYlp0-5N8fdpzadg53oRgA.text: Come early or you will miss out. Also if just stopping by. They have pickup parking in the back for 15 minutes. Come around 10 and most definitely you will miss out on their awesome selection. What can u ask for. Great donuts and friendly staff. Always out goto place for donuts.

Gg4NYPLAIqHFh-jgcrYiMA.text: It's your average donut shop just w more fanfare than others. I didn't see the WOW factor honestly. I went there early morning so selection was good. I got 8 donuts for $22 felt like I overpaid for similar donuts I could of gotten at DD or other donuts shop. Won't be coming back.

5evu8Pxra6BsgAKxQ_G7dQ.text: Very very good. Had the strawberry cream puff looking donut. The strawberry pop tart. They will push the grilled cheese donut on you but I just ignore upsells and get to what I want. Good coffee, service and donuts.

qrI-BrlXz7mSboJobdTrxQ.text: Bookmarked The Donut Bar for our Vegas trip, best decision we could have made.  We arrived at 8:20 am and there was a short line. We bought so many types of donuts. They all sounded DELICIOUS!!!! We tried the Big Poppa Tart, the cinnamon roll bacon, blueberry Meyer lemon, banana Carmel, creme Brulee , chocolate euphoria, maple bacon and the pumpkin French toast donut.  Oh, and the Strawberry Split Donut too.  Now you are probably wondering if I ate them all, and the answer is yes, or at least a sampling of them. We brought the goods back to the hotel. We used Uber to get there from The Ventician, and it. The cost of Uber was around 12 dollars roundtrip.  Let's just say there was not one donut in the three boxes we got that wasn't super yummy!!! My favorite was the cinnamon roll and bacon. So much bacon on it and in it too. I found a couple of strips of bacon ribboned through the roll. Best part is that i checked in on Yelp and got a great cup of coffee to with my donuts.  Also, note the owner will be on Tanked on November 18th too. If you ever make it to Vegas checkout The Donut Bar you won't be sorry!!!

13Z-kCzIBkHvnvR05OBWQQ.text: I have visited the Donut Bar twice.  As a diabetic I only eat donuts occasionally. Each time I have gone in I have been greeted by a patient and professional staff member.  When I say patient, I am referring to the fact it is extremely difficult to decide what to get.   Since the last time I was there, they have made what seem to be "giant" donuts.  Believe me I wanted the giant blood red orange donut!  However, I picked the strawberry cheese cake and a creme brulee.  I really liked the strawberry cheesecake donut even though I thought it should be called a strawberry filled donut more than anything.  The creme brulee donut had outstanding filling!  It was a delicious decadence.  I wasn't into the top of the donut but I haven't had much exposure to creme brulee.    Just to mention, I have also had their vegan donuts and loved them as well.  I had the vegan donut when I had company in town and bought a dozen for everyone.  It was a bit of sticker shock when the dozen cost me $23 but when you eat the donuts you understand you are getting "every penny's worth."   Overall, I would have to say these donuts taste as if they were cooked with care and pride in craftsmanship. They are worth the drive when you have a donut craving that won't go away and demands gourmet taste.

nJHnEEf4BFHpgxKwE4X9fw.text: Terrible experience! My fiance and I are getting married in exactly 2 weeks and wanted to have Donut Bar cater a section with donuts in Las Vegas. She had emailed them in the beginning of the year and didn't get a response. I had to stop there when I was in Las Vegas to personally get information about what we wanted. They took my information and then I followed up with them to get the figures. After getting that squared away I was told to get them paid for about 2-3 weeks prior to the event. I emailed them to have someone call me to take payment, no response, then called today to give them my card and the person on the phone was authorized to do so and he person that was wasn't available for about 3 hours. I left my name and number for them to call me back and never did. By far the worst customer service I've seen in a while when a person is trying to "give" you money. I wouldn't recommend using Donut Bar to cater any event in fear of them not getting back to you when time is of the essence.

JgVwBlYgsjoTdOcMScqyRg.text: Before I go or I get out of court I am tempted to stop at the donut bar and choose some of their delicious donuts and a nitro iced coffee.  Great spin on traditional old fashions, fritters and bismarks with creative pastry creations which are mouth watering and delicious.  Lattes and other expresso drinks as well.  Usually parking is available and friendly service.  Not cheap but worth every penny.  Good after an all nighter.

aPefJTiMh0vioAUOLaSVWg.text: The doughnuts were delicious.  So many different choices.  Also they have great outdoor seating.

PlP28ccHDP1RU6-mE-gtUg.text: I mean where to start ok went in for the creme brulee donut order a dozen different donuts almost 30 bucks wtf waaaaaay over priced, but anyways my creme brulee donut was good flavor but half my order was soft didnt even have the crunchy top they are suppose to have, all other donuts tasted like Albertsons donuts not impressed , Pink Box hands down are running circles around this place if you are about flavor and not ooh i have a pop tart in my donut WTF it was gross by the way, and i drove all the way from summerlin early as hell because they close at 1 so i thought for sure it was fire NOPE, yall got me with all these bull crap reviews thanks for keeping it fake this place sucks.

9lJdhB_Bwz3sGOlNBXBz-w.text: Visited from out of town and a friend recommended this spot! We got the Mexican Hot Chocolate, Creme Brulee, Homer and Cake Batter doughnuts. All were good. Creme Brulee was liiiiittle dry, but still delicious. Will be back!!

6KkRM_Au70JQEIKimNUq9w.text: I could not believe the size of some of these Donuts as soon as we walked in. It is exactly what you were expecting if not more. We were only supposed to get one donut but ended up with 4 the birthday cake donut with super super sugary very delicious but not for the faint of heart. The creme brulee doughnut was unbelievably good the center was so creamy and not too sweet almost looks like a vanilla bean creme custards something. Death goodness! But let me tell you something... Their regular Donuts are so good and so fluffy I've never had a fluffier donut.....and on the weekends they have free donuts for kids and they also make French toast donuts made to order... What. Im about to walk my happy arse doen there now to get the french donuts!

nyk3LFnJ55_6H4z7AwbLeQ.text: My husband and I just got married in Vegas, and instead of a cake (my mom almost spent $800 on a cake that feeds 20-30!), we got a shit-ton of donuts from Donut Bar for $250! We worked with Chef Jeff who was super prompt in responding to our emails, and he gave us everything we wanted. Very professional and reliable.   We ordered 8 different types of donuts, including a few vegan ones and a dozen donuts with Vegas-y designs. Our flavors ranged from Lemon Pistachio to Nutella, so everyone was satisfied.  Overall, they were a huge hit, delicious, and a cheaper alternative!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z5UCWXseaHZ3LjA5d-xsew.text: Located in downtown Las Vegas near Fremont Street, this donut shop is cranking out the most mouth watering, unique donuts I have come across!  Walking into the shop you can smell the coffee and the donuts being freshly baked. The donuts are displayed behind a glass from almost top to bottom and all look amazing. There is a little sign that tells you all of the flavors - there are a lot! The service here is great and they answer all your questions for you and are also REALLY patient - since there are so many options it is definitely hard to choose just a few.   - Creme Brulee Donut - THIS IS A MUST GET! The crack of the hard sugar shell and the custard on the inside all inside a soft donut.. yes, please. ($2) This is a little bit smaller than some of the other selections, but you do not need much since it is very sweet and rich. - French Toast Donut - another favorite, light, airy, and the perfect balance between a donut & french toast. Also comes with syrup, butter, and jam ($5) - Birthday Oreo - A birthday cake donut with an oreo inside - this is the same size as the creme brulee donut - Caramel Latte Donut - This one is huge! The frosting is exactly like a caramel latte - Big Poppa Tart Donut - ALSO HUGE! Looks just like a huge pop tart and has strawberry filling on the inside.  - Burning S'more (or something to that name?) - looked fancy and tasted like a fancy s'more. If you like s'mores, you'll like this.   Serve Stumptown coffee here and make great Americanos. All our donuts and our coffee cost about $28 (this includes tax and tip) and we got two of each of the creme brulee and birthday donuts. The smaller donuts are less expensive and the bigger more expensive, but totally worth the splurge (might as well on donuts instead of losing it gambling, right?)  Can't wait to come back!

9oSo0vzHMQS-PCQobqmszg.text: I went to the soft opening and it surely pays not to have a salty attitude because we got great service and a free doughnut! Sweeeet! I've been waiting for this place to open for quite some time now. I've been stalking them on social media and you have to pay attention so you don't miss out - you snooze, you lose!  I got a few doughnuts: Caramelized Pineapple, Caramel Latte, Red Velvet, Big Poppa Tart, Samoa, Homer, Apple Fritter, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Nutella, Maple Bacon, Banana Caramel, and Cinnamon Sugar. They're most famous for Homer, Big Poppa Tart, Strawberry Split, and doughnut ice cream cones. I would have to try the Strawberry Split, Creme Brulee, and doughnut ice cream come at a later date as they weren't available/ran out.   But what I like the most from the ones I did get include Caramelized Pineapple, Mexican Hot Chocolate (sweet, cinnamony...then a spicy note. Yum!), Banana Caramel...Nutella was ok.  They have Stumptown coffee, puppy treats, and milk. My pup, Ralf absolutely loved the puppy cookies I got him.   Welcome to Vegas!

6wMHMajlgxQpWs-2NEyw7g.text: This place is a donut lovers paradise. The donuts here are delicious and super fluffy. There were so many great looking donuts that it took me forever to pick out the ones I wanted. The size of some of the donut choices are huge and could feed a small family. I ate my first round of donuts there at the shop and of course had to go for round two but got those to go. The service there is fantastic and the employees there are all very friendly. They treated the tourist folks with the same amount of respect as they did to the local regulars that came in. Will definetly be returning when I'm back in Vegas.

AhsGnPupDnUYsdGmVbcw2g.text: There's a wide variety of donuts - a lot of unique flavors ! I got the s'mores and birthday cake donut - the s'mores was really good and super filling ! The service was fast and everyone working there was efficient. There's ice cold water in the back that really helps with the Vegas heat. Some of the donuts are expensive though so be prepared to spend money because it adds up quick.

FpVOi_k0j-yAxEuz3I-GSA.text: Overall, a decent donut shop with a friendly staff.  Below is a breakdown of all the donuts I tried...  Strawberry Split: vegan! The fresh strawberries are a great contrast to the cream & fried donut. I wish the cream wasn't made from soy but I guess you can't be worried about GMOs at a donut shop lol  Blueberry with Meyer lemon icing: reminds me of a blueberry muffin topped with lemon frosting. Not as good as the blueberry donuts from M&M Donuts in Orange County but still good.   Red velvet: I would have personally liked it a little softer, but overall, I can't complain. Not bad, but not anything that I'd rave about.   Salted caramel: just really HUGE, but average tasting  Oreo birthday cake:  For your sweet tooth, this donut tastes just like the name. More like dessert than a breakfast food, but I guess that's True of most of these donuts. Props on creativity!  Creme brulee: delicious & vegan! I just wish the hard caramel on top was a little thinner because it can overpower the yummy donut with creme filling a bit.   Strawberry big poppa tart: A pop tart inside a donut made to look like a huge pop tart. Probably the most unique donut here. I'm not a huge fan of pop tarts but this pop tart hits the spot!  If you want to be able to choose from all of their options, I suggest coming before 10am. I came at 10:30am & they had already run out of a couple things. If you come when they are almost done, like 12:30pm, you'll only have maple bars & salted caramel donuts to choose from; however, you can buy a box full of these donuts for $10 at that time.

D1OGaKoKeNcDcwcfbE7O7A.text: We visited the Donut Bar on a Monday in late April. It wasn't busy. Great selection of donuts. The coffee was pretty awesome. We loved all the donuts, my favorite was the Strawberry Shortcake. Going into this visit I was expecting overwhelming sweetness. It was not the case. All donuts were well balanced!

z-eNBItlPpBwhI3ek2VDGA.text: Flew in from the midwest, landed at 745am and made sure this was my first stop! To top it off -- greeted by awesome friendly staff who walked us through the selection of donuts displayed!! Donuts were delicious, fluffy and perfectly flavored -- definitely worth your morning stop!!

82QySSTOPh8-P1Y3GxGQNQ.text: Great donuts and great service- a definite win in my book!  I read an article that this spot would be opening in the same location as a former donut shop. On Sunday I was finally downtown doing one of my make my own food crawls and knew I needed to stop in.  We were warmly greeted right away by the employees and the delicious looking donuts. :) Since we were doing a food crawl we narrowed to two donuts, but we were offered some free donuts and who can pass on free donuts? I'm glad that I was able to try several flavors and get a good idea of what they offer.   The apple donut was my favorite. It had a nice spice cake flavor with small chunks of apple in the cake and a nice glaze on top. The chai donut was unique and also hit the spot. The birthday cake donut had Oreo in the center and was tasty as well. The vanilla was my friend's favorite and while simple, I loved this one as well. The chocolate fritter was less moist than the other donuts and had a nice flavor, but wasn't my favorite of the bunch. Overall, nice texture and awesome flavor for the donuts.  We also enjoyed some of the delicious Stumptown coffee. Stumptown is always delicious and quality coffee is always good with a donut. I also tried the Nitro brew which was bold and perfect with the sweet donuts.  The employees were very friendly and generous in making sure we were able to try as much as possible during our visit. I love visiting a local business where I can feel the pride in the business. It's cool to have another business join what is becoming a pretty cool downtown Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

brNWEZQ39avOtdIarq-Cxg.text: Great selection of donuts, if you can think it they got it. You have get there early tho, some donuts tend to run out in the first hour or so! Yeah there are that good!!

rSLmqB-ToyfZ5Ug-U5ghNg.text: So this is what you call sweet and savory heaven. I am visiting a friend in town and he introduced me to the "next level" of donuts and a trip to the gym following it. I was extremely pleased by the array of options and flavors. The donuts are huge. Well worth the extra run afterwards. And this bar had the nerve to have a grilled cheese donut! I went two times. It would have been three times in 4 days, but I drove by around noon one day and they were already sold out! What a bummer. But I learned quickly, if I'm craving a donut, I need to get to Donut Bar ASAP!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hAkF7lMcR-QqOsqhVXYKjQ.text: Even though Donut Bar is brand new to the Las Vegas area, I've been twice already Haha. They are killing it! I've heard people say it is the old location of O-face donuts? Not positive about this because I never went to O-face. Anyways the original location of Donut Bar is from San Diego, really glad they brought  it to downtown Las Vegas.    I have to say I was pretty impressed, they had Stumptown coffee! I am a bit of a coffee snob and Stumptown coffee has got to be my favorite. They serve Stumptown at the famous Voodoo Doughnuts in Seattle/Portland area to give you a better idea of how serious this coffee is. The outdoor patio seating behind Donut bar is also on point! Very spacious and surrounded by artwork. However, the customer service was a bit lacking to me. I felt pretty rushed to order by the girl behind the counter. She almost seemed annoyed that we didn't automatically know what we wanted to order.   Pros: vegan options, outdoor patio seating, Stumptown coffee, cool bathroom decor, amazing coffee selection (nitro cold brew coffee on tap), location   Cons: Small space (wouldn't like dining inside), really loud music for early morning, close at 1 pm or until all sold out, have to pay for parking (only a $1 but still), customer service   Vegan donuts you must try: Banana Caramel, Strawberry split, Creme Brule    Tip** for every dozen donuts you buy, you get 1 free.    All in all, pretty cool addition to the downtown Las Vegas area. Definitely recommend people to go check out this mouth watering new donut shop!

nJOYlYQFb2HTDuJUbHVNLA.text: Now I'm a pink box fanatic but will splurge downtown and stop by this place. Location isn't very convenient unless you're walking around, the parking lot across the street is often full. They have a variety of vegan doughnuts which is awesome and I'm not sure if they have any gluten free options. The strawberry shortcake one is AMAZING. Definitely too large to eat yourself, most of their doughnuts are completely shareable and always fresh. I'm not surprised they sell out on a regular.

BNef1ufpNrZbBFhXvFIj2g.text: 3.5 Love all the flavor choices and cool decorations. My favorite had to be the lemon pistachio, was a little disappointed with the creme brulee and that was the one I was so looking forward to try. Staff was very nice and helpful. Clean bakery with the racks of fresh donuts. Used Yelp deal for a free large coffee with purchase of a dozen.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée

ejDg0_SCfiGNuej5-SRn6A.text: MIND BLOWN!  I am so impressed with how delicious, fluffy, and chewy their donut are. I bought the cake batter, blueberry cheesecake, Nutella, samoa, Homer's donut, and the red velvet donuts.   I came in around 11 AM during their soft opening and there were quite a few good choices left. Unfortunately the strawberry split & Oreo one was sold out  but that's okay because what I got was tasty!   Donut Bar compared to other donut shops around town is their HUGE donuts ($4 each), and unique ones like the Oreo inside the donut, the pop tart inside the donut, and hopefully the donut cones soon (well that's what they advertised on their Instagram). The dough is exceptionally chewy, moist, the toppings are even & proportionate, and most importantly the frosting isn't overly sweet.   I definitely recommend this place, just come early so you have more options!

5yEY-1l243k7Hej818KgeA.text: I love the size of these donuts!  For donut fanatics like me, it is a glimpse of nirvana to see a giant fresh donut with delectable toppings.  And the variety!  So much to choose from, I get paralyzed when I want it all.  I can't decide!  And kudos to them for not serving all cake donuts, which is what many bakeries do so that they can stack multiple toppings and glazes on top without them losing their shape.  Nope, Donut Bar serves nicely soft, huge yeast donuts, which is comparatively rare.  And yummier :-)  I chose the Brad Fritter with bacon and caramel, a blueberry cheesecake filled, and a lemon pistachio "glazed" yeast donut (small tire sized).  Took me 2 days to finish them, such is my gluttony.   They serve a nice assortment of caffeinated drinks to wash them down.  Not a whole lot of sit down space, but that's the only shortcoming really.  Worth the walk.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With double-shot cappuccino

7ShyMewVfG0-voG4Y1C-6g.text: The music is WAY TO LOUD!  You have to scream what you want! The donuts are tasteless.  How can that be? My grandson would not eat them and hes 7!!!t  they are the worst tasting donuts I have ever eaten,  they have no flavor.  And the cost is ridiculous for a tasteless donut!

ZDgajzxteFt5f1gLnAraLA.text: PROS:  -convenient downtown location -fast friendly service  -strawberry split donut is amazing   CONS: -vegan donuts are more expensive than the non-vegan ones -loud music (like nightclub loud) which makes it hard to communicate orders or chat with friends -creme brulee donut is blah, & the strawberry split donut is pretty heavy which leaves one other vegan option. I wish they had better vegan selection (ie: simple options like glazed, eclair, sprinkle, etc)  If they had better vegan options I would frequent this location weekly, for sure. I've only seen the vegan sprinkled donut on 2 occasions. So far the strawberry split & sprinkled is my fav

FCdPyTr5Cc5kFxdMClBKxA.text: Donuts. On. Steroids. I mean massive!  Walked in on Tuesday morning around 11:50 with a friend with the understanding that all the good donuts would be picked over. Wasn't wrong about that one, except that they had what both of us came in for. I was shocked to here that they did sell out 70% or something like that of the flavors... I saw plenty to choose from. The employee helping us was warm and was happy to help us with our selections.   I chose the birthday cake donut with sprinkles because, duh. But also because it was of normal donut size. My second choice would have been the homer but I had errands to run and didn't want to leave the donut in my car in warm weather. My friend chose a chocolate donut. The big kind and he got through half. I ordered a glass of milk while he ordered a coffee. In regards to my donut, I wasn't blown away. It isn't the best I've had because I've had really great, moist donuts that taste extremely fresh, but there's no reason I wouldn't return to Donut Bar for more donuts. It's the first donut shop I've tried since I've been out here so my next couple visits will be in comparison to Donut Bar. I do appreciate the uniqueness they bring to something so classic, I was told they had donuts with a pop tart inside. I got cavities just thinking about it, but innovative concept to say the least. Attractive frosting and designs but traditional as far as donuts are concerned.   It was a fabulous day out, a cool off after a hot couple of days. We were happy to find we could sit outside where there is a communal patio of the neighboring shops. It's clean and inviting, likely bustling in the warmer weather. I appreciated the art work on the buildings as well.   I had intended to eat my donut and go back in to order a couple for others. To our surprise in 20 minutes 90% of their stock we walked into had vanished. No they had not put them away, they sold them! I was told they sell out daily! I think there's benefits to showing up fashionably late around the time they close (1p) - you get a bargain! Selection is sparse though at that point - you've been warned.   Shout out to the bathroom - Homer Simpson, Family Guy art, loved it! Also loved the merch though I didn't purchase. Street parking is readily available around the block and you are in super close proximity to Fremont Experience for you tourists.   I'll be heading back to try new flavors!

XcSFwo3OpFh04xtNXaGybg.text: This place is amazing! My little family and I were visiting Las Vegas and Yelp this donut shop.  Based on the great reviews I told my husband that we got to try this place.  When we arrived we were greeted by all their friendly staff.  The ladies also asked if my children wanted to take a complimentary cookie monster donut.  They gave us one for each of my kids. I thought that was very sweet of them. They even went the extra mile to give my kids each a balloon. We ordered a french toast donut, nutella filled donut, the birthday oreo donut, and maple bacon donut. Let me tell you these donuts were so delicious. I honestly could not stop smiling they were so good! I would have given them a 5 star just based on their friendliness, caring, welcoming service. This donut shop is by far my favorite just by one visit. Thank you!!

AlNlYFw_UKLue2KbdMAFWA.text: Was here a month back in the morning, and had breakfast before heading to LA.  Had a creme brulee and it was so good that I ordered two more right after the first bite. The donuts were fresh and soft.  Coffee was good.  Friendly staffs. There's a backyard patio with a few tables.

ZfddXPXtqd9Sb89wROsPTA.text: Stopped by on my trip to Vegas this past weekend. I went towards the end of the day so I'm not sure if all the options were there.   I purchased 3 items, 1 that they are known for and random 2 flavors.  Was not that great and didn't finish any of them.   Thankfully I didn't have to wait in line.

XcGITj4aRIxU2oaRpMYkwg.text: I wanted so much to love this place! But for the price and taste, 3 stars is as high as I can go.  Pros: fantastic service - staff were friendly and   knowledgeable Cute shop - set up/ decor Ginormous donuts and vegan choices Free Jiggly puff donut for my son Vegan apple fritter was yummy  Cons: Aside from the apple fritter the donuts were just ok. For the elaborate toppings the actual donuts were alright, nothing special. Price varies per donut...I paid $18 for 6 donuts ( vegan: 2 creme brulee, 1 strawberry split, 1 apple fritter, 1 cake batter, 1 chocolate euphoria, and a free Jigglypuff donut) Music was a bit loud and it made it hard to hear donut descriptions and specials from the staff  Had this place bookmarked for a while and decided to try it out.  Apple fritter was good...probably only donut I would go back for.

AeE3wjKLXMBhPiWSkolwBQ.text: Had a work trip to Vegas, but had to figure out my own accommodations off-strip for one night. I mostly buckled down and did work, but after getting up early the next morning, I checked out Yelp to find out this place was right down the street. My cold brew was stellar but my whipped cream strawberry donut extravaganza was the real star. Started to walk out the door. Went back for some cream brulee bites. Was not disappointed.   I was in and out in a minute and had a delicious breakfast, so I had no complaints!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold brew, strawberry shortcake, creme brulee

5eo4esG_PMp3__iTNUJ6oA.text: Warning: you will be overwhelmed by the choices, eat more donuts than you planned, and end up with a oh-so-worth-it bellyache. I can't wait to come back here. I've already started making a list of friends and family that are coming to town so that I can bring them here too (and hopefully have a little more control and spread out the donuts that I want to try).   This place is super clean, cute, and we saw both of the owners in on a Saturday morning making the french toast donuts and handing out drinks at the counter. That is one of the greatest things to me to see because it shows me that they're really here and really passionate about their business and I am so excited to go back and support them again and again.   Parking is very available near here, with both street parking and a pay-to-park lot directly across the street. When you enter, you are immediately greeted by so many donut options that you will feel a little overwhelmed (so many choices) but don't worry, your donut guide will be with you shortly and will help you pick a great one.   I chose the big poppa tart, a donut the size of 2 long johns, filled with a pop tart and jam, and topped with pop tart crumbles and frosting. It was awesome. The donut was super puffy and flakey and even before getting to the pop tart middle, tasted exactly like a pop tart. Next time I really want to try the strawberry split or the french toast donut (which is made to order and served warm).   I honestly can't wait to go back. This is a great little local place that is fun for both locals and tourists alike. Just make sure you get up early; when they sell out for the day, they close!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We saw both of these guys behind the counter while we were there!
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of the big poppa tart. That pink line is the pop tart middle. Delicious!
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes there are fish in there!

untYSQ6ayFiT7nx7ryUS4w.text: For my boyfriends birthday, I decided to buy him one of every flavor donut from Donut Bar that they had for that day (since they rotate some flavors each day). They were so good!   Each donut had a nice bite to it & the texture of the donuts ranged from light & fluffy to dense & thick. Some of our favorites were definitely the creme brulee (it has a crunchy top!), strawberry cream cheese, old fashion, & maple bacon.   They have many specialty donuts that's it's hard to keep track of them! S'mores, Mexican hot chocolate, red velvet, blueberry lemon.. even some filled with pop tarts in them! It was so crazy to see! Also some of their donuts are HUGE. There was no way we could finish all 26 donuts in a decent amount of time before they got stale haha.   The place was also easy to find. Located by Fremont street. There is an arrow neon sign that you can't miss. Downside is you have to pay for parking, but if you're there early enough you can park for free. Will definitely be back for the donuts we didn't get to try yet. Especially their French toast donuts that they only serve in Sunday's!

YujD2kDmcfdWlh2Y25Yi0Q.text: Donut Bar... home of the biggest donuts I've ever seen. They are pretty darned tasty too. I have visited here a few times.  The service is always friendly and there is always many choices.    My favorite is the chocolate euphoria.  Chocolate curls, delicious frosting, and light, fluffy donut.  Today's visit I got a mud pie, lemon pistachio, and cake batter.  The lemon pistachio was refreshing.  The glaze was light and just tart enough.  It had a sprinkling of pistachios.  Perfect balance.  The mud pie was chocolaty deliciousness.  I didn't try the cake batter but it did look yummy.  I recommend Donut Bar for a sweet treat.  Bring your friends though because the size definitely makes them shareable!

tsrddx0K1UKPWtLqJAOG0Q.text: Love this place. Super cute. Friendly staff. The lady took the time to explain all their flavors, what they recommend, etc.   Small seating area inside but there's a back courtyard that has more seating.  Donuts were good. Fresh and soft. My fav was the Nutella donut and salted caramel.  I was disappointed that they didn't have some of their other flavors available like the caramel latte but apparently they rotate the flavors.  I'll definitely be back. This place was great.

HfkBbbhMvYidrn536wBRxQ.text: We finally made it to DB before they sold out and closed!   I've been able to taste their delicious donuts at a Yelp Elite event, but never got to be in their store!  We made it in for "happy hour", meaning we were about to get the last of the day's donuts. We ended up with creme brulee, cheesecake, apple fritter, blueberry Meyer lemon, strawberry shortcake, and chai. Creme brulee was my favorite! The crackle of sugar on the top and filling was just like a creme brulee dessert!   I probably would've given DB a 5 had I had a fresh batch of donuts, and since we live so far south I'm sad we haven't been able to do that yet!

QY2J6kns1fzXSYieCQaikg.text: This place is the best in Vegas  Love the donuts and the service is just awesome Always bring a box of donuts home when I visit Vegas  They sold out quick and during weekends they have the best French toast made out of donut yes it is the best

yvAmBSYd-VcFm84RKp4BvA.text: Super cute, super friendly staff. Unique looking and large in size donuts, do you get your monies worth. However, some were lacking in flavor. For example, the Nutella was basically just like a chocolate glazed. It was good though. We also felt rushed and pushed down the line. I felt like i didn't even get to look at all the choices because of that. If you want to sit and eat there, they do have seating outside. I loved the outside sitting area. Very cute and peaceful.

UhzuNqOaneaZWiZi9aGrzQ.text: Came here because I really wanted to try their  donuts. It's in downtown and parking wasn't that convenient but thanks for the meters I got in and out. It's a cute donut shop. It's small inside and you go in and get in line to order. I got 2 creme brulee donuts and I also got the Nutella donut. The Nutella donut was $4 and the creme brulee was $2. Definitely reasonable prices. I would have to say I love love love the creme brulee donut. It's my favorite and I loved the Nutella one too but creme brulee definitely has my heart. I will definitely come back here for sure.

hVmOWDE6mQdi0xgOva1YVQ.text: I like donuts and am always willing to try out different donut shops/bars, especially ones out of state. Las Vegas' Donut Bar is located in downtown, which is a bit out of the way if you stayed along The Strip. We ended up getting a Lyft there one morning for a quick bite to eat.  If you follow them on Instagram, they post their menu daily. I was really looking forward to getting the strawberry split donut, however when we arrived - they were all out. Go early so you won't be disappointed like me. We ended up getting:  Ohh My Birthday Cake Oreo ($2) Creme Brulee ($2) Caramel Latte ($3) Maple Bourbon ($3)  Caramel Latte tasted a lot like coffee and we had a hard time finishing it. Same with the Maple Bourbon. Amongst the 3 of us, we demolished the smaller ones (Creme Brulee & Birthday Cake) but had to take the other two larger donuts (Caramel Latte & Maple Bourbon) back to the hotel. Their donuts are HUGE. It's kind of hard to try all the donuts unless you're with a group. I didn't really care for the Birthday Cake one. It tasted like a funfetti cake that had an oreo inside. At least it was small so we were able to finish. By the time I tried Maple Bourbon, I was already too full and on a sugar high. That was enough donuts for me.  My favorites were the Creme Brulee and Caramel Latte, mainly because I love those flavors in general. Mmmmm the Creme Brulee was delicious with its crisp outer caramelized crust and custard filling on the inside. If I had known any better, I would have ordered a dozen of these and called it a day. Next time I'm in Vegas I already know what to get & hopefully they will have my strawberry split then....

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clockwise: Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo ($2), Creme Brulee ($2), Maple Bourbon ($3), Caramel Latte ($3)
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh My Birthday Cake Oreo ($2)
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

6fSrfl2yknyhF2VP246T2w.text: Heard good things about this place so made a special trip there and it did not disappoint! Had an apple fritter and a nutella donut both were excellent and made from high quality ingredients.  Worth the trip and really like the patio section in back of the building to enjoy your breakfast.

rFUohW0EJ1HSS7Dvsh9piw.text: This place had an assortment of different kinds of cool donuts. The interesting thing is that their hours say an opening time, but instead of a closing time it says they close whenever they sell out of product for the day. That ensures they are fresh everyday and don't sell day old donuts. It's a small shop, and can get pretty hectic when it's breakfast or lunch time, so prepare to wait in line. Donuts were very moist and full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o1ipmrKbrUeKaQUhJyJuCA.text: Meh! not impressed about average donut place I got almost every donut they had and none of them blew me away except the price of them! Nice staff Quik service but sad to say I won't be back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nNDjkWkQFiBqHYWqWxRAtg.text: Why O Why O WHY do I love this place so much???  Every donut I have ever had was delicious!  It is like their basic donut recipe is so good that whatever they do after that is just an enhancement on perfection!  My absolute favorite is the oreo stuffed donut-my mouth is watering remembering the last time I had one.  The Poppa Tart is so unique and delicious and I am thinking it is made to be shared but....ya know...sometimes it just has to be hidden from your family and eaten bit by bit all day long :-)    My first experience with the donut bar was their happy hour; they were close to closing time and did a happy hour where an entire box of donuts was $10.  We had no idea the joy we were about to experience.  Since that day I often drive by the donut bar hoping to catch another happy hour but it seems like they are often sold out by the time I come by.  Next week I plan to make a special trip for the weekend French toast donut, you can bet I will go early for that one!  Overall the donut bar is outstanding with a friendly and comfortable ambiance.  I highly recommend this place.

TIoSsDuoTze3ygSHt-NBNQ.text: I came here this past Wednesday and I pre-ordered a whole dozen.  I was afraid it would sell out, so I got there at 7 am on the dot.  I got a whole bunch of nutella donuts, a few creme brulee, an apple fritter, and a couple of birthday cake donuts.  Let me put it this way, the ones that I liked were definitely the smaller ones to an extent.  The nutella donuts(large) were borderline tasteless.  Too much bread, fairly dry.  The creme brulee was definitely tasteless.  The cookies and creme b-day cake was fine.  The best one, and the most expensive of the bunch I bought, was the nutella(small).  That had some flavor and was just right.  Not too much bread and just the right amount of nutella.  I paid $36 in total for a dozen and I now realize that getting there early is more than enough to get what I wanted.  I probably won't come here again, but it is a decent novelty donut shop.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of two boxes.

nMC7BQgVTLPOHaJmAO8WuQ.text: Holy hell this place has changed my breakfast game forever! Located on 6th & Carson (near some other tasty places), you can't miss the place with a large "Donut" sign outside. I came here with my mom and little brother to come enjoy something different for breakfast. Immediately we were greeted by a friendly gal that told us about the best donuts and recommended her favorites. I can't remember the names but we had a strawberry whipped cream, Nutella filled, and red velvet. My favorite was definitely the strawberry donut. The whipped cream is soy-based and the donut was so light. Definitely looks lighter than it is! The outside is super cute with lots of seating and artwork. I can't wait to come back and try some other delicious treats.

Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

viqBEpBejdLJtDeqjQaouw.text: Delicious! Need I say more? Ordered the strawberry split, cake batter, and Nutella filled donuts... Yummy! The dough was light and fluffy!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7YSiJqqyOpSe1Gtr96fsDg.text: Great choices! Great atmosphere and easy ordering system. Our choices weren't overly sweet which was good because the doughnuts were huge! Vanilla latte was made perfectly with timed espresso. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FJwpyEMoKU4ZmTXBl3DE4g.text: Overall: great variety, fluffy donuts, great atmosphere  This place is right by the smoothie place we went to for breakfast, so we decided to stop here for a treat after. They have a great variety of donuts and unique flavors like creme brulee. We got the blueberry lemon cake donut and the creme brulee donut. The creme brulee donut had a bruleed sugar top and a vanilla pastry cream filling. It was amazing! The donut was a perfect fluffy texture, and the filing was very creamy, and the bruleed sugar had a nice crunch. The blueberry lemon donut was great as well. I find that sometimes cake donuts can be dense, but this one was perfectly fluffy and had the perfect amount of icing on the top, so it was not overly sweet and sugary. To top it off, their bathroom has the cutest murals of Homer Simpson and his pink sprinkle donut!

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fYNRb1Y2rhg4xwHQutlnIw.text: Every time I am in Vegas I try and eat at this place however they are always sold out and closed. So I was excited when i saw they were open. I went on a Saturday around 10 am. I ordered 3 donuts. The creme brulee donut, Oreo birthday donut, and cheesecake donut with a strawberry like filling . Each were good not great. The sugar crust on the creme brulee donut was executed nicely. The filling on the creme brulee donut was subtly sweet it felt more of like an eclair texture than a donut. Somehow it seemed like the donuts were not fresh? Which is weird because they always sell out and they had to be made that day. I also ordered a cold brew coffee which was okay. They have other specialty donuts like the huge pop tart donut. And peanut butter jelly donuts . Overall this place is okay. Seems more like a hyped fad- like place. There are many dessert like places in Las Vegas this doesn't stand out from the rest.

6bwF5DvGHFJGwCuuAFcQQA.text: Thus far every time we've gone to Donut Bar, we've pre ordered the night before in order to get the donuts we want. I love the Creme Brule donut! My husband is a fan of the Butter Beer Donut and anything Chocolate. We tried a couple new ones this time and they weren't that great...i.e. The Apple Fritter (not Apple-y enough), Pumpkin with filling. I thought the Strawberry Split was fabulous though and would certainly get it again. We do the free coffee with Yelp check in each time and we've never liked the coffee. Whether you are a fan of fluffy donuts or cake donuts I'm sure you'll find something to make you go mmmm!

9NwIGYQu6ZJUmAiFOCINpA.text: The Best Doughnuts EVEERRR!!!! My Son And I Went Downtown To The Donut Bar And Just Indulged, Man WhenI Tell You They Were Good, For Real, For Real They Are Bomb It Is A Must Have. Krispy Kreme's Are Good. But, The Donut Bar Is Where It Is!!!! So I Give Them  Once They Open At 8:00am You Can Get Them Until They're Sold Out And It Just May Be 12 Or 1:00pm Lol

wL08ywCNYnHoU5hT15-u1g.text: We stop here at least once every trip.   We love this place.   Get there early for the best selection. The donuts are delicious, so is the milk and they have nitro cold brew  The decorations are adorable and the staff was super friendly!!

oXbf3UYq0RFrYviStu-Z0A.text: I use to live down the street from Donut Bar. Their donuts were great! Full of flavor, fresh, fluffy, and versatile. As long as you like donuts, you can for sure find something here to your liking.  Their iced chai was also very good. JsvpdZN-iy7zb0Ho35aykQ.text: Wow! Fantastic! I got the strawberry shortcake donut and Jim got the vanilla bean donut. Then we shared a creme brulee donut. By far the creme brulee was the best one! The cream center is made in house and the crunchy sugar top makes this donut turkey something special! The vanilla bean was good so was the strawberry shortcake. They are huge but nothing to special. Atmosphere is great and the staff are wonderful!

gh5TbMEub2BgKZQiBb8D6A.text: You've got to get here early otherwise they sell out, and that's all she wrote. OK so are they, as they boast, the best donuts in the world? No, but they are very good. So if you find yourself downtown early in the morning get in line before hey run out. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

8qLwfWPiK4Mm0kz8SvW2JQ.text: As a donut lover, I researched the best donut places in Las Vegas before flying in for my first trip. According to reviews and social media this seemed to be the place to go.  My friends and I woke up early on a Sunday morning and took an Uber to the bakery. When we got there it wasn't crowded at all and we spent time looking over the menu trying to decide what we wanted. Thanks to the pictures I saw on Instagram, the French Toast donut and Strawberry Split donut seemed to be must haves. Along with those I got a vanilla bean glazed, a Nutella filled and a cheesecake filled donut. Go hard or go home right?  The strawberry split was my favorite hands down and I'd go back for that alone. The French toast was made to order and served hot with syrup, jam and butter. Easily a second favorite. The other 3 were okay and kinda let me down. The nutella and cheesecake filled were both good but did NOT have enough filling...I felt like I bit through 3/4 of the doughnut before I tasted filling. The vanilla bean glaze was also okay. However, there are so many delicious looking donuts available that I'd definitely go back to try something new along with my favorites.  Props to Donut Bar for having a back patio where you can sit and enjoy all your donuts. The morning we went there was plenty of seating available. If you love donuts like me, definitely make this a stop on your next trip to Vegas.

Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Split

Lemon Blueberry, the flavour was there but still not that great.   I will be open-minded, maybe better when you get it fresh. Would want to go back to try French Toast Donut.

Not the "best doughnuts in the world" like their box claims. I've had far better, fresher and softer dough at Donut Mania or Glaze. Just ok!

By1DN0k7pWqI0Az7LR6Cww.text: Having jury duty earlier this month allowed me to drop by Donut Bar for two days straight.  First visit-11:30am...choosing from what was left, I tried a Strawberry Cheesecake and a Boston Creme. Both tasted okay, but the chocolate glaze on the boston creme wasn't only excessively sweet but looked dull, not shiny like other donut shops, and the dough part itself was a little more dense for my liking.  Gave Donut Bar the benefit of the doubt and decided to catch them earlier the next day.  Second visit-7:30am...arriving with a full display, I perused the list and ordered three types of cake donuts: Matcha, Blueberry Meyer Lemon, and The Samoa. I also ordered a Creme Brulee Donut and their special donut of the day, Strawberries and Cream. Best of the batch was the Creme Brulee Donut and the Strawberries and Cream not far behind. The yeast raised donut items here aren't as light and fluffy, but more dense and are alot darker than other shops around town. The cake donuts sound better than they actually tasted and I just took one bite of each and couldn't get passed how DRY each of them were. Couldn't taste matcha or meyer lemon, but sugary sweet(and I got there half an hour after they opened)  Service was okay,  and price point is kinda iffy with the fact that there are other shops in town that charge less for a better tasting product that won't leave you with buyers remorse. Like that song goes, "I'm a classic man"...I like classic style donuts that light and fluffy,  and  aren't hidden by thick glazes and don't need  the addition of an oreo or pop tart. To me, less is more, and maybe third time's the charm, but for now,  I'm in no hurry to rush back.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu. 2.5

TGiiGcmwYP4EAT9WbroCdg.text: I have been to the Donut Bar a few times and like to bring friends/family when they visit. They have a fun collection of donuts and good coffee. The staff is friendly when ordering donuts. We also enjoy the back area for sitting and talking. My last visit ended with an unpleasant encounter and now I am not sure how I feel about visiting again. Everything was good until we were about to leave. My sister and I had our kids with us and we decided to go out in the back to eat donuts. When we went out we noticed they had gotten some corn hole boards and some other customers were enjoying them. My sister's kids played with them for a little at one point but for the most part stayed by us. As we were leaving our group was approached by an employee who asked our kids in an accusing manner what happened to the corn hole board. When we explained that others were playing with them and the kids said they didn't do it he continued to accuse them of damaging them and then proceeded to lay a guilt trip on the kids. First, if you think someone's kids did something you should approach the parents and speak with them so we can handle it. Second, if you don't have proof or a witness accusing someone is wrong. He never said he had proof or a witness...if he had we would have handled it appropriately and the kids would have been held responsible. Like I said at the start normal our visits are great and we love introducing people to the donut bar and love their treats...now I am a little put off by this last visit due to this employee.

UxIOgvSPXuGe9Bi5RQBySA.text: I want to start off by saying I've never actually gone inside the establishment, but I follow them on Instagram and all the fitness models post epic cheat meals with these donuts. So~ when my friend went to Vegas, I made him bring home a dozen for me. Little did I know, a dozen would actually be 2 big boxes! It was totally worth making him lug it around though. Because these donuts were so bomb! We do not have anything like these in Philly. I mean a donut with a poptart in it?!   Anyways, after cutting a piece of each flavor to taste them, I ended up freezing them because I couldn't possibly eat them all in one sitting, well I could, but I decided I shouldn't. Well let me tell you, have any of you guys tried frozen donuts before? It was probably even better than when I tried it fresh! How could that be possible?! Well some of the donuts were too sweet when I had it fresh (the poptart one especially) and when it was frozen it was the perfect amount of sweetness.   I still dream of eating these donuts. I need to make a trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A dozen donuts lugged around across the country for me

6doej_R5FZlDdxRwLtCG6Q.text: Yes! They have vegan options! Super happy and satisfied; it's hard find vegan sweet spots in Las Vegas but this one was totally worth the drive and (calories) for!

s4f3LlANea5eTzzNaiDt6A.text: Donuts as big as your face! I see this place every year on my way to Life is Beautiful and I finally made time to stop in. It's heavenly.  It's located about a block away from Freemont East on Carson and 6th Street and, without the flying pink donut on the wall outside, I might have missed it. Before walking in, you'll notice the posted hours for each day - they close when they sell out - so it's probably better arrive earlier than later.  We ordered four cinnamon rolls, two strawberry cheesecake donuts, a slated carmel and a Homer. I almost went into a diabetic coma because I couldn't stop and they were gone too soon. Each one was distinctive in taste but not overly sweet or dry. My favorite were the cinnamon rolls, they were gooey in the center and melted in my mouth, I highly reccommend them!

3MW00wWmzqYZvJ6sdUshMw.text: I ran my first 5K this morning!  Just kidding...I'm on my third donut.    Went on Sunday 5-1-16 at 11:30AM to grab some donuts.  I ordered four donuts.  Don't judge me.  For $16 we got four donuts and two drip coffees.    $4.00 "big poppa tart" is a ginormous donut which looks like a poptart on the top.  You need a fork and knife for this!  It's kinda greasy but fluffy and filled with a generic cheap-tasting  jam.    $3.00 "DB's nutella donut" is a standard donut with chocolate on top and what I think was crushed nuts.  It was fluffy, huge, and nicely yeasty.  It didn't taste much like Nutella to me.   $4.00 "strawberry split" is a huge donut dusted in sugar, split down the middle, and filled with cream and fresh strawberries.  The donut itself was kinda boring but the strawberries were ripe and juicy.  The cream they use is the super-white kind that never melts....kinda like the type they use on the desserts at Golden Corral.  It doesn't taste good and I'm sure it's not good for you.  I'd pass on this one next time, even though it's very pretty.    $3.00 "Pb & J" is a vegan jelly-filled donut with peanut butter glaze on top.  My husband really liked this one.    They gave my son a free donut...it was a round one with a red face on it...maybe it's a character from a cartoon or something?  I'm not sure cuz' my son is two and hasn't started watching TV yet.  It was a very nice gesture on their part!  We both got drip coffees which were actually good but they only had regular sugar, sugar in the raw, and stevia.  Gimme some splenda or nutrasweet, ya hippies!!!  Let me kill myself slowly with artificial sweeteners.    Usually donuts give me heartburn but I felt fine all day after gorging myself on these donuts.  I'll be back to try the creme brulee donut!  This place will definitely do well because they are catering to the hipster vegans and they have unique donuts.   I had a lot of leftovers since the donuts are so big but they ended up in the trash...which means they weren't very good because I will gladly eat a krispy kreme donut that is 4 days old that i found on the ground somewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $14 for the four donuts I chose, the red one was free for the kiddo. 5-1-16

Jcjh2mo4Ok9xISX4BmflRA.text: Thanks to Danny N. of West Covina, CA for giving me the 411 on this Hot and New business in Downtown Las Vegas!  We don't have these fancy 6 inch donuts in Hawaii, so it was a fun discovery for me!  We arrived at about 9am and the line was out the door, but it moved quickly since the workers are efficient, skilled, and friendly!  We easily found metered street parking right in the front of the shop on Carson Avenue.  I ran right in and was done before the meter maid caught me!  Oh yeah for "free parking"!  Donut Bar is a cozy place where the width of the shop showcases their eye-popping product.  There's a row of stools along the counter on the far wall if you want to dine there.    The colors, designs, and names of the donuts really intrigued me. It was so difficult to make a decision, but I finally settled on the Caramelized pineapple and the Coconut Dream. ..  I'm from the Aloha State and I haven't seen a pineapple donut before.  Mmm mmm... it was a delight!  The Coconut Dream was even better because it reminded me of a Mounds candy with a thin layer of chocolate between the donut and the coconut layer.  Yummy! Both donuts were $3 each. They did leave an oily spot on the wax paper that lined the box... and a bit of an oily feel in the mouth.  The donut itself seemed a bit denser and less cakey in texture.    I want to go back for the Mexican Hot Chocolate, creme brulee, chocolate bacon, and the Strawberry Split. .. (note: vegan options are available!)   I heard that there is a Donut Bar in San Diego. .. oh oh...here we come!

y7w1fs3f1CS69A1U1RUXSQ.text: Maybe it's because we came later in the day (around 11:30 am) that I wasn't really as impressed as I thought I would be because I had a limited selection.   The staff was super nice! She immediately welcomed us as soon as we walked in. We were staring at the menu for quite some time and she remained super helpful, offering descriptions and suggestions.    JUST AN FYI, just like most donut shops, they will run out of certain donuts so definitely show up early if you want a certain type that may be popular on their menu aka the creme brulee donut. But I don't regret what I got! I went with the red velvet donut and the db Nutella! The red velvet was not bad! It wasn't too sweet so it's not too overwhelming to be considered a meal on its own. The only thing was with the latter was that I felt as though there was too much bread with the donut to Nutella ratio but maybe because the donut itself was HUGE.   I've heard plenty of amazing things about the Donut Bar. Prior to their opening, they already had so much hype, so much talk of people lining up at their door. But personally, I thought they were OOOOKAY. Probably will give them another try when I'm in the area.

yJHXFOaZpHqPpVcVDg_utQ.text: So I've been here three times now and like a fine wine, it just keeps getting better with every passing day.  The Donut Bar has been killing it since day one here in Vegas, by staying True to classic fried delights of my childhood, but also upgrading a few of the sprinkled covered favorites. I've tried good portion of the offerings here, but the real standouts for me are the coconut covered donut, The Old fashioned, the peanut butter chocolate, the Pop-Tart donut, and a classic pink frosted donut simply dubbed, "The Homer".  Every bite is soft; flavor packed and melts in your mouth. The icing on all of these gorgeous bakery beauties is made in house along all the donut fillings, no store bought stuff here. This process of making in everything in-house really helps to keep the quality on point; three visits later and the donuts have the same mouthwatering consistency. I will keep traveling here for these amazing donuts all the way from Henderson which wasn't the case for O' Face, R.I.P. Sorry, but a dry donut that's lavender and lemon flavored just wasn't for me, especially when they cost close $6 a piece.   If you simply can't decide on what calorie bombs to order, just have the people behind the counter put together a half  for you, trust me it will be amazing. Don't forget the coffee, they have Stumptown Nitro Brew on tap along with chocolate and strawberry milk being tapped daily as well. That's enough right there to visit this place.   Donuts. Just do it!

0Hqwgi4XKo3uIygFGGnPRQ.text: Loved this little spot!  Went for lunch with a co-worker after seeing a photo of a donut from this place on unlokt. Apparently, it used to be O Face Donuts and looks the same inside. I never visited when it was O Face but I'm glad I did visit this time!  I went with the ginormous blueberry donut and it was delish! Co-worker went with the one stuffed with the Oreo cookie. I tried both and I think the Oreo stuffed one was a little better but any donut the size of the one I got gets bonus points for 'more to love.'   The guy who helped us was super friendly and told us we had to stop back in the morning to see their full display of goodies. By lunch time, they have a smaller selection remaining but I still felt like the 10-12 left were plenty to choose from. Also, at this time of day it was buy one, get one. I love a discount so that was huge for me.   Next time, I'll try the one with the pop tart inside. I punked out this visit because I was trying to eat slightly less than a zillion calories of possible but next time I'm going for the gusto!   Final thought: my donut was a little dry but the icing was great. As of my first visit, they didn't steal my heart for best donut in town. But I'm definitely going to give them another shot.   I say go give them a try!
