GjieT5ZBjljk6W5EfYdDEA.text: I went to the donut bar based on the yelp reviews  Sorry 18.00 gets you stale creme brulee donuts Stale coconut chocolate donut, stale maple bar. The two stars go to the bourbon caramel donut. The only fresh one in the bunch. Oh and the creme brulee is NOT creme brulee, its a cheap vanilla pudding and not even tasty vanilla pudding.  Not returning to spend that kind of money on garbage   I decided to drive out of the Las Vegas strip after reading the reviews. God was i wrong to trust. Either people were drunk when they came here or i arrived on an off day.

xoQsikSDWktc27seggWlnQ.text: Everyone jumped on the hype train when this place first opened and took over the old O Face Doughnuts location. My first run-in with Donut Bar was when I lived in San Diego in 2013. They were one of the first West Coast shops to try to emulate the cronut, which at the time, had just been invented by Dominique Ansel and was an overnight sensation. Donut Bar's Gaslamp location was very much like this one. There were huge lines that stretched out the door in the morning and they were often sold out by midday. In fact, I never did get to try one of their cronuts or "cro-bars," rather.   Flash forward three years and once again Donut Bar is the darling of the donut world and selling out on a daily basis by 1 pm. I've visited this location twice now (but really once because one time it was sold out), and I'm still unconvinced that the majority of these doughnuts are that spectacular. For the most part, the novelty is the large size, especially the Big Poppa Tart, but I felt sick trying to finish an entire one myself. This fact holds True for most of the other large, yeast doughnuts as well, all priced $3-4.  However, the one doughnut that I felt was unique enough to return here for was the creme brulee. The caramelized sugar topping has that deeply satisfying crack when broken in half and the filling flavor is completely on par with that of a vanilla creme brulee. It's advertised as vegan and also only $2.   Overall, I wasn't impressed by the size or price. The yeast donuts turned dense if you didn't get them fresh. But highlights include the can't miss creme brulee donuts and Stumptown coffee (which just so happens to be my favorite coffee).

photos.caption: Photo of Donut Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Big Poppa Tart

sZz_-P-Wa1sfNhPk96s_JA.text: Three stars for the very average tasting donuts. They're of the same quality as any supermarket bakery so I don't think they warrant the "world's best donut" title, which I was disappointed about. The prices are reasonable, and the staff did an excellent job at serving the line quickly. I can see it getting chaotic as the line grows in the small place but the staff manages it well. The actual space is cute with a nice courtyard outside for extra seating. I probably wouldn't stop here again as there are places that I've had better donuts but for the time being it was a fun place to stop.

GUK9QQE7JG-O0tB3PEl3rQ.text: Brought my daughter in today... very cool, modern place with donuts everywhere!  We had the strawberry cheesecake and the Nutella galore... so good!

feSbI15__st7-fWc789K5A.text: Finally tried bacon cinnamon roll it was amazing and totally worth the wait. Delicious donut flavors, amazing and friendly staff.

Wg0DnZD1s9XEJfiYxOqsJw.text: I've been waiting to try these donuts for the past month. Reading reviews after reviews and finally said today is the day. Packed my family up and headed over, paid for parking and walked in. Small space but loads of beautifully decorated donuts behind the case.  Kids got the free monster Inc donuts, I ordered the strawberry split and creme brulee, hubby ordered an apple fritter and the espresso donut. I also wanted to try the pop tart donut and a few extras. $25 later we are walking out happy to try these award winning donuts.  My first bite of the strawberry split underwhelming, I could taste old oil along with a flavorless donut. after sampling the rest of them my family came to the same conclusion, the old oil taste took over the flavor of all the donuts and we were very disappointed after waiting so long to try these.

wmWM4DwL5p_zEwePR6Px5w.text: The donuts are GREAT! They even give the kiddos free donuts certain days of the week. I still have yet to try the donut Icecream cones but looks so delicious when I see the pictures.

ZljEN09pTSceP7_4OxqTBg.text: This place was ok from all the reviews I thought it would have been different and omg my 13 year old son had the bourbon donut and I know they said the alcohol is burned out but oh man this donut had my son acting and feeling weird he was not his self at all but I won't ever go back it's ok nothing to brag about

mdAh3WTxIr32Vnp_2iP0MQ.text: Outta sight!! Finally was able to try this place, and at First Fridays no less, but I was amazed by the kitschy donut I bought. POP-TART DONUT is exactly what you think: tastes like a Pop-tart, looks like a Pop-tart, has a Pop-tart in it!! At $4, this is a massive donut and well worth the price. I recommend sharing, even though I didn't because I have a problem with not sharing donuts, but you certainly can share this and be satisfied. It's a strawberry-flavored tart inside and includes extra homemade strawberry jelly along with the hidden Pop-tart inside!! White frosting, colorful crumb topping, and strawberry drizzle included! Can't wait to try more of their donuts!

VvvTm5DRWXI4YSZL1iSeeA.text: I came to Vegas before I'm the weekend and kept missing out because they were sold out before noon each day. I tried the chocolate Twix donut. Thumbs up.  I tried the strawberry cheese cake- that one was amazing!. Everything looked awesome. You will not be disappointed.

2809Y2t8A_fji9DeWzafMg.text: My Fiance and I have been trying to get to this place for a while now, and today we got the chance to experience what we now think are the best donuts we have ever had. We are donut people and this place did not disappoint. We got there early, probably 5 minutes after they opened and they already had about 10 people ahead of us. The staff moved quick and were very friendly. The donuts were all fresh, and we were surprised at how big they all were. You certainly get your money's worth. I tried the French toast donut which is made to order, as well as the cake batter donut and they both were amazing! I think they both still would've been amazing even if I weren't 7 months pregnant lol. My fiance tried the "big poppa tart" and the lemon cheesecake. He was surely satisfied! We will definitely be back!

They had some of the their seasonal donuts and a few regulars left. We did have to take a bus out for this one. 02Gk241qRivJZR4YewjlPw.text: To be honest, I have had wayyyyyy better donuts.  Although the donuts here are cute, they are also on the dry side.  Wish I had a picture, but I'll my pics got deleted on my old phone.  If you decide to get a donut here, I would say the maple bacon is my favorite.

LJAy8Xf8XczFV57gsMAl6A.text: If you like donut places that run out of donuts at 915am, this is your place....make more donuts dummiez!!!!!

U0V9TDr_3W8wmmaRKlSnvQ.text: Hello, My name is Scott Bianchi, and I have a donut problem.        I'm a huge fan of the Donut Bar in San Diego. They have great donuts, they have great people. It's a good place. When I heard they were opening a store in Las Vegas, I was jealous of Las Vegas. They're supposed to open a store in Santa Clarita. However, when I suddenly planned a trip out to Las Vegas, I knew a stop here was primary on my list.      Saturday morning I woke up early. Having been to the San Diego location, I know there's a line a block and a half long Saturday mornings.  However, when my WAZE lady told me I had arrived at the Las Vegas store, there was no huge line. There wasn't even people out the door. It seemed fairly quiet. There was also a parking issue.       The lot directly across the street has signage all over it saying 'permit required' and 'we will tow your car' so when I parked in it initially, I was a bit concerned for my ride. I poked my head in the door of the Donut shop, and asked about it. The nice guy behind the counter said that the lot didn't belong to them, but there was free parking on sixth street on the weekend. So I ran back out, and relocated my car to the warm and fuzzy, safe free parking area just down the street. I then returned, knowing that I could sit for a lil while and have my ride be there when I left.      I entered the shop, and the familiar donuts smiled up at me from their case. They were holiday decorated even. I walked down the case and picked out four donuts.  I was going to stop at three, but then the rudolph donut just had to go along too. So, I paid for the four donuts (ended up at about twenty dollars) I then sat down to admire the donuts, and the fish tank from the fish tank tv show when I heard somebody order a french toast donut.     "French toast donut?" I asked, still composing my yelp photo.     "Yes, we have them on Saturdays and Sundays..."     "I loooove the french toast donuts. I want one."     "Excellent!"    I paid for a french toast donut, and sadly put the lid back onto the box of donuts I had. I sipped on the juice I had also paid for. After a lil while, another donut box was brought out. This one had a plate and containers inside. Atop the plate was a french toast donut. In the containers were toppings. One had maple butter, one had jam, and the third had maple syrup.       I've never been a syrup kinda guy, so I put that one aside. The butter I smeared on top of the donut, and the jam I also used. There was also a plastic fork and knife wrapped up in a napkin. I used them to surgically cut apart my breakfast and enjoy it as long as I could. It was good. After this french toast donut, I was actually pretty full. So I thanked the store for their tasty treats, and walked back to my car.           It turns out they're a just block away from old Fremont street. So knowing my car was in a safe spot, I spent several hours wandering the area. Lots of very neat things to see right around here. Including 'old' Las Vegas, and container park with their colossal mantis. (Just in case you're looking for things to do around here)     The four donuts actually went home with me. They were still tasty and fresh when I got home the following day.

g_Ruljgm-lfIgktA7HYiWg.text: What a beautiful donut shop- shop is an understatement. It's a glamorous display of gluten-laden deep-fried sugar-coated creatively crafted creations that just don't seem to be fairly priced! Those babies should cost at least 50% more!  The intense labor and attention to detail explains the wicked narrow window of when it is open... I empathize with the time demands and being a slave to crafting such treats, so it's cool to limit hours. Otherwise, they would sacrifice worker sanity, donut quality and artistic freedom to the confines of clock time.  Anyhow.... they have vegan donuts. I repeat, they have vegan donuts. Not the kind that you see and think, "oh, those are the vegan ones." Oh no, you wouldn't even care they are vegan or even know the difference, dear donut aficionados!  Though Judy there one day, of the 4 vegan choices, 3 looked amazingly divine, and all looked just like the rest! Strawberry split?! Apple fritter?! Creme brulee?! Who doesn't want those if you are going to eat a gluten-laden donut?!  Truly beautiful donuts! I also love that they have some esteemed coffee here to compliment the divine donuts. Stumptown, baby!  The line is long but worth the wait. Everyone is happy here- from staff to customers. The decor has an old-fashioned feeling to harken back to days when people didn't care about carbs as bad for the diet and brain? I love that they put your treats in an open box until they ring you up on the register.  A must try if you eat donuts with gluten- truly beautiful artistic creations. You'll be so happy!

kBAW61gnTWKDKN0zzTCEeA.text: Lost count how many times we've been here. Never disappoint. French toast donut lifer. Too bad this one doesn't have beer like the other.

dS8zjcaZ4i0kZpazPHfeMg.text: I guess you gotta have boobs to get options. Case in point, showed up this morning to have breakfast. Admittedly, we were running late and I knew I was risking what they'd have available. I love the French toast donut. By the time we walked in, I was told they'd sold out already. Fine, I get it. I ordered another donut and it was fine. But, as I turn around the corner, I see two young ladies being handed French toast donuts by the manager(?). I looked at it to make sure and he looks at me and said, "you should try one." My response: I just tried but was told you're sold out. He panicked cuz he knew he'd been caught and tried to cover his ass by saying they were out of the regular and the ladies were given the option of another version. Yeah? Where was my option? Oh, that's right, I don't have tits and wasn't offered the same options. And the cherry on top, we're local, which means I'll be telling my clients, whatever you do, don't go to the Donut Bar. Nice doing business with y'all.

yvABB-XAMiLOYQFjenhN_g.text: Donuts are delicious! We tried the big poppa tart, vanilla bean donut and the chocolate milk (which was amazing by the way). They also have pretty cute shirts and hats. If in the area, you should support this donut shop!

5gESr2jjp_CsTOzyERUFdQ.text: Best donuts Ive had in Las Vegas. Super fun and delicious. Unique flavors and helpful staff. No wait

_LrxHfsVj2qIDIXKVuZkkA.text: A little pricey but so worth it. Be sure to go super early because they sell out easy.

_vw9n4rY2rrTk3IhiCOPAQ.text: I would leave 5 stars if I could, but since my friend pre-ordered two dozen and picked up for me I cannot comment on the physical location or the staff. I can say that my friend had no issues placing his the order or picking it up in the morning.  Forgive me for not knowing exact amounts but there were a lot of the matcha green tea cake donuts, several blueberry lemon cake donuts, and some raspberry pistachio yeast donuts. I was most excited for the matcha donuts because I'm obsessed with matcha. This donut was an absolute success, it made the perfect cake donut. It was sweet but not overly so and the matcha flavor was prominent without being overbearing. I loved the texture of it as a cake donut, definitely could have eaten twenty more of these.  I then tried the raspberry pistachio yeast donut which was as big as my face. Seriously, the thing was HUGE! I'm generally not a fan of yeast donuts because they lack flavor, this yeast donut however had the perfect fluffy texture and was buttery. the raspberry pistachio icing was incredible as well, slightly tart but mostly sweet with subtle hints of pistachio. It melted in my mouth with each bite, I was sad but very full when it was all over.  I really want to go back to try their creme brulee donut, as well as any others they're offering. I'm reading reviews about their donuts being dry but I didn't have that experience at all. I think Donut Bar's donuts are way better than the donuts O-Face used to sell. I'm hoping when I can check out the physical location I can update my review to 5 stars.

TOrDS4bpsLdPy5V3EjFp_A.text: This place is okay, but not amazing. Surprisingly they still had a pretty large selection on a Saturday at 1pm. I've had the Creme brulee donut, the big poppa tart, Samoa, cheesecake, lemon blueberry, birthday cake, and the shortcake. None of them stood out as delicious, and the dough that they use for their donuts is too dense for me. Most of them were too sweet as well. If you come here, I just recommend getting the Creme brulee donut so you can record a video to make your friends jealous. The donut itself was overly sweet.

Evrq3KKx3MtlCqU41oaOxg.text: Wow....vegan donuts and the price is great. Usually the vegan donuts don't sell out, so go later and get them at half price. Creme brulee donut had vanilla inside and a toffee crunch topping. Pb&J needs no explanation....taste like the sandwich. We'll keep coming back. Oh...great drip coffee too!

bZbU94T27sso466qf3aRzQ.text: Tried their creme brulee donut, maple bacon donut, and crumb cake donut. All were as advertised! They even had a bogo deal so that made our donut experience that much sweeter. Only reason I'm marking off a star is because of their hours (they close at 1pm)... Sometimes I want a donut in the afternoon!

xj4sm2TsuJXqPlU8HdTDrA.text: Uhh . . . Portland (voodoo donuts) , we have a problem. These are amazing donuts. Strawberry stack, chocolate old fashioned, and creek brulee with a hard shell! The strawberries are delicious and the whipped creams is light and fluffy! The old fashioned do it itself is not sweet at all and has a crunchy outside and the chocolate is dark and slightly sweet. The creme brulee is amazing! The filling is a rich not-too-sweet custard. Wow!  I don't even like donuts, they tend to be too sweet. Huge fan!

pla_u0AsM94ZLLJGyp-N3g.text: I was surprised to see so many four and five star reviews for the Donut Bar.  I give it a solid three stars which is A-Ok.  I work within walking distance and deiced to give it a try this past Thursday.  The donut was okay but not near one of the best I've ever had.  The prices are crazy high for a single donut and I do not think you get a discount on a dozen.  I guess overpriced donuts are the current trend and people have no problem paying between $2 and $4 per donut.  I had a strawberry frosted donut at $3 and it was just okay and nothing special.  I think the Donut Bar opens a little late at 7:00 and misses the people that want to pickup donuts before going into the office.  I usually go to Real Donuts or Pink Box Donuts and both places are open very early.  I probably will not go back as I'm content with run of the mill donuts from the other places I listed above.    I will say the staff at the Donut Bar is very friendly and welcoming.  They greet eat each customer when arriving and offer to answer any questions.

IMbjUL2Hl2OBE2Xfadzh8Q.text: My boyfriend & I tried the famous Donut Bar on Saturday. It was great! Donuts were very sweet but good & moist! We tried the girl scout cookie, vanilla bean, red velvet & the cone. Location isn't convenient for me so I wanted to try/take multiple ones while I was there. Staff was super friendly & helpful.  Parking isn't the best but that's just how it is downtown.   Restaurant itself is small but super cute! There's also an outdoor area in the back to sit& eat.  I'll be back if in the area!

EYw_Yfu8X259ubMHhGZlLw.text: I heard about this place on Facebook, and wanted to check out the hype. I went here around 12:00 PM, and surprisingly, there was no line. The service was really good! Our cashier was very nice! He was very patient with me since this had been my first time.   The restroom and the restaurant layout is very nice! The restroom doesn't have a mirror just an FYI. The interior design around the restaurants suits it well.  The donuts weren't as good as I expected. I got the Creme Brulee donut which wasn't very good. It tasted cold because it had been left out throughout the morning. I thought it would be warm and fluffy, but it was cold and tasteless. I really did try to like it because I heard so many great things about this place! Maybe I went during the wrong time, but I am willing to give this place another chance (donut wise)!

7GGOaNu6sW_rWJMBGyJGoQ.text: They had a pop up store at Illumilatte so I decided to buy a bakers dozen for my office. Can I just say I was the hit of the office that day! Each donut was fun inventive and so so good! I will definitely be going back!

-pfSEzGmS4q7gc-sTdafNw.text: We came here around 12:30pm before closing. I didn't expect to buy leftover donuts but they were a great deal at the moment so we decided to fill the box up with $10. Half of the box were all creme brulee, the rest were weird unwanted assorted donuts. The donuts were cold, chewy and unappetizing. Maybe it was because we came late... I wasn't very happy but for the price, it was $1 per donut approximately. None of the donuts were that good, just taste like a regular mom and pop kind of place.   I also got a Nitro infused coffee because the guy recommended me as something new to try. Pricey and wasn't worth it. The coffee was SOUR! I'm not sure if it's supposed to taste that way... I mean if you really put your mind to it, you might find it drinkable. I'm a huge coffee lover and it hardly got me to finish half after an hour of walking around downtown.   BUT we will be back, earlier for fresher, warm, assorted donuts instead of leftovers! This place got potential and I will update the review with my next visit.

wEe76PvRmX--Vu94kYOscQ.text: If there was a great kaiju battle between Voodoo Doughnuts and The Doughnut Bar, the entire west coast would be deliciously destroyed. Thankfully these two places are far enough apart that we are safe (for now).  These doughnuts ARE art. They look as delicious as they taste. The signature creme brulee is truly a marvel and the maple bacon is poetry. When one dreams of doughnuts one dreams of The Doughnut Bar. Is this too over the top a review? I can't tell when I am under the influence of maple an and bacon.

Q3HIKtarU55wP1RCBnaNgQ.text: Was here for their 'soft' opening. The staff were really friendly, however when I arrived at 10 they already ran out of all (but 1!) of their vegan donuts! I ended up getting the Spiced Chai (which I was highly skeptical about)... But it was AMAZING. I hate chai tea and cake donuts... But the vegan Spiced Chai cake donut was yummy! I spoke with the manager and they didn't realize the demand for vegan donuts out here, and will be adding more once they open. Overall, very good but you do have to get there early for the best selection. Looking forward to trying more donuts from here... And I think this will be a very good replacement (possibly better) than O Face. I miss O Face donuts, so I'm hoping to get a chance to try the rest of their vegan donut flavors in the future.
